But beware, for an opponent landing on your cone will send you back to the start, and the eight spaces on the flippers, which lever into a central dumping well, will flip your cone out of the game permanently.

name: MÃ¤use verstecken
description:
In Mäuse verstecken ("Hiding Mice"), the players take turns hiding two (foam) mice somewhere on their body: in their fist, their knee, elbow, armpit or between their head and shoulder.

The other players have to guess where the mice are hidden. Each player may make two guesses. After all guesses have been made, the active player reveals where the mice are located, and points are scored. A player earns one point for each correct guess. If the location of a mouse has not been guessed by anyone, the player who hid the mouse scores one point. These points are recorded on the scoring track.

After each player has taken a turn hiding the mice, the player who is furthest ahead on the scoring track wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Bluffing, Children's Game

name: Deal-a-Dart
description:
Cardgame consisting of 69 playing cards and 3 instruction cards (English & Dutch), developed for dart players by (the dart brand) Bull's.

Rules include a introduction and full game, and offers variants for both.

All 62 dart board scoring areas are represented by individual cards, thus creating 3 suits: singles doubles and trebles.

On a player's turn, a player select an open or blind card, and either returns a card, or plays a shot. The amount on the card is subtracted from the players score, which (by agreement) can be 101, 201, or 301. To win a player had to hit exactly 0 with the last shot, AND the last card played should be a 'double'.

In the more advanced game the player is allowed to open as many 'pile' as he likes, but scores negative points for unfinished piles.

name: Monopoly: Bodensee
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Bodensee, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Expression
description:
Instead of forming the words with letters players forms sentences with the words randomly drawn from the bag.
There are also some joker-cards what can be used to be an any word.

Time is chosen by the participants and everybody starts to forming the sentences.

If time is over the scoring begins.
Each word (including the joker) earns you two points.
For each word taken from the bonus column: 1
If the player winning the bid is the current player: 3
If you have not used the joker: 6
If you used the 12 cards: 6

At the end of the game, whoever has the highest number of points wins.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Evergreen
description:
This edition aims at elder players and offers questions from the following categories:

Blue: Sport & Leisure
Pink: Health & Diet
Yellow: Travel & Regeneration
Brown: Personalities & Celebrities
Green: History & Politics
Orange: Culture

The rules follow the standard Trivial Pursuit games:

Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.

name: Grandfather's Whiskers
description:
British card game, described as a game and a puzzle.

Any number of players from two upwards can play. The cards are dealt round in the usual manner, faces (pictures) downwards. The players must not look at the face side of their cards. The player left of dealer leads and turns his or her top card face up in the centre of the table. Each player plays a card in turn Each successive card should be quickly played so that a "body" is fitted to the "Head" on the last card played. The title line "Grandfather's Whiskers" on the back of each card indicates the half containing a "body."

Lots of combinations of head and body will be created to the amusement of all the players, but when Grandfather's Head appears on Grandfather's Feet, players must call "Out" or "In". This is because his whiskers might be under the eiderdown on the card or poking out from under the eiderdown. The first player to call correctly takes all the cards in the centre. If a wrong call is made, that player must give every other player a card from his hand.

The objective is to be the last player with all the cards.

THE SIX JIG-TYPE PUZZLES
The backs of the cards comprise six different jig-type puzzles. The cards numbered from 1 to 8 constitute a quite simple puzzle, for the picture is formed merely by placing the cards in a certain order with their edges touching. In the second puzzle group (numbers 9 to 16) the cards overlap.
The remaining groups, numbers 17-24, 25-32, 33-40 and 41-48, become successively more difficult. The last group (41-48) in which Grandfather and his Whiskers are depicted, is the most advanced puzzle of the whole series.

name: Unlimited Nine
description:
User summary

A Japanese small-press card game about building a baseball team and then performing a match. The first part of the game is about recruiting team mates of which there are 27 unique ones; which are available and in which order varies. Each player has an attack value, a defence value, some special effect, how fast they run, where they hit the ball etc. In the second part, players use the team mates and the training cards they've collected to play out the baseball match; which includes comparing the different numbers and special powers on the team individuals, and using some hand management to play the right card at the right time.

Translated box back blurb:
Players of all colours and with next to superhuman powers amass on the field, the devil curbs swirve through the air and the baseball bats burst out in fire!!!
This is a game based on such baseball comics.
With all the quirky rules of baseball, and using the characters' special powers, you can taste the charm of pitching and hitting in an easy way.

It's time to PLAY BALL!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: County Championship
description:
Statistical cricket game from the inexhaustable Terry Goodchild, who has designed more sports games than you have had hot dinners.

This game rates every County Cricket side for two seasons, 1985 and 1986. Dice are used and checked against certain ratings of the teams. Very few dice rolls are needed to complete a match because this game was intended to be a game where you can play an entire season in an evening. I don't know how many games that would be, around 150 perhaps, so a routine sports simulation was not wanted.

name: Modern Armor: Miniatures Rules for AFV's of the Contemporary Era
description:
Modern Armor is a set of miniatures rules "based on U.S. Army doctrine and the combat experiences of the author." The information is based on unclassified 1976-77 data.
The game is set up to be used with 25mm or 1/76 scale vehicles, but 1/285 scale micro-mini tanks are just as easily accommodated with minor adjustments.
The game can use simultaneous movement with written orders, or a move/countermove system.
In addition to Armor, rules include Indirect Fire, Small-Arms Fire, Infantry, Morale, Smoke, Amphibious Capabilities, Repair and Recovery of Vehicles, Airborne Operations, Armed Helicopters, and Air Strikes.

name: Jurassik: Mini-expansion
description:
This small expansion to Jurassik provides support for a fifth player and adds eight cards: a new dinosaur (Macroplata), two eggs, and two recovery actions.

The first edition was bundled in Sherlock.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Mephisto
description:
Based on rules published by MindSports.nl:

Mephisto is a puzzle game played by virtually any number of players. It requires a double-six domino set, five uniquely distinguishable pawns, five corresponding dice, and a one-minute timer.

The playing area is made by laying all twenty-eight dominoes face up into rectangle of 7x8 squares. Other than the double-blank, no blanks can touch the edge of another blank. Pawns are set on any five of the blanks, dice are rolled, and the timer is flipped.

Players examine the board and call out bids. When the timer ends, the high bidder must move the pawns to spaces with a sum that meets the bid. (There is also a special bid for landing all five pawns on matching spaces.) Meeting the bid wins the stake. (The publisher suggests candy or beer, but scoring one point would suffice.) Failure pays an equal stake to every opponent!

Pawns move orthogonally the number of spaces indicated by their corresponding die. They are not allowed to cross the same space twice nor any occupied space.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Of Pride & Policy
description:
The people call out for Justice. We’ll give them Justice. They call out for Liberty and we’ll give them that too. We’ll give them everything that they call out for, exactly as we’ve designed. And in our magnanimity we will turn the ear of the King in our favor. That is when things really start to change. For once you’ve had the King’s ear, his eyes are sure to move too. Sooner or later, you may find that you’ve gotten hold of his whole head.

Our time is coming and if we have to swallow our pride and dance a dance for King and people while biding our time, then so be it. We have a vision for this land, and by the power invested in us, we will make it so.


Of Pride & Policy is a game of political maneuvering for 3-5 players. There are 4 sets of opposing political issues in the game each one with a color and symbol:

Expansionism Vs. Isolationism
Conservatism Vs. Liberalism
Industry Vs. Agriculture
Liberty Vs. Justice

The kingdom is divided into 5 regions: Galicia, Castilla, Madrid, Portugal and Andalucia. Each region is divided into 5 or 7 territories. Each territory will have particular concern in one of the eight political issues.

Each player represents a Noble family. At the start of the game players will have no particular stance on any of the issues; however, this will soon change. Players will influence both territories and legislation in order to advance in the Court of the King. All the while, the political state of the kingdom will change.

name: Western in My Pocket
description:
In Western in my Pocket, players take on the role of a heroic Sheriff in the old west. Take out the hideout of the Notorious Jones Gang before they rob the noon train!

Western in my Pocket started as a spinoff to Zombie in My Pocket.

Western in my Pocket is a Solitaire tile-laying adventure game set in the Old West. Players lay tiles beginning at the Sheriff's Office, and must find dynamite at the Survey Camp and get to the mine and blow it up before noon. While you're doing this, there are bandits around that will try and stop you. Western in my Pocket features a modular board, so no 2 games are ever the same.

There are also scenarios planned to expand upon the base game, and offer the player more fun in the Old West.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Pressure Putt Pro Golf
description:
Statistical replay game, designed to generate quick results, thus enabling a whole tournament to be played in an evening. In fact, in a week or so, a whole season could be replayed.

Dice rolls checked against charts determines successes or failures for the players, each player being rated in various skills.

The statistics are compiled for players on the U.S. Tour rather than the European one.

name: Fairplay by Spiel
description:
A community taboo word/word-category card is placed on the table (e.g., money or curse words), and each player gets a card of secret goal words. Points are claimed by catching opponents saying words featured on either the community card or a goal card.

Published in Fairplay magazine, issue 100.

name: Spies & Alibis
description:
"Spies & Alibis is a Co-operative Mystery Game.

We are a team of Special Unit Detectives working together to discover which of the Suspects has taken the Government’s Top Secrets. We have to do this before the Spies board the Airplane and get away."
(from the game box)

Tiles are randomly selected and turned over by players to reveal "eye witness cards", each of which shows an enlarged part of a suspect's face. The players must reveal enough tiles to properly rules out suspects and thereby deduce identity of the spies before the spies depart on the plane. Each time a tile is turned over, there is a chance that it will be a "time flies card" which hastens the planes departure. The game consists primarily of attempting to reveal as many eye witness cards as possible before revealing all 10 of the time flies cards, and then guessing as to the spies' identities.

name: Cheesed off!
description: Children's memory game where players need to slide down mice of different colors. Mice are covered by a little cap. If the color of the mice is the same as the sliding gate, they keep it as a point, otherwise is returned to the cheese board. The winner is the player who collects the most.

name: Beat the Best
description:
Think you know how many Queen songs your friend can name? Is your throwing aim better than other people might think? In this game, you need to make or beat the best predictions to score points and win.

Players receive challenges and their opponents must guess how well they will perform. If the performing player beats the highest guess, they score points. However, if they fail to be the highest guess, the player who guesses closest steals their points!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Humor, Party Game

name: REALISM
description:
Realism is a money-based board game which is easy to play at the basic level with a subtle form of competition where, unlike other money games, winners do not succeed at the expense of other players, so everyone can enjoy the game. A realistic game which makes players differentiate between needs and wants and encourages them to analyze their risk and limit their exposure.

The object of the game is to try to become a virtual millionaire by buying property, shares & other assets. The players have jobs, can invest, take out loans and buy insurance. During play there are personal and market events to cope with.

This game is particularly relevant in these difficult financial times, as it encourages individuals to think more deeply about the financial decisions they make.

The game is aimed at adults and the family and helps the players learn about investment and spot the difference between "good" debt and "bad" debt. While playing they can build up their income with good investments and try to avoid buying costly luxuries.

The winner is the player with the most net assets when play finishes.

name: Monopoly: Harz
description: The classic Monopoly with locations and other elements of the Harz mountains in northern Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Speyer
description: Monopoly set in Speyer, one of the oldest cities of Germany. All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hugs
description:
Everybody needs a hug now and again! In Hugs, by designer John Poniske, you are a member of a big family and you love everyone. So how do you show your love to the members of your family? By giving them a lot of hugs!

Each time you hug a family member, you earn points, and the objective is to earn the most HUG points possible. Of course, some members enjoy more hugs than others, and then there are SOME things you want to avoid hugging altogether. But will you be able to tell the difference?

Each turn, a player has one of four actions to choose per turn: To place one of their colored HUG counters, remove a family token from the board, peek at other tokens on the board, or draw a token from the "Token Pool" and place it face-down on the board.
Not all tokens are good to hug, and some family members are worth more points than others! When all pieces from each player have been placed, each counter is flipped over and the points are counted where their HUG counter connects with any character tokens.

A great little kids game that the whole family will love, give some HUGS to you and yours today!

name: Monopoly: Chemnitz
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Chemnitz, in Germany/Saxony.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Alien War
description:
2260

It is a time of war.

Over one hundred and fifty years ago, mankind began its relentless conquest of the stars. With the realization of infinite resources came infinite greed. What is the point of difficult compromise and drawn out negotiations when strength could gain anything a nation, corporation, or unaligned military force could desire? What need for a minority population to bend to the will of the majority when they could just as easily forge a nation of their own on a virgin world?

Human space is dominated by intense nationalism, rampant balkanization, and brutal competition. Only the Watch keep man from tipping into a new dark age and utter self destruction.

And man is not the only predator in space...


Alien War is a game of ground combat for 28mm (1/56 scale) models set in the year 2260. The rules are designed to give you an authentic feel for future warfare including unpredictable events – sudden rushes, explosions, ambushes, and malfunctioning weapons – that challenge your strategy and tactics as a tabletop general. The terrain can be as elaborate or as simple as you like; but the game is best played with lots of cover (buildings, trees, rocks, downed landing ships, etc). The playing area can represent anything from a futuristic cityscape to an alien forest to a Bug-infested hive!

Each player controls a Force that can be as small as a squad (6-15 models) up to a platoon or even a company in size (40-100 models or more). Some Forces may involve more models than others since they consist either of less skilled human troops (like colonial militia or poorly armed and trained conscripts) or aliens whose strength lies in their overwhelming numbers. As players become more experienced, they can control larger numbers of troops as well as vehicles and incorporate more advanced rules for future warfare. At its most basic size (squad level), a game of Alien War should take an hour or less to play.

name: Mad Barrington's Gyre
description:
In Mad Barrington's Gyre players compete to accumulate the shares worth the most bottle caps by the end of the game. "Why bottle caps?" Because in the post-apocalyptic future of flying castles, giant robber baron cockroaches and mutated broccoli.... bottle caps are the coin of the realm.

Each player starts with a identical set of cards and can play, buy or sell cards each turn that improve their deck's purchasing power or allow them to impact the value of shares (Guns, Ammo, Food, Water, Meds & Pennies) directly or indirectly through rumour cards or affecting the number of stock value cards in play.

Shares are bought and banked separately from each player's main deck but the stock value cards that determine the value of the shares are bought and sold from a common pool that is manipulated by the players throughout the game.

As well, each player has a character card that gives them a distinct bonus in the game ranging from Humbles Wuggles-Roach's ability to buy Ammo shares at a reduced rate to Lord Fat Pockets ' improved starting bottle caps and Mad Barrington's ability to buy rumour cards on the cheap.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Card Armies: Battle for Wesnoth
description:
Elvish archers are advancing through the forest, but you already have a line of loyal pikemen in place to hold them off while your mages drive the rebels out of the town. Suddenly word comes that your bowmen are falling back in disarray before the shadows rising out of the graveyard. With your reserves already stretched thin, you have only one chance to turn this around -- it's time to bring in the paladin.

Card Armies: Battle For Wesnoth is a strategy game. You control an army in the fantasy world of Wesnoth, and must combine planning, tactics, and luck to emerge victorious over your rivals. The game can be played as one-on-one battles, multi-player mayhem, cooperative campaigns, and even solo.

name: Mayhem Mines
description:
Mayhem Mines is a card game in which 2-4 players compete to collect the most treasure before tremors collapse the mine. The game takes between 10 and 25 minutes to play. In the game, players mine for treasure, sabotage other miners, and avoid traps and monsters such as the infamous Greedy Dragon!

Mayhem Mines is an incredibly simple card game with the objective being that at the end of the game, be the player that holds the most Treasure.

The game consists of of 4 types of cards.

Treasure Cards (Blue): These are what you are searching for! Have the most at the end of the game and you win!

Event Cards (Yellow): When you draw an event card its effect takes place immediately and you reveal the card and follow the text.

Actions Cards (Green): An action card is held in your hand until you wish to play it.

Tremor Cards (Red): Tremor cards are revealed and stay on the field.

The game is played by shuffling and dealing the entire deck of cards on to a play surface face down. Then on each of your turns you have two options, Search the Mine (pick up a card form the playing field), or Play an Action Card. Keep in mind, that some Actions Cards allow you to search as well!

This continues until 3 Tremors are caused by either revealing them in the mine or using the “Jack the Hammer” tremor causing card, the game ends immediately and a winner is determined. Add up the values of all your treasure cards. The player with the highest is crowned the winner.

name: 'Attack of the Boogeymen' Supplement (fan expansion for Last Night on Earth)
description:
'Attack of the Boogeymen' supplement is a fan created print and play for 'Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game' and features 5 classic horror character game cards.

These are made for fans to print and use in the game. They work just like normal Hero Cards in the game. NO profit is being made. Copyright to all respected parties.

Character Cards:
Ash Williams
Freddy Krueger
Jason Voorhees
Leatherface
Michael Myers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Horror, Mature / Adult

name: Operation Goodwood
description:
(from the editor website:)

Goodwood 1944 covers the British Offensive against the German Defense in the Caen sector. If Montgomery achieves its objectives, the Allies win the Battle of Normandy.

Goodwood 1944 is a game for two players, one player assumes the role of the commander of the German forces, and the other player assumes the role of the commander of the Commonwealth forces. The game map represents the areas over which the balle was actually fought. Each hex is 1 km across. It uses playing pieces that represent the actual military units that participated in the campaign. The German units represent companies and battalions. The British units are mostly battalions. Each turn represent 1 hour and half of real time.

Scale :
- 1 counter = company to battalion
- 1 hex = 1 km
- 1 turn = 1 hour and half

name: Monopoly: City of Lagos Edition
description: This edition of the ubiquitous property game takes its inspiration from Lagos, Nigeria's largest city. All of the Atlantic City landmarks from the original board game are replaced with Lagos locations. Boardwalk becomes Lagos' Banana Island, which is an artificial island with mansions and exclusive apartments. Mediterrranean Avenue, the cheapest property becomes Makoko, a waterfront slum of homes on stilts.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Columbia
description:
Back in the late 1700’s. Two North-American fur trading corporations compete to expand their routes: the Hudson’s Bay Company, based in London (represented by red trading post cards), and the North West Company of Montreal (represented by blue trading post cards). Players mount expeditions to establish trading posts and earn money by trading pelts.

Columbia is a fast-paced card-management, action-selection game. The game material is composed of cards (expedition cards and trading post cards, both relating to traps, barters, canoes and sales), cubes representing animals and furs (beaver, wolf and bear) and coins.

The game is divided into 13 turns. Each turn is divided into 3 phases. Each phase is performed simultaneously by all players.

The richest player at the end wins.
categories: Adventure, American West, Card Game, Exploration, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Trisq
description:
IntroductionTrisq is a drawless connection game for two players: Red and Blue. It's played with trapezium-shaped pieces on an initially empty square board. The top and bottom edges of the board are colored red; the left and right edges are colored blue. The recommended board sizes are between 6x6 and 9x9.

All pieces are the same and only differ in color. They can be placed in any orientation, but always with the front side up. Thus, when playing on a physical board, the back side of the pieces should be marked so as to distinguish it from the front side. A square can accommodate four pieces, and no piece can be placed in a way that makes this physically impossible.



DefinitionsTwo pieces are point adjacent if they share nothing more than a vertex, and edge adjacent if they share at least part of a side longer than a vertex.



PlayRed plays first, then turns alternate. On his turn, a player must place one or two pieces of his color on empty spaces of the board. On his first turn, Red can only place one stone.

At the end of a turn, for any two point adjacent, like-colored pieces there must be at least one like-colored piece edge adjacent to both.

Passing is not allowed. Players will always have a move available and must make one.

The game is won by the player who completes a chain of edge adjacent pieces of his color touching the two opposite board edges of his color. Draws are not possible.



AcknowledgementsThe featured placement restriction was first used in Corey Clark's Slither. Asymmetric, variable orientation cell division was first used in Mark Steere's Tripen.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: PrivÃ© de sens
description:
This adaptation of the Quebec show Privé de Sens showcases the creative genius, memory, insight and general culture of the players.

To win, you must also demonstrate a great complicity juggling with words, mime coping with stress, find the link between various clues ... These are some of the challenges that await you!

There are many mini-game that the 2 teams will play. For mini-game the teams will get points.

The mini-games are:

1- Au pied de la lettre: In this game the team receive 3 letters. One player from the opposite team will ask questions and the 3 letters will be part of the answers. You get one point per correct answer given within the time limit.

2- Passez-moi l'expression: One player from the playing team is designated to use a randomply chosen sentence with mimes and make his or her teammates guess songs, characters, ads, etc, on a list.

3- Mémoire d'éléphant: The 2 teams look for 10 seconds at a board with 9 pictures. After the 10 seconds, the images get covered and a player ask questions. The answers will be the pictures previously seen.

4- Ménage à trois: 2 players from a team try to make there other teammates guess a word by each saying a word. After correctly guessing up to 7 words the team must try to guess what link together these words for another point.

5- Des pieds et des mains: This is mime game where to opposing team choose a restriction to make it a little more difficult. (Ex : you must use an object with your mimes)

6- The final game: The team with the most point gets 1 minute to play this game and the team with the fewer points gets 45 secondes. The team look at a card with 8 words for 8 seconds and tries to memorise them. Then one player from the team take the card and say one word so the other players can guess one the word from the list. Each correct answer award you a point for the final game and the team with the most points for the final game win.

Having fun with the meaning of words is the goal of the game Privé de sens!

name: City of Gears: JUSTICE and MIGHT
description: The JUSTICE and MIGHT expansion increases the ability for players to directly attack one another through the use of new City Tile steam effects and Development abilities. It also adds new ways to earn victory points, even through a strategy of peace and diplomacy.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Eleven Point Black Tile
description:
Heart Family trick-taking using double-six dominoes played by 3-4 players. There are eight suits (0-6 and "doubles") and each domino belongs to two suits. The highest is always the double, followed by high number to low number (for example, the suit of 4s has the order 4-4, 4-6, 4-5, 4-3, 4-2, 4-1, 4-0). The suit of doubles has the order from 6-6 down to 0-0. Leader can decide which suit and other player must follow the suit.

There are 11 points in the game. Seven dominoes of the suit of 3s worth 1 point and 0-0 worth 4 points. The goal is to avoid them and keep your score low. There is "shoot the moon" option and you make all other player score 22 points if you are successful.

name: Monopoly: Puteaux
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Puteaux, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Agatha Christie: The Scoop
description: The Scoop is a VCR-based game in which players watch a 30 minute VHS tape and then solve a case based on different version of 8 different clues. The box claims that this difference in clues means you will never play the same game twice

name: Solsidan
description:
Are you thinking of a total makeover after watching the H&M swimsuit commercial? Are you so addicted to facebook that you must attend a twelve step program? Are you just as scared of the IRS as of hemorrhoids? Don't worry! You are not alone. You share these thoughts with the characters from "Solsidan" (a swedish sitcom) and probably with your friend, grandmother or neighbour.

Do you want to know more? Play the "Solsidan" game with friends and family to share issues, obsessions and megalomania. Be prepared to find out which of the "Solsidan" characters you resemble the most.

Read the statements and vote for one of the players. The winner is the player who know himself and his opponents the best.

Scary? The worst that can happen is that you gain some self knowledge or realizes that both you and your neighbour are pathologically fond of grills.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Worlds War One
description:
Worlds War One is a 2-5 player nation-building, resource managing, war game set in an alternate steampunk history where the first world war takes place in outer space! Each nation features unique strengths and weaknesses that players must learn to leverage in order to make the strategic and tactical decisions necessary to ensure victory. Victory points may be gained though activities such as trading, destroying an opponent's planet, or saving another player's forces from destruction. As it is never clear who the victor will be until the very end, tension builds and builds until a fast and furious finale - a no holds barred, guns blazing, fight to the bitter end!

GAMEPLAY

Each turn consists of 5 phases:
1. Discard (down to 10 cards)
2. Produce (planets produce resources of their color, draw 2 cards)
3. Trade (cards in hand, resources, etc., with other player(s), or 3 of the same color resource for 1 of any color to the bank)
4. Diplomacy (read: ATTACK!!!)
5. Industry (put into play Troops, Developments, and Planets)

A player wins the game by gaining 10 Victory Points, or by having the last surviving Homeworld. A player can win a victory point in one of five ways:
1. Destroy a planet
2. Trade with another player (Until player has 9 VP's, then no VP's for trading)
3. Defend a planet
4. Produce 10+ resources
5. Have 3+ unique colored planets in play

Each player begins as 1 of 5 homeworlds, following the Worlds War One theme:
1. Germania Prime
2. The British Trade Conglomerate
3. The United Planets of America
4. The Asiatic League of Interstellar Expansion
5. The Intergalactic Russian Empire
Each homeworld has unique troops, developments, handicaps, and strengths--know your history in order to dominate the future!
categories: Card Game, Economic, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, World War I
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: What? Girls Night Edition
description: Party game, What? Girls Night Edition, is a spin-off of the original What? party game. Made for girls only, this party game is great for large groups of people. A hilarious party game, your girlfriends will be guessing who could have possibly said what! Players answer three categories of questions: General, Fill In The Blank, and Sticky Situation. Girls can be as honest or as deceitful as they want, but the goal is to fool your friends so they can't guess your answer! Shock value anticipated as players give their most creative answers. Fun party game for bachelorette parties, girls night, pajama parties and any occasion where the girls can kick the boys out for a few giggles!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Cartoon
description:
A funny game about telling a good story. But you have to fulfill a couple of requirements. First of all your story has a certain theme and then has to end with a specific punchline.
You have a stock of handcards where you choose your cartoon and punchline from, so it matches the theme.
When everyone told there story, you have to choose what story you liked best, second and third.
And then there will be points for all the Players.

name: Give Me Five: Carte Promo
description:
Promotional card for Give Me Five with question about Paris.

Your teammates have five seconds to guess a word – but first you need to figure out the word to be guessed and how to clue them in to that same word.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Bohemian Schneider
description:
Bohemian Schneider is a trick-taking game in the Ace-Ten-family for two players played with a 32-card pack. Players are dealt six cards initially and after each trick, players draw another card.

The goal of the game is collect valuable point cards. There's no trump and no need to follow suit, and the only way the second player can win the trick is to play the next higher card of the suit led.

The game is over after the deck runs out, and the player with the most points wins the game. The cards have the typical point values for Ace-Ten games (Ace 11, Ten 10, King 4, Queen 3 and Jack 2 points), but the card ranking is the more usual AKQJT987, instead of ATKQJ987 that is used in Ace-Ten games. To win, player needs to collect 61 points.

Bohemian Schneider is similar to a German game Elfern, or Figurenspiel, in which the cards don't have the usual point values, but instead the honour cards are all worth one point and the goal is to collect 11 of the 20 honours, hence the name (Elfern means "making elevens").

(Source: The Penguin Book of Card Games by David Parlett)

name: Trickle
description:
Abstract strategy board game, similar to a reverse "chinese checkers" with shared pieces.

Players alternate moving one bead of the common pool from the center of the hex-hex board towards the border. They may do simple moves or jump other beads.

The end of the game is when all beads are on the border. The player with most beads on the border hexagons of his color wins.

The link of the game at the Game Crafter Website is: https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/trickle

For those willing to play test the game on a digital mobile device, Trickle is available on Android (completely free, includes ads): https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=air.com.trickl...

name: Turbo: Kratz die Kurve!
description:
Game description from the publisher:

On your marks, get set – scratch the curve!

In Turbo: Kratz die Kurve!, Turbo and his friends compete in a series of races. Nitro boosts your speed, but watch out for traces of oil on the track. Whoever reaches the finish line first wins the round, then everyone lines up on the starting line and off you go once again! Whoever wins the round can score quickly, and whoever first collect eight coins wins this turbo-charged racing game.
categories: Animals, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Pirate's Booty
description:
It is the Late 1600's in the Age of the Pirates, deep in the Swashbuckling heart of the Caribbean! Grab your friends and don your Pirate hat as you set forth as Captain on adventures across the hazardous Caribbean islands to Plunder Booty from the Rich Ports and Ships of the Spanish, English and French. Explore the Ancient Ruins of Lost civilizations and encounter the Native cultures and the secrets they hold! Square off against your friends as you set a Voyage for fun and BOOTY! For only the pirate with the most Booty will go down in history as the greatest scourge of the Age of Pirates!

The goal is to have the highest Plunder total of all the other players of either Ship, Ruin, Port or Native in order to take the Plunder. Cards can be played at any time, allow for fast paced rounds as you try to outfight your opponents.

The game contains 2 decks, the Pirate Deck and the Plunder Deck.
The Pirate Deck contains all the ships, sailors, treasures and tactics that you will use on your long journey. Many of these cards will go directly in play and will form the bulwark of your fleet on your voyage. These are called Voyage cards, they have defensive abilities that will protect you against your opponents machinations, or be powerful enough to steal or destroy your opponents Voyage Cards. The Voyage cards are also vital in that they have Plunder Total, the values you use to win the Plunder currently being fought over! Your other cards will be the action cards, one use cards that are swashbuckling tactics that are quick and efficient and will get the job done in a pinch.

The Plunder Deck is comprised of famous locations and vessels. They are divided into four different types, Ships, Ruins, Port and Native. These Plunder types tell you what values on the Pirate cards are necessary to win the booty! Some of the more valuable cards even provide bonuses that remains in effect for the rest of the game.

Game play is a divided up into voyages, where each captain will put forth a Plunder Card from the deck and fight back and forth to try and take the Plunder! The unique thing about this game is that once you put a card into play, another captain can immediately play one of their own cards to counter it. This is meant to keep the game quick and cut throat to force you to think on the fly!

Kickstarter Link
http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1640472770/pirates-booty...

name: Rooked!
description:
Rooked! is a Chess variant that changes the goal of the game. Instead of Checkmate, you have specific achievement you need to reach to win the game.

At the start of the game, each player draws five random achievement cards from their color deck. Each card has an achievement and a reward for completing that achievement. All game pieces move as normal and all rules are the same as Chess, though you no longer worry about check and checkmate. Your opponent also has five achievements, so you must be quick to complete yours before they complete theirs.
publishers: Menaveth Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: The Source
description:
It’s 1854 and a mysterious epidemic is sweeping through London Town. Only you know the crucial detail: the contaminant is in the water. Work together with your team to find the source well and shut down the pump before it’s too late…

The Source is a cooperative deduction game for 4 to 8 based on real events. Unlike traditional card games, The Source gets you and friends moving and turns the entire room into your playspace. It works great as an icebreaker at events or parties, and is suitable for most ages and all gaming abilities.

Gameplay

There are 8 wells and one of them contains Cholera. Unfortunately, there's only one way to find out which wells are clean and which one is contaminated: drink the water.
Every round players have 60 seconds to drink from four wells, or die from dehydration. After discussing with their teammates, players check their cards. If they drank from the tainted well, they immediately die. Communicate with your teammates, eliminate the clean wells, find the source, and win!

name: Unruly!
description:
Unruly! is a party card game for all ages, where the object is fairly simple, but the rules are constantly changing, and the laughter is infectious!

In theory, winning the game should be easy. You just have to play a complete sequence of 3 Thing Cards, but getting there isn't so simple.

There are several obstacles that can, and will, get in your way.

The rules change with every player’s turn - rules ranging from silly to downright hilarious! Breaking a rule comes with a Penalty. Players draw a Penalty roll, with the results ranging from losing just one card, to losing everything and having to start from scratch.

There are Event Cards like "Switch places with another player" or "Take a Hike" where everyone leaves their cards and moves over one place. These are great for messing with the other players.

And there are Unruly Cards, which players can use at any time, when they catch another player doing the behavior or action listed on the Card, forcing the other player to make a Penalty roll.

You’re kept on your toes 100% of the time. You always have something to do, even when it’s not your turn. Your plans and progress can change with the drop of a card or an errant scratch of your head.

Competition can be fierce, yet you’ll laugh so hard that everyone will feel like a winner!

name: Popeye's Treasure Map Game
description:
Object: To be the first player to reach his or her Treasure X near the center of the gameboard.

For 2 - 4 players

Ages 7 - 12

Contents: 24 cards, 4 playing pieces, spinner and gameboard

name: Yu
description:
Yu is an abstract strategy game. Players place their stones on the playing field, trying to occupy four adjacent spaces in a diamond shape. The first player who manages that is the winner.

Each player has 12 stones of his colour. On your turn you can either place up to 5 of your stones on an empty space or on a space with fewer opposing stones, or move any number of your stones from one space to an adjacent space that is either empty or contains fewer opposing stones.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement

name: Balloon Race
description:
Game appeared in the Postman Pat Annual for 1993.

A simple roll and move game for pre-school children.

Players are in an air race over Greendale. Move according to your die roll. If you land on the light blue spaces, you must obey the instructions. First to space 35, wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Playable Napoleonic Wargames
description:
Rulebook for miniature wargaming in the Napoleonic period from about 1792 up to 1815. The particular focus is on simulating the conflict of British and French armies in Spain and Portugal between 1807 and 1814.

The book comes with a complete set of wargame rules and campaign rules, including various options and a large campaign map.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Boccia: Auf dem Tisch
description: Each player has 4 disks. Players shoot their coloured disks, one at a time, at a black disc using a special device to do so. The player who is closest to the black disk scores one or multiple points. Points are scored in a 'jeu de boule' fashion.

name: National Parks and Monuments: The Colorado Plateau Challenge
description:
Race your family and friends to as many National Parks & Monuments as you can - Bryce Canyon, Zion, Mesa Verde, Grand Canyon, Arches and many more!
Along the way, discover the Parks and Monuments of the Four Corners region and the treasures they protect. Become a Ranger and challenge other players in this exciting game of strategy.

Every move is packed with fun and facts about the most famous destinations in the American Southwest. Great educational family fun.

name: Leaky Boat
description:
Your sail boat proudly cuts through the waters of the caribbean, carrying you closer to the many treasures marked on your old map. Suddenly you hear the dreadful sound of crashing wood. The razor-sharp reefs tore a menacing hole into the hull of your boat. But as a true salty sailor, there's no giving up! Can you find all the treasure while keeping your leaky boat afloat?

Leaky Boat is a real-time solitaire game (free to print n' play), where you are constantly up to your neck in watery peril. You frantically roll your dice to navigate through dangerous waters and to collect the riches buried on faraway islands. A unique sandtimer-mechanism simulates the treasure chests weighing you down and the salty waters continuously pouring into your boat as you struggle to stay afloat.

“Just a few big treasures and then I’ll stop” you say to yourself as you sail towards the horizon, your boat circled by hungry sharks…
categories: Dice, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play, Real-time

name: Metacell: Genesis â The Board Game
description:
In this abstract puzzle game you battle your opponents in an attempt to outwit them before they do the same to you. You do this by picking a random game piece from the bag and placing it on your side of the board in an attempt to make a match of 3 or more like pieces. Once a match has been made you take those matched pieces and place them on your opponent's side of the board trying really hard to mess their day up. The game is over and you are victorious once your opponent can not make any matches whatsoever...even if they tried really really hard or their side of the board is full.

To add some ball'n variation to the game there are different characters to play as; each with their own special ability that is triggered whenever that player makes a match of its color. There are also white game pieces and black game pieces that will help you and hinder your opponent when drawn.

There is also a 2v2 game mode.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition
publishers: Products for Robots, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: SwissIQ
description:
A game of questions, mainly based on Switzerland. Composed of 400 questions it covers a wide spectrum including, for example, the Vienna meeting of 1815, Facebook, or Swiss heroes.

Points are earned for every good answer and are showing your IQ. The player with the most IQ wins.

name: Mens erger je niet! Card Game
description:
Translated from the box:
Who collects two complete series of cards first? Use your Joker and Choice cards well and avoid being hit by your opponents.

Gameplay:
Start with 3 cards. Take a card, play a card. Collect series of 6 cards. Your Start card determines in which order to build the series: up, down or random. Close a series with a Home card.
You can hit on the last cards in an opponents series using Tease cards as long as that series isn't completed with a Home card.
Jokers can substitute any number card and can be exchanged for the right number in your turn and must be played again in the same turn.
Choice cards make you turn extra cards from the deck (as many as there are players). You get to choose first. Don't forget to end your turn with just 3 cards in hand. The other players have to fullfil that condition at their respective turns.

name: Monopoly: Thomas Cook edition
description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Thomas Cook travel company, located in the UK.

This special edition of Monopoly celebrates the growth of travel in the UK through the years.

Monopoly Overview
Players take the part of land owners, attempting to buy and then develop their land. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players. When times get tough, players may have to mortgage their properties to raise cash for fines, taxes and other misfortunes.

Game play
On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail.

Goal
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ligato
description: Two players strive to bring their six pieces from their "home rows" of a 6x10 board to the row furthest away; pieces can only move backward or forward, as many spaces as pieces are in the row of the board where the piece lies. A space can only be occupied by one piece.

name: BrainBox: My First Science
description: Players will have 10 seconds to study a card before being asked a question from the back, chosen by the roll of the die. If the question is answered correctly the card is kept, if not it is returned to the box. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins the game!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Trivia

name: Script-o-Gram
description:
Script-o-Gram is a word dice game with 13 cubes where players make words to score points.

It is similar to Spill and Spell and Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes, but has several differences:

Crossword play is forbidden, dice are not touched once cast, play is reminiscent of Boggle.

Scoring: per letter value, variations include one word scored or multiple words scored.

name: Khrysos Hunters: Ruins of Abetan Expansion
description:
Watch your step! The Ruins of Abetan are a treacherous labyrinth of steep cliffs and rickety bridges, but the fabulous Khrysos treasure inside is all that matters to the Khrysos Hunters.

Expand your hunt to up to six players with Khrysos Hunters: Ruins of Abetan Expansion, which includes ten new Hunters to make your team. Jump the gaps, but don't get pushed in!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Krigs-spelet, grundadt pÃ¥ BÃ¼lows nyare krigs-systems esprit
description: Game about military operations played on a grid with terrain drawn on. Units are brigades formed into three different armies for each player, plus Generals that are needed to activate units. There are also forts and magazines on the map. Tracing of supplies and communication are important to winning the game. The goal is to capture the opponent's main fort. Combat is deterministic, decided by having more units attacking or defending, modified by terrain, forts, or having elite units in the battle.

name: Raiders of the North
description:
Raiders of the North is sage of the EPIC SEA BATTLES between the British and German naval forces during Second World War.

It can be played as grand campaign game or individuals battles such as:

The Entire Strategic Campaign Game
The Breakout of the Bismarck
The Battle of the River Platte
The "Disguised" Commerce Raiders
The Death of the Scharnhorst
The Battle of the Barant's Sea
The Breakout of the Admiral Scheer

name: Spot it! Match & Learn
description:
Spot it! Match & Learn consists of two Spot it! games: Spot it! Numbers & Shapes and Spot it! Alphabet. Both games feature similar gameplay, with players trying to spot matches as quickly as possible.

Each card in Spot it! Numbers & Shapes features six different symbols, with their sizes varying from one card to another. Any two cards have exactly one symbol in common. To play, reveal one card, then another. Whoever spots the symbol in common on both cards claims the first card, then another card is revealed for players to search, and so on. Whoever has collected the most cards when the deck runs out wins!

Spot it! Alphabet plays similarly, but each card has eight items on it, thus making for a larger deck (55 cards vs. 31 cards) and more challenging play suitable for older players.

In addition to the base game, two additional games – each an observation game with a speed element – are included for each deck.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Curse of the Mummy's Tomb: In Search of Eternity
description:
Four additional characters for the board game Curse of the Mummys Tomb:

Doctor Chai Sen Fong
Idaho Smith
"Dodger" Fagin
Mycroft Lestrade


First published in White Dwarf, issue 102 and four new Citadel miniatures of the additional characters were advertised, which were available to purchase from Games Workshop mail order.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â The Collective Month 3 Organized Play Borg Cube and tokens
description:
Comes with the following for use with the "Battle of Sector 001" scenario as a part of Month 3 of "The Collective" organized play tournaments:

1 Borg Cube (ship) Token with unique stats
1 Borg Sphere (ship) Token with unique stats
1 Borg Control Token
1 Commendation Award Token
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Warfare in the Age of Madness
description:
From the publisher:

Warfare in the Age of Madness is a game of company-level battles in a dark near future. Designed for 15mm figures, opposing forces fight to survive by scavenging supply caches from the battlefield, stripping enemy casualties of their gear, and raiding the enemy field camp. Features include easy to learn rules, small armies of just a few dozen 15mm figures (about 10-12 elements/stands) and a few vehicles, and a flexible force creation system. Create a completely custom force representing anything from a former regular rifle company (and now your personal war band!) to a hardened civilian militia from your hometown. The game uses only standard 6-sided dice and can be played on the average dining room or kitchen table.

The game is available in electronic and hard copy formats. Players can use 'extra' 15mm figures they may have lying around or simply reuse miniatures they have for other games to create post apocalyptic warbands with minimal cash outlay. Players build customized forces and are able to tweak stats, weapons loadouts, morale and other factors to both optimize and personalize their force.

name: Kleine Musik-Macher
description:
Who wants to make some music with Sammy the squirrel? Kleine Musik-Macher, part of HABA's "My Very First Games" line, includes eight different games with simple rules that don't take long to play: Enjoy games of listening to bells, music memory, a musical dice race, games that require you to listen carefully, and cooperative games, as well as games with physical activity. The variety of game ideas, the four handbells, and the wonderfully illustrated game materials ensure hours of entertainment.

Music fosters linguistic and intellectual aptitude, as well as motor skills in children. In games and activities designed specifically for them, children are given the opportunity to experiment with sounds, beats and rhythms, and acquire essential skills while playing.

name: Crimebox: Paranormal
description: An expansion for Crimebox Investigation which contains new cards. But these cards are talking about strange things: zombies, sprits, ghosts... Investigators can enter in a paranormal universe in order to explain their stories.

name: Battle Bones
description:
A fantasy dice game where 2 or more players control the armies of Sorroah using the forbidden artefacts: the BattleBones.

BattleBones sees players take on the role of a CleroMancer one of the MageCaste who use ancient Artefacts of great power to control the armies of the land. Through the use of these BattleBones, warriors and heroes are summoned to the field of battle, where great battlelines are created with which to attack the enemy.

These BattleBones are represented by special engraved dice, each face showing one of the elements of the army:

Each turn players roll their dice and lay out their battlelines, placing the dice in the order they wish to play them. Dice are then compared in a rock-paper-scissors fashion with the winning dice able to continue the fight. The losing dice are killed and removed to the Graveyard.

It's a great little game suited to killing time between wargames, waiting for a table to come available at the club, or down the pub with your friends.

name: Jo & Jack
description:
Welcome to Grim City / town of quirky characters
It is very simple: Collect as many points in a same color, then you are well regarded.
Optimize your hand as soon as possible. If a player closes his hand, the fun is over!
Joker and Doubler help you while foreign Hi-Jacks poach in their own ranks and make seemingly safe points to nothing.
Turbulent, exciting and fast it goes on here - can you keep up?

excerpt of the official rules:
Each player receives 3 cards on hand. 3 more cards are placed side by side for all players on the table.
The remaining cards form a draw pile deck. The players try to collect as many points in a same suit (red, green or black).
During the game the player's hand can gradually optimized with the table cards. In each round, each player has exactly one of several possible actions.
Note: During the game each player always has 3 cards in hand and on the table are always 3 cards open.
The game is played over several singles matches. The player with the lowest result at the end of a single match, loses a credit (chip card is rotated accordingly).
The player is completely out of the game if he can not bring this stake.
Note: If several players at the same time have the lowest result (tied), each of these players lose a credit.







Willkommen in Grim-City / die Stadt der skurrilen Persönlichkeiten
Es ist ganz einfach: Sammle möglichst viele Punkte in einer gleichen Farbe, dann bist Du gut angesehen.
Optimiere Dein Blatt so schnell es geht. Macht ein Spieler dicht, ist Schluss mit lustig!
Joker und Doppler helfen Dir, während fremde Hi-Jacks in den eigenen Reihen wildern und sicher geglaubte Punkte zunichte machen.
Turbulent, spannend und schnell geht es hier zu - kannst Du mithalten?

Auszug des offiziellen Regelwerks:
Jeder Spieler erhält 3 Karten auf die Hand. 3 weitere Karten werden für alle Spieler offen nebeneinander auf den Tisch ausgelegt.
Die restlichen Karten bilden einen verdeckten Nachziehstapel.
Die Spieler versuchen möglichst viele Punkte in einer gleichen Spielfarbe zu sammeln (rot, grün oder schwarz).
Mit den ausliegenden Karten werden die eigenen Handkarten nach Bedarf im laufenden Spiel nach und nach
optimiert. Pro Runde hat jeder Spieler immer genau eine von mehreren möglichen Aktionen zur Verfügung.
Hinweis: Während des Spiels hat jeder Spieler immer 3 Karten auf der Hand und auf dem
Tisch liegen immer 3 Karten offen aus.
Das Spiel wird über mehrere Einzelspiele gespielt. Der Spieler mit dem schlechtesten Ergebnis eines
Einzelspiels verliert einen Credit (Chipkarte wird entsprechend gedreht). Der Spieler ist ganz aus dem
Spiel, wenn er diesen Einsatz nicht mehr bringen kann.
Hinweis: Haben mehrere Spieler zeitgleich das
schlechteste Ergebnis (punktgleich), verliert jeder dieser Spieler einen Credit.

name: Relic Knights: Cerci Speed Circuit Battle Box
description:
Cerci Speed Circuit is not just a race track, but an entire planet given over to the speed and thrill of the race. With the onset of the Darkspace Calamity, these risktakers and daredevils must learn to use their skills to defend the universe from destruction.

Featuring a playable force straight out of the box, mini-rulebook with complete game rules, an esper deck, and tons of tokens; this starter box is the perfect way to jump straight into the Relic Knights tabletop miniatures game!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Relic Knights: Shattered Sword Battle Box
description:
The paladins of the Shattered Sword have stood as a bulwark defending the Alliance for millenia. The Darkspace Calamity has seen this gallant organization spread thin throughout the stars in a bid to stem the encroaching chaos.

Featuring a playable force straight out of the box, mini-rulebook with complete game rules, an esper deck, and tons of tokens; this starter box is the perfect way to jump straight into the Relic Knights tabletop miniatures game!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Perspectives
description:
It's all about Perspective!!

Move the brightly colored Game Tiles around on the board to create one or more patterns from your “Perspective”. Solve your Pattern Cards even when it is not your turn but pay close attention and be quick so you do not miss out on a winning opportunity!

Match the Pattern Cards to patterns on the Game Board to earn points. Move Game Tiles to create new patterns and opportunities for more points. Score the most points from matched patterns to win Perspectives!

name: KÃ¶bes: Das Brauhausspiel
description:
Köbes is a board game for two to four players from 12 years of age. The game is played in the dining room of a typical Cologne brewery/pub. Players assume the role of Köbes, a waiter who serves Kölsch (name used to describe beer in Cologne and Bonn). Each Köbes is his own entrepreneur. He must bring as many Kölsch as possible to the tables of his guests, that he previously purchased at the bar from the host brewer. But it's not as simple as it sounds, as there are always many obstacles in the way.

The game bases its mechanics on the well known and loved game Mensch Ärger Dich Nicht, which uses dice to move around the board. In Köbes, players also use dice rolls to advance their Köbes around the brewery/pub, but are not limited to just the rolled dice numbers.

name: KaBlooey
description:
KaBlooey is a light-hearted party card game that pits player against player in a war for survival. Toss bombs, grenades and even nukes at each other in a bid to be the ultimate victor in this fast-paced game of bluffing and strategy for 3 to 8 players.

The object of KaBlooey is to destroy your opponents’ Bases by blowing the living hell out of them with bombs, grenades, and any weapons you can get your hands on! Each enemy has 3 lives (Bases) and if you’re the last Bomber standing with 1 or more Bases at the end of any turn - you WIN! But, there’s a twist: the cards you play don’t have to be actual bombs! You can bluff your way to military supremacy with a non-Bomb card to try and get your opponents to waste their valuable resources. War is hell, and all’s fair in love and KaBlooey!

name: Warage: Covo
description:
Expansion Set for Warage: Starter Set.

This expansion allows an even more balanced multiplayer match and gives more variety to deck building thanks to the new race and class cards.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Attack on Omaha Beach
description:
This is a game created for the 18 Microgame Contest!

Players: 1
Ages 13+
Time: 15-20 Minutes

Attack on Omaha Beach follows a squad of American soldiers landing on Omaha Beach June 6th 1944! Your goal is to move up the beach avoiding obstacles and mines, to eventually get to the Pillbox and destroy it!

The game consists of phases and turns. You have a demolition engineer and a sniper to help you reach the pillbox.

You must use your Demo Engineer to destroy barriers in your way but don't use all your 6 demo charges or you won't be able to destroy the pillbox and you will lose!

The sniper can help remove German machine gun nests that will attack you while in the open. Your sniper only has 6 shots so make them count, after that you will be shot every time you move in the open or side to side without sight restrictions.

You will lay out a 3x3 grid of Beach Terrain card to create the beach assault and as you progress up the beach you will create a new beach assault 3 more times until you get to the pillbox.

Here is the link to the WIP thread!
http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1275178/wip-attack-omaha-bea...

Here is the link to the 18 Card Microgame contest thread!
http://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/178832/item/3575479#item35...
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fleet: Arctic Bounty â Captain Mouse
description:
A new captain card that was from the Drive Thru Review Season 5 Kickstarter campaign

Text says:
Reveal the top boat card at the start of the Launch Boats Phase. If it is a $2 boat card, add it to Captain Mouse's fleet. If not, discard it.
During the auction phase, if the first card drawn is not a $2 boat card, draw one more. Captain Mouse will bid when you draw a $2 boat card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical

name: Die Maus: Reise durch Deutschland
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The mouse has packed her backpack for an adventurous journey through Germany! There are many exciting things to discover because each province has its own stories.

In Die Maus: Reise durch Deutschland, players help the mouse by traveling with her, working on a new route across Germany each turn and answering tricky questions about the exciting things that take place in each region of the country.

name: Mahou Shoujo: Fight Like a Girl!
description:
Mahou ShÅjo, meaning Magical Girl, is a turn-based paper card game based off the anime genre with the same name. Two players face off against each other in sparkling combat in order to defeat the other and capture their gems so that their rival cannot transform. Decks span from a number of themes including Nightmares, Daydreams, Sweets, Flowers, the Constellations, and even in the Internet. Playtime is under 20 minutes, which is more than enough time to show your rivals what true (sparkling) pain is.

The object of the game is score three of your rival's gems. Gems are gained when a RIval's Magical Girl's HP reaches zero. To do this, players using a series of spells and abilities (and sometimes a little roleplaying) must engage in battle. As battle is happening, Magical Girls have a limited supply of magic they are able to use. If their magic is drained to zero before their hit points are, they are safe from being defeated. Some Magical Girls will be able to become Grand Magical Girls, which are very powerful for only a short amount of time. The game ends to be short but action packed.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Unemployed Clowns
description: Unemployed Clowns is a game where each player portrays a Clown at the union waiting for a job. Utilizing variable player victory conditions, and a Mafia style deduction element, players will utilize card play to attempt to achieve or avoid work. Any number of players may win since they will have different victory conditions.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Calling All Turtles Card Game
description:
Based on the Nickelodeon Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle Series, up to 4 players are dealt an equal amount of cards and play cards similar to the classic card game "War", with a few caveats.

The highest number takes the cards. If you play a turtle that matches your headband the value is doubled. If a villain is played, you must find that villain's tile before the included sand timer expires. The villain tiles are placed randomly on one of three different boards that have been placed in different rooms. Lastly if, after the using the red filter decoder in the headbands, one of the cards has a pizza icon on it and someone shouts, "Pizza," they take the cards.

name: Mage Duel
description:
You and your Opponent have been rivals all through the Wizard Academy. It is now your final exam and the perfect opportunity to roast that guy once and for all. The first to deal 20 damage wins.

Like any wizard duel it is a battle of wits to see who will come out on top. Each player has a character card with special abilities and the same 6 spells, 2 defence, 2 offence and 2 utility. Players choose a spell from their hand and place it face down in front of them. Once both players have chosen, they turn them face up simultaneously and resolve the effects in Energy Number order.

However if both spells have the same Energy Number then they are cancelled. Too many cancelled spells in a round and the characters abilities come into play. First they punish, then they get desperate and desperate people can do almost anything.

link to the Work-in-Progress: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/19029697#19029697

name: A Conta da Copa Ã© Nossa!
description:
A Conta da Copa é Nossa! is a card game who pictures the process of building the infrastructure of Brazil's 2014 World Cup.

Each player represents a contractor which competes with other players to gain more profit and participation in the constructions. To achieve their goals, the players will have at their disposal a humorous deck of illustrated cards with politicians and characters which can help you with many tasks: gain favors, spoil the adversaries, work around difficult situations, among other things.

At the beginning, each player gets 20 cards of characters. Three piles are stocked at the center of the table: constructions, governors, and sponsors. After that, 8 construction cards, 1 governor and 2 sponsors are removed from their piles, and the players can use them, replacing the cards as they are used. There are material tokens that make constructions possible. They are obtained by using the characters and politicians cards.

Each construction sums points to a total, and the highest total wins the game.

name: Monts-Ã -Mots Gorgotte
description:
Translated from the back of the box:

Find the key hidden inside the caverns and free the knights from the claws of the dragon Gorgotte.

Answering questions will help you discover the hidden caches in the caves.

Use your weapons to combat the monsters and avoid being captured by the Dragon Gorgotte.

Find the keys and free your companion knights and win the game.

Mont a Mots Gorgotte was created with a simple idea in mind: Help young children in the first cycle of education to learn French in an original and playful way. Based on tested tools and expert teachers the family game Mont a Mots is designed to help your children. Offer your child Mont a Mots, a most entertaining tool to assist in the development of your child.

Basically you are a knight battling monsters while traveling around the game board. Caves along the way contain power ups (weapons and healing items) to assist you in your battles. However to obtain them, you must answer questions on cards. These questions are designed to improve your ability to speak and understand French.

The game comes with the box, instructions, game board, 275 questions, 5 cardboard knights, 5 pawn holders, 39 cardboard tokens and one d6.
mechanics: Memory, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Heimskringla
description:
Players play Vikings chieftains, seeking to develop their own territory.

Each player uses his own deck of cards (preconstructed or drafted). The deck includes Location, Unit and Treasure cards. Location and Unit cards are placed in the territory when played. Treasure cards provide an immediate effect and are then discarded.

Common Location cards are placed in the center of the table and
can be used by all players. Unit cards can use them to collect resources, become first player, gain Victory Points, launch Expeditions agains the other players, ...

At the beginning, the players only have their Patriarch. By expanding their territory with Location and Unit cards, they will be able to perform more actions. Playing cards and restoring Units requires resources and these are scarce as players compete for them.

At the end of the game, players tally their points: VP gained during the game plus 1 or 2 VP per card in their territory (2 if the Patriarch became King).

The player who won the most Victory Points wins the game.

The game box provides all components to play a 2 to 4-player game. It contains 20 rare cards out of 40.
Booster packs sold separately provide 16 common cards and 5 rare cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Find It, Say It For Children
description:
Βρες το Πες το για παιδιÎ¬ (Find It, Say It For Children) is a party game similar to Taboo.

You have to describe a word to your teammates without using some words written on your card in a specific time. If successful you gain the card and you start a new one if there is still time. The team with the most cards wins at the end of the game.

There are rules for 2 players as well.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: HappyNumbers
description: Work as a team to tell a funny and quirky story using the provided picture cards. Remember the numbers that appear in the pictures. Then test your memory and collect markers in the mini games. Once you’ve collected the required number of markers, you have to solve one last challenge: the master card.

name: Monopoly: Clearwater Marine Aquarium
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the theme park Clearwater Marine Aquarium
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Gromit Unleashed
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the organisation Gromit Unleashed, which raises funds for Wallace & Gromit’s Grand Appeal, the Bristol Children’s Hospital Charity. Bristol Children’s Hospita.l
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Chrysler Town & Country Road Trip Edition
description:
