A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Chrysler, a multinational car company.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Elf Elfen helfen
description:
Game no 3 in a Family of 7 games called "Die kleinen Feinen". There are only 10 Cards inlcuded - rules can be found on the website - or you can buy a set of cards with seperate printed rules sheet.
Cards are both sided and show nine (out of ten) colored elves and nine (out of ten) tools. Just one card is placed in the middle and players have to find the missing elf and the missing tool. Player who gets it right first will win a chip (not included in the game).

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â Sabotage Cards
description:
The Sabotage resource is the participation prize for the "Balance of Terror" episode Organized Play event. It costs 5 SP.

At the start of the game, you place 5 Mission tokens on your Sabotage card. These tokens can be spent once per round to either force your opponent to re-roll up to 2 attack or defense dice, or to force your opponent to roll 1 less attack or defense die.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Jake and the Never Land Pirates: Shipwreck Beach Treasure Hunt Game
description:
From the publisher:
Yo ho, let’s go! Captain Hook has buried pirate booty all over Shipwreck Beach. Flip over the gold doubloons and use Jake’s spyglass to decode the secret clues. When you get a match, get up and go! Snag the correct treasure with the foam sword and hurry back to score!

Promotes:
Matching
Memory
Physical Dexterity

name: Fast Words
description:
Fast Words is a very fast game to form words, where you have 8 letters and a theme, and have to decide a word that relates to the theme, using as many letters as possible and do it the first time.

A word about "something with a lot of hair" ... What you thought? Or another about something that "has holes."

A pile of theme cards is placed on the center of the table surrounded by 8 cards with one letter in each one. When showed the first theme card players have to find a word on the theme that have at least one of the showed letters. Who founds put his hand over the theme pile, say the word and takes all the letters contained in it. The rest of the players plays the same way until only one player has no said any word. Then, letters are replaced and a new theme is showed. Player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: The King's Armory: Artaxerxes the Jester
description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The King's Armory: Fairytale Expansion Set
description:
This expansion set contains:


The Sheriff of Nottingham Boss card.
4 Fairytale themed Reinforcement Cards (Puss in Boots, The Frog Prince, The Pied Piper and The Three Musketeers.)
1 Iron John Armory card
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Tintin Joker
description:
The game is comprised of seven sets of nine cards. Each set of the same colour includes five positive point cards (10 through 50), three negative point cards (-10 through -30) and one wild card (the joker). Each set contains images taken from a Tintin book (Coke en Stock, Le Crabe aux pinces d’or, Tintin au pays de l’or noir, Le Sceptre d’Ottokar, Le Secret de La Licorne, Le Temple du Soleil, and Tintin au Tibet).

'Tintin Joker' is a simple Rummy variant. The goal—collecting sets with as many positive points as one can at the end of each game while giving the maximum number of negative cards to your opponents. The first player to go out achieves a bonus.

name: Blind Mythos
description: Blind Mythos is a cooperative game with eight scenarios in which players try to collect banned materials during play to resolve the situation presented in the scenario.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Cars 2: Pictureka!
description:
From the back of the box:

Join the stars of Cars 2 in 4 cool card games!

• Race to spot pics and get rid of your cards.
• Speed through the alphabet to find pics.
• Test your memory with a matching game.
• Combine cards to complete missions.

Start your engines! It's time for Pictureka Cars 2!

Four games included:
8-Away
Alphabetti
Matchureka
Pass the Pics

name: Bugle
description: Bugle (ãã¥ã¼ã°ã«) is a two-player only game of goblins vs. dwarves, with the two armies competing on a small battlefield and with the bugles determining in which directions an army can move on the subsequent turn.

name: codingFarmers
description:
The core of codingFarmers is a standard roll-and-move race. However, instead of simply moving the distance rolled, you choose one of two code cards you draw and obey its instructions. Most cards refer to the die roll you made and will move you. Advanced cards involve simple loops and conditionals. The cards are expressed in Java code, so the act of deciding which of the two cards to use requires you to parse simple Java. The board has features (trees, rivers, rocks, etc) that have a normal meaning, and which can be referred to by conditional cards.

From the back of the box:

codingFarmers is the first ever board game to introduce kids to real programming. It is created exclusively by three high school students (Kikhil, Vineet and Anika) who are very passionate about programming and wanted to spread the awareness among kids. In this game, you are the coding farmer. After a long day at work, you decide to race to the barn with your friends. Since you code, your tractors operate on code cards. You have to strategically decode and use the correct set of cards to reach the bard first. This game provides two sets of cards. Action cards have instructions in English as well as Java code. code cards have instructions only in Java code.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: FÃ¡bulas FantÃ¡sticas
description:
Fábulas Fantásticas é um jogo de storytelling, isto é, através das imagens contidas nas cartas, os jogadores se unem para contar e criar uma história pra lá de fantástica.

O jogo é formado por um baralho de 54 cartas dividido em 3 tipos: Persona, que define o protagonista e os coadjuvantes da cena, Locações, que define o cenário onde a cena ocorre, e Acessórios, itens que trazem o conflito motivador da cena.


Fantastic Fables is a storytelling game, that is, through the images contained on cards, players come together to tell a story even more fantastic.

The game uses a deck of 54 cards, divided into 3 types: Persona, defining the protagonist and the supporting cast, Locations,which sets the local where the scene takes place, and Accessories, items that trigger the conflict scene.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Humor

name: O Gangster de Retrocity
description:
During the Depression, the streets of Retrocity were controlled by the iron hand of Don Picolotto ... But he died. Now, four families are fighting each other to control the organized crime in the city.

O Gângster de Retrocity is a competitive game for 2-4 players where each one assumes the role of a mafia boss that seeks to dominate the crime of Retrocity.

Only one player can become the big boss and to achieve this goal, each player must create a strategy by joining board movement, card's special effect and attacks on their rivals.

The game uses modular boards, which allows the city to have a different setting every new play.

The deck of 60 cards is divided in three types: Action, Equipment and Building. All cards have a special effect and Action and Equipment cards can be used in combat against a rival.

The length of a game is 30 to 60 minutes and as players become accustomed to the rules, the game becomes increasingly wild!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Babylon
description:
In Babylon, you have to assemble a soma cube as quickly as possible, but with a twist:
Which pieces you get is determined by chance.

There are nine building blocks available, two of which will be removed with the start of the game depending on the dice roll.

name: Gimatriks
description: Tile laying game. Each tile has a letter and a value. A = 1 ... Z = 800. Tiles are laid scrabble fashion onto the playing surface to create words and match values.

name: Devino
description: Be the first to discover the answer to a question whose letters are contained in the last word.

name: Fireball! Fireball! Fireball!
description:
"Fireball! Fireball! Fireball!" is a light card game of magic mischief.
Mages hurl spells at each other in an attempt to defeat their opponent with superior spell casting.
With their lightning reflexes, seconds feel like minutes - making them able to block incoming attacks with their own spells.

All players starts with three Fireball cards and get to choose two cards each from one of the eight different Schools of Magic.
Each turn consists of three moves.
A move can either be to draw a card or to play a card.
When an opponent plays a card against you, you can attemt to block the with your own cards.
The objective is to get all other players down to 0 health, kept track of on a health card.

Features 35 distinct playing cards, at a total of 68 cards in the deck.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombie Farkle
description:
Well, it was bound to happen sooner or later; and now the zombie apocalypse is here. But never fear humanity, heroes have emerged to save us all! Ninjas, robots, pirates, monkeys, and aliens are here to defeat the zombie hordes and restore order. All they need is a little bit of your help.

Zombie Farkle is a press-your-luck dice rolling game that is fun for the entire family. Each game consist of 6 custom etched and color filled dice in a custom printed dice bag so you can take it with you anywhere.

The object of the game is to destroy as many zombies as possible by rolling combinations of dice. You can score the points you earn, or push your luck further for a greater payout. But remember, if you get too reckless, the zombies will eat your brains.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Thunderbirds Trivia Game
description: Thunderbirds Trivia Game is a quiz board game. The players moves around the game board answering questions about each of the TV series Thunderbirds episodes. The questions comes from cards, that contain images and questions from all episodes. The player that first answer six questions right is the winner.

name: Angels vs Devils
description:
Angels vs Devils is a party/social deduction cardgame for 3-6 players where players can pick which team they're on, try to detect who's not and score points depending on their choices.

Each round players secretly select the team they'll be on - Angel or Devil - or join the neutral team - but switching straight from Angel to Devil is not allowed, which should sow some doubt.

Then players decide to let "the mission" succeed or fail. Devil players can play blue "succeed" mission cards to avoid suspicion and Angel players can play red "fail" mission ones to draw suspicion.

Players each then select who they think joined the Devil team.

Angels score if the mission succeeds, they managed to select a Devil or if they successfully drew suspicion upon themselves.

Devil players score if the mission failed and if they avoided suspicion.

Neutral players always score, but only 1 measly point.

First to an agreed number of points or most points after x rounds played wins.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Monopoly: World Football Stars
description: Do you have what it takes to be a football legend? Prove that you are the world's number one with the World Football Stars edition of Monopoly. Challenge friends and opponents to bidding wars for your favourite players from the world of football including Messi, Rooney and Neymar Jr! So what are you waiting for, reach for glory and become the football Monopoly champion!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tag Team: Woodland Park Guerrillas vs. Back Alley Gators
description:
These days it's not enough to be the toughest crew on the streets; you need to make sure everyone knows it, too. Bring enough cans of spray paint to tag walls all over town, and enough muscle to make sure no one else does. There's nothing quite as satisfying as watching little punks drop their spray cans and run at the very sight of you — just make sure that there isn't someone even bigger right around the corner!

In Tag Team, you play as a crew of Eagles, Bulldogs, Alligators or Gorillas, defending your turf by bluffing your way through battles each day. Players simultaneously reveal their leader characters, and, if nobody backs down, their backup characters join the fight. The winner tags their opponent's territory as a reward. In the end, the crew with the most tagged territory wins.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: City Express
description:
All aboard! If you want to set off on your journey, you have to find 8 passengers and then the driver, quickly! Will you be the first to fill your train?
In this pick up and deliver game, players will try to fulfill their 6 wagons with corresponding passengers by picking them up along train tracks.
On their turn, a player picks a new passenger randomly from the passenger bag and puts it on the board. Then this player moves their train along train track by choosing one color track. They can ride along this track and pick up a passenger if corresponding to a needed color. Or They can stop in a train station and change track on their next turn.
First player to collect 6 passenger win the game.

name: 221B: A Story Driven Detective Game
description:
description from designer:

It was a fine evening as I was sitting comfortably in my chair sipping Mrs. Hudson's remarkable tea. Holmes was walking heavily around the room, complaining quite arrogantly about the lack of crime in this world.

Have you thought of my Christmas gift yet?' I asked him politely, interrupting his rather disturbing topic. 'No' he said as he looked down the window. 'But it looks like i'm getting mine early this year.' Few moments later we heard a knock on our door. 'If i don't open, will turn back and come later?' he asked. 'Certainly not, considering the situation i am in.' said a voice from outside. 'Good' said Holmes, 'Then do come in, it's open.

Lestrade walked in with a look of quite serious anxiety on his face.

221B is a paragraph card game, where you control the duo of Sherlock Holmes and Dr. John Watson to solve interesting cases in Victorian London. In this game, you may travel to different locations and deduce information from different suspects, the way they talk, the way they dress. Conduct experiments on important pieces of evidences, research crucial information and solve the case before time runs out.

Inspired from games like Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective and T.I.M.E Stories, the game consists of a base game deck of basic locations. I will upload with that several case decks where each case will have story cards and other cards to mix with the base deck. Sherlock Holmes and John Watson will have different actions like travelling, interrogating, examining they can do each turn.

Within a few turns the game will end. You can check your theory and accuse suspects. If you are right you win. But if wrong, you can chose to play the case again. Each game plays in roughly around 40 minutes.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based, Print & Play
mechanics: Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Geo Facts
description:
Description from the publisher:

Geo Facts is an entertaining, instructive and easily transportable guessing game for 2-6 players, aged 12 years and up, with a playing time of approximately 30 minutes.

Is Mount Blanc actually higher than Mount Vinson in Antarctica? And how far is the distance from K2 to Mount Everest? When was the first ascent to the top of Mount Kilimanjaro? How far must you descend from the Matterhorn to get to the next-highest mountain? Which is longer: the Nile or the Amazon? And which of these two rivers has a larger drainage basin? Which lake has the largest volume world-wide and which one is the deepest? These and other questions about the world's major mountains, rivers and lakes have to be estimated in the 12 categories of Geo Facts.

By using different jokers, additional excitement, entertainment and tactics come into play. Another special feature of Geo Facts is its internationality. Via translations of all terms into five languages, global topics and the frequent use of symbols, Geo Facts overcomes the usual focus of quiz games on just one language and culture. Moreover, the game cards contain impressive photographs of different landscapes.

name: Ritjakten
description:
Ritjakten - A game of drawing and guessing for the whole family.

Adults draw words for everyone to guess, while children instead choose from illustrated cards to copy.

The player that first guesses what's being drawn wins tickets (required to move unhindered on the game board) while the drawer gets to move forward on the circus themed game board. First to the finish line wins the game.

name: Autodrop
description: Autodrop is fun game named after famous Dutch candy. It's a simple but fun game where all players race their way to the finish with real candy. Up to four players choose 5 candies they will use as their pawns and with a dice they move forward on the game board. On the way players eat, switch, jump and fight to master the first place so they can eventually finish first! Can you win this race frenzy?!

name: The Front Nine: Slow Play
description: The Front Nine: Slow Play is a single promotional card for The Front Nine that features a poorly-driving zombie. Designer Nick Case notes, "This will be the last offering for The Front Nine game."

name: Mille Bornes: Edition spÃ©ciale SÃ©curitÃ© RoutiÃ¨re
description:
Small version of the old french classic game given for free during 2016 summer holidays on french highways. This was for educate drivers on road safety.

Only 32 cards in this version:
16 mileage cards
4 dump hazard cards (1 classic - red light - and 3 specifics for this version: Alcohol, Phone call, no motorcycle equipment)
8 remedy hazard cards (green light, negative ethylotest, end the call, motorcycle equipment)
4 safety cards (emergency vehicle, SAM - the guy who drives don't drink, hands free kit, full equipment and airbag

Other changes from the usual rules of the game:
The goal is to reach 500 km
No need of a green light at first before playing mileage cards

name: Martin Luther: Das Quiz
description:
Description from the publisher:

Where are the Ten Commandments? With whom was the life story of the Reformer filmed? What did he call his wife? And how many theses were there actually? Martin Luther: Das Quiz is a trivia game centered around the reformer Martin Luther, the Bible, and films on the subject.

name: Thinko
description:
Gameplay overview:
Players become explorers that must turn a day-to-day object into 5 different uses under a minute for the place chosen in every round.

RULES ABOUT THE OBJECTS:
- The object can adopt any size – be it tiny or huge- and be changed to any material.
- You must not break or change its structure: a bottle cannot be cut in half to have it transformed into a flower pot.
- An object of the likes of “ball” or “balloon” may be inflated or deflated, this doesn’t change its structure.

Example: What can a toothbrush at a camping be used for?
How can you use a toothbrush at a camping?

A player answer:
- Fix the tents.
- Marker of the plot number.
- A floater (gigantic plastic toothbrush).
- Kids slide.
- Dog toy.

Your goal is to become the more creative and win more points to be the first with 40 points scored.

SCORING:
You get 1 point for each use that someone else had written down as well. 2 points are scores for each unique use.
You can get 1 point subtracted if your repeat a use from previous rounds during the same game or if the actual structure of the object is cut up or modified in any shape or form.

CONTENT
20 scene cards
45 item tokens
1 hourglass
1 board
6 player tokens
Rules (Español, Catalán, Euskera, Galego, English)

name: Â¿QuÃ© sabÃ©s de tu Pareja?
description:
Couples are challenged to answer about their life, preferences and personal choices, while trying to guess the answers of your couple.

It's divided in 3 rounds, the first round has simple Yes/No questions, the second round you have to choose between two options and on the last round there are hypothetical situations and you should choose what you would do. In all three rounds there are different questions for each gender.

After the three rounds of questions have ended, it's time of reviewing the answers. Each couple scores a point for each match in their answers. The couple with the most points wins the game.

name: Monopoly: Osaka Loop Line Edition
description:
This Monopoly game is developed based on the Osaka Loop Line.

Theme
Players take the part of land owners, attempting to buy and then develop their land. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players. When times get tough, players may have to mortgage their properties to raise cash for fines, taxes and other misfortunes.

Gameplay
On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail.

Goal
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Chicken Wings: Glow in the Dark
description:
The chickens are becoming more and more inventive and are now ready to attempt to break out at night since they now glow in the dark.

Chicken Wings: Glow in the Dark is a new version of Chicken Wings that includes new tiles for more fun.

name: El Juego del Rico Rico
description:
El Juego del Rico Rico is a card game in which you have to be the first player who complete a cooking recipe.

Each player has one card with a 5 ingredients recipe, and 5 more cards with one ingredient each.

They will have to change their ingredient cards until they have the matching ones. Whoever does it first, wins.

name: Mauseschlau & BÃ¤renstark: Rund um die Natur
description:
From the publisher

A memorabilia and collecting game with mouse squeaky and bearish actions!

With Mauseschlau & Bärenstark It's in the nature! There the players learn local animals, flowers, tree and berry fruits. In addition, they can show how well they can represent animals and imitate animal voices. If you also show some skill in gyros and a good memory, the first to collect 6 picture cards and win

name: The Red Dragon Inn: 2016 SlugCrew Minor Reward
description:
Adds 3 drinks to the drink deck.

Golden Stout (also appears in The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox Collector's edition)
Prognosticating Punch (also appears in The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox Collector's edition)
Timewarp Tonic (also appears in The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Cards Against Profanity
description: The family-friendly game Cards Against Profanity takes the popular adult party game and gives you a fun and wholesome experience that even your kids and their friends can enjoy. Designed for ages 8+, Cards Against Profanity has 75 quirky question cards and 425 funny answer cards. Each round, the "ruler" deals the players eight white answer cards, then flips over one orange question card. Players then place one of their white cards face-down. The ruler then selects the best answer!

name: WÄdrÃ³wki miÄdzy WisÅÄ a Kampinosem
description:
This is a family educational game designed for 2-4 people from the age of 8 years of age It consists in incarnating the role of a tourist who visits the 10 municipalities belonging to the Local Action Group "Between the Vistula and Kampinos." Along the way, players visit, among others, nature reserves, monuments, more or less known places, earning points and knowledgeable about the area. While wandering tourists should avoid encounters with moose and try not to disturb other visitors in exploring the beautiful countryside. The game has three difficulty options, so that pleases both the younger and older players.

On his turn player have to choose one of three actions.

First action "Gathering information" is the move and taking the one card. First move to the neighboring region is for free. For the next player have to pay in "footer". To each region one card is assignment. Card which is taken have to be hold in hands.
Second possible actions "Sightseeing" allow player to move and play cards from the hand on the table. The cards on the table will score the points at the end of the game. During this action only card from from the region where player end the move can be played.
The third action "Rest" allow player to simply take three "footer".


The cards score in five categories. The more cards you have in each categories the more point you have.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Ninja All-Stars: Onibaba
description:
Onibaba is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

As a mortal, Onibaba would lure stragglers from battles into her traps, finish them off, and sell their possessions. One night, however, she pulled a finely crafted mask from a dark and terrible samurai, and slipped it on over her face. In that instant, the dark power from within the mask touched the festering rot in her soul and consumer her. Soon the mortal hag was gone, replaced by an ageless, devouring horror that has stalked Kagejima’s places of slaughter ever since.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Stealthy, Ruthless Scavenger Ronin
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: Challenge Austria
description:
Description from the publisher:

Austria in all its facets is at the center of Challenge Austria. From landscape to music, history to sport, one should not only have their red-white-red knowledge up to date, but also be ready to shine in their negotiation skills since questions are not only answered, but also bought and exchanged. During the game, players have a number of question cards in their possession and can answer only those about Austria as a whole and those about the region of the country in which their game figure is currently located. Thus, you might want to trade cards with others, offer them cash, move to new locations, or pay to return cards that are too difficult to answer. Too pay too much, though, for in the end the first player to collect a previously agreed upon sum of money wins the game.

name: Dust Tactics: Panzerkamplaufer II-F â "Loth (Troop)"
description: The tropical version of this walker is very common in the Axis army today. The Loth can provide invaluable services on the battlefield, in support of other walkers or heavy infantry. Thanks to its improved open chassis, this walker can now be found all over the world, anywhere the Axis fights. Perfectly suited to desert environments, it's now a NDAK staple.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Garimpeiro
description:
"El Dorado discovered in Estado de Para!"

With the discovery of a large gold deposit, Brazil erupted into a frenzied gold rush. Over ten thousand workers swarmed to become garimpeiro (gold prospectors in Portuguese) and make their millions. The greed filled desires of the garimpeiro and their patrons bored deep holes into the earth like an inverted pyramid, and the once lush jungles were quickly stripped naked, giving the name of Serra Pelada to the dig site - "the Naked Mountain".

In Garimpeiro, each player becomes a patron of the garimpeiro (gold prospectors) who will lead them to seek fame and gold ore through various actions, in order to become the greatest man or woman in Serra Pelada. It is a full-fledged worker placement game that simulates the excitement of gold prospecting.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: LA BISTRO
description:
Description from the publisher:

In LA BISTRO each player starts with a small stake that they use to build up their restaurant and then with profits decide how much to invest further, either in improvements to counter what the opposition are doing or to create a second restaurant.

Simultaneous actions to take in this game:

Choose a building in one of six different types of neighborhoods to site your place.
Decide from one of eight types of cuisine.
Set your prices.
Hire kitchen staff to improve your food quality.
Hire wait staff to improve your level of service.
Renovate your space to improve your ambiance.
Advertise so that people know about you.


Do these in any order you like, but do them better than everyone else, and quickly! Before you know it the first customers will be rolling in!

Features many details of the restaurant business including differing neighborhoods, cuisine types and a wide variety of employees and renovations.

Customer visits are determined by a new gaming mechanism in which players roll 15 dice and place them in a unique way to determine which restaurants the fickle public taste adores.

At the end of the year though, it's the planner who has the most money who wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pirate Treasures V
description:
The legendary treasure is here!
Use your brain to uncover the mystery of these five treasure maps.
You could get the treasure!

Goal of the game

Use 5 treasure maps to combine the same quantity of islands shown on clue cards. Then place the gold coin on the appointed location.

Game preparation

1. Each player uses a set of treasure map(5 maps per set)
2. Shuffle clue cards (your deck).
3. Place the coin aside.

Game round

Restriction:
Each treasure card must be shown at least an
island. Do not cover all of them.
All of the treasure maps must be used.
ãSingle Player Modeã
1. Draw a clue card from the deck .
2. Use 5 treasure cards to match the same quantity of island shown on the clue card by stacking and covering.
3. Place the coin on the appointed island.
ãMultiple Player Mode:ã
1. Prepare same quantity of copies according to the number of players.
2. Same rule as Single Player Mode.
3.The player who finds the treasure first grab the
clue card.
Correct O: The clue card turns into your point.
Wrong X: Return the clue card. Then remove one
4. Draw a new clue card and turn to next round.

Game End
The player who gets 3 clue cards wins the game.

name: Jok-R-Ummy Jr
description:
A child-friendly adaptation of Jok-R-ummy. In this version, the deck of playing cards has replaced the four suits with animals (parrot, penguin, tiger, and zebra).

Each round players receive nine playing cards and one mission card. Each mission card is unique and lists a series of cards needed to complete the mission (for example: 5 tiger cards in ascending order). On their turn, each player must draw a card and then discard a card. When a player has the cards required on their personal mission card, they reveal their mission card to the other players and layers the corresponding playing cards on the table. Players acquire a new mission card every round, or they can keep an old mission card if they did not manage to complete it in the previous round.

The game ends when a player completes four mission cards.
publishers: Ãditions Gladius International, Inc., Jennick Games, Inc.

name: Llamas with Hats: Hungry for Hands Card Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Llamas with Hats: Hungry for Hands is a card game where 2-6 players attempt to survive Carl's terrible llama rampage. Will you stumble out of the way in time to save your succulent hands from his dark appetite? Maybe, maybe not, that's life!

All players can die, all players can live, or any combination in between! Work together or leave your friends behind, as Carl slowly munches his way toward your tasty digits.

Comes in a metal tin that is sure to impress at your next dinner party or ball. Additionally, each copy comes with 1 random "Poketmans" card, which is also sure to impress at your next dinner party or ball.

name: Lawless Empire: Lawless Invasion
description: Lawless Invasion is the expansion set that will be bundled together with the base set in the Kickstarter campaign. The plot unfolds against the backdrop of an invasion of the city of Scarpizo by a new Yakuza clan that has the intention of taking over all of Scarpizo's vices. Lawless Invasion features 8 new soldati and 8 new scheme cards to increase the re-playability of the base set. In addition, it comes together with an infusion of Japanese artwork to immerse gamers in a gang war of epic proportion between the Yakuza and the Mafia.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory

name: Black Stories: Scary Music Edition
description: 'Black Stories Scary Music Edition' are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles about music. One player reads aloud a storycard and the other players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A spooky card game just right for any party.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
publishers: G3, Gen-X Games, Kikigagne?, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: quizzone stories 2
description:
quizzone stories is a trivia game with 100 cards each containing 1 picture and 6 questions. The first question is based around the picture - the next is based on the answer to the first question and so on.

When the game ends can be freely decided and it is therefore a great game to bring on a road trip and the like... The winner is of course the one with the most correct answers.

quizzone stories 2 can be played on is own or be combined with quizzone stories.

name: Relic Knights: Codifier Togan & Cecilia
description:
Few of the ancient Imbach race choose to follow the path of the Aethyric Doctrine, finding aethyric patterns to be too fickle to rely on. Togan on the other hand revels in the chaos inherent in the energy that binds the universe together. Cursed with insatiable curiosity and gifted with his races’ naturally long life span, there are few Codifiers in existence who can match his mastery of the Doctrines. Unfortunately, Togan’s curiosity also leads him to become the source of an uncommon amount of mischief. He is banned from as many planets, stations, and ships as any corsair. Many husbands and fathers would like nothing more than to see Togan clasped in irons (or worse) due to his scandalous behavior. Cecilia, his personal Doctrine scribe, follows in his wake desperately trying to make amends and keep the catastrophes contained to disasters.

Codifier Togan and Cecilia are two multi-part pewter miniatures provided with a single 50mm premium base. Models are unpainted and require assembly.

name: Iron Fists of Our Fathers II: Battle of Laocai
description: This is an wargame of Battle of Lao Cai during the Sino-Vietnamese War 1979, and the first game of War Drum Games' Sino-Vietnamese War trilogy.

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: "EdÃ©r" Promo Card
description: Promotional ally card that is usable with any Pathfinder Adventure Card Game set. In addition, it has a code printed on it that can be redeemed for the same card in the Pathfinder Adventures video game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: "Pallegina" Promo Card
description: Promotional ally card that is usable with any Pathfinder Adventure Card Game set. In addition, it has a code printed on it that can be redeemed for the same card in the Pathfinder Adventures video game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: The Island PIZZA
description:
The aim of the game is to collect the first one pizza of any color of the 6 pieces.

The cards represent pieces of pizza from 3 pairs of different types and 3 different colors (red, green, yellow), on some cards there are Hero-cards (Pepper, Mushroom, Knife and Fork), which has useful effects.

Think it's easy? It was not there, because in the game you'll not only find repeated pieces, discarding the wrong color, but also strongly interfere with favorite neighbors, using the effects of the Hero-cards. You can choose from and sharing bits and reset of the selected card and diabolical plans rigging the deck! Yes! We legalized cheating a little ))) Here is an adventure!

For those who are and it will seem easy, we have prepared Advanced Rules. The game adds a Ship-Captain special card and achievements!

Now 3 cards will always be open to players that provides an opportunity not only rely on luck and memory, but also to plan their actions! Special cards and achievements offer a real challenge - not just to win the game, but also to fulfill some conditions!

We thought about the smallest! For them there are Easy Rules, and card-tip and full-sized Pattern-hint (on the back of the Rules)

You can play with children from 5 years for Easy Rules and from 7 and 10 years for Basic and Advance Rules. The party lasts 10-20 minutes.

name: Spin Go Round!
description:
Take a Spin with Vampirina in this exciting twist on bingo! Spin to see where you can play. Match the color, pattern, shape or character. If you get Spin Go Round, everyone switches spinners! You never know when the game will take a batty turn!

—description from the publisher

name: Patrimonia Amsterdam
description:
Patrimonia Amsterdam is a strategic board game for 2 to 6 people. By manoeuvring your boat tactically through the canals, collecting the right materials and being the first to finish building your monuments, you can win. But be careful, some monuments are worth more than others. Also watch out for the other players! Using shrewd negotiation tactics and a clever choice of profession they can mess up your game. Also keeping things on edge are the luck or lose cards. Who sinks his boat and who sails away towards victory?
Patrimonia Amsterdam is an addictive board game, exciting till the last second.

Purpose of the game:
Sailing the canals you collect foundations, building materials and permits to renovate monuments, and by doing so, you help conserve the historical city centre of Amsterdam.
Has a player finished renovating all his monuments? This is when the last round will be played. The player who has the most points at the end, wins.

—description from the designer

name: Star Trek Tactics IV
description:
Star Trek Tactics IV is the fourth expansion set to the Star Trek starship battles using the Heroclix game series. Includes 32 premium pre-painted ships with all new dials! Some of the miniatures sculpts are new to Star Trek Tactics and not in previous expansions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Adorable Monsters
description:
Adorable Monsters is the super cute card game, for all ages, in which the first player to put together a squad of 7 cutie patootie monsters, wins! Have a blast with your buds, pals, mates, friends, family, or even absolute strangers, as you try to be the first to create your monster squad!

How to Play
Learning to play Adorable Monsters is easy! That's because what each card can be used to do during play is written directly on it, in the form of concise instructions.

To begin the game, all players draw 5 cards and thereafter take turns drawing and playing one card at a time, as they try to line up a squad of 7 monsters in front of them to win the game.

Of course, it's not that easy, as there are lots of cards that players can use to remove monsters from their opponents' squads. So, not only do you have to try to put together your monster squad, but you have to try to stop your friends from doing so, too!

—description from the publisher

name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Gaming
description:
Do you know where the secret lives can be found and which combo that does the most damage? Do you think that the best parties are LAN and that easter eggs should be digital? Here is the quiz for all of us whose parent thought we should have spent more time in the fresh air.

This game contains 60 questions, in addition to a category tile, that can be used as a standalone game, or to expand your Bezzerwizzer game with this new category.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Knowledge the Game
description:
Knowledge is a battle-based, deck-building game that uses dice to determine victories. It takes place in a Fantasy realm where Knowledge is power and fought for. Mana allows you to summon giant creatures, defensive structures, and mighty warriors into your army in the quest to battle enemies and gain the most Knowledge. Knowledge cards give you victory points and bestow you with unique, extra abilities instead of clogging up your deck.

Knowledge is a fast paced Deck-Builder where you are constantly reacting to your opponents cards. When someone plays a card it attacks each other player one by one. Roll die to determine battles and roll die for certain cards that give you extra abilities if you roll the right number.

The whole point of the game is to gain the most Knowledge. Once all the Knowledge cards are gone the game is over. Count up all your Knowledge points, highest wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Tous au CinÃ©ma
description:
A trivia game about cinema.

1500 questions related to about 1000 movies.

name: Froggi
description:
Froggi is the cute, quirky card game in which you try to be the first player to connect 5 of your cards together on the playing surface, while you strategize to interrupt the progress of your opponents!

How To Play
Separate the deck into 4 stacks of cards by color, face-down. Shuffle each deck and give 1 to every player. Set any extra deck(s) aside. Place the sole green frog into the center of the playing surface. The player left of the dealer takes the first turn.

For each turn, a player draws 1 card from his or her deck and plays it onto the surface in an invisible grid that may grow in any direction. Diagonal play is not allowed. If a card with an action is played, its action must be completed either after, or as part of, the card's placement (if possible). The action cards are:

+ 1: Extra turn (after)

c1: Cover an opponent's card (as part of).
m1: Move any card to a new position (after).
-1: Remove an opponent's card from play (after).

No card may be removed that "breaks" the overall grid of cards (creates and island of cards that aren't connected by border to the others).

The first player with 5 cards in a row (vertically, horizontally, or diagonally) wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Star Wars: Angriff auf den Todesstern
description:
The rebels are planning an attack on the Death Star, the
ultimate weapon of the Empire. Of course, a fleet of enemy spaceships immediately appears to the rebels way. Help the rebels to defeat these spaceships to end up to finally reach the Death Star.

Galactically cool dice game in which the STAR WARS fans help the rebels to their "Death Star Attack".

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die Rebellen planen einen Angriff auf den Todesstern, die ultimative Waffe des Imperiums. Natürlich stellt sich den Rebellen sofort eine Flotte von gegnerischen Raumschiffen in den Weg.
Helft den Rebellen diese Raumschiffe zu besiegen, um am Ende bis zum Todesstern vorzudringen.

Galaktisch cooles Würfelspiel, bei dem die STAR WARS Fans den Rebellen bei ihrem "Angriff auf den Todesstern" helfen.

—description from the publisher (German)
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Monopoly: Howden Editiion
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:

Howden, originally Heaffudene, grew at a crossing point (Bridgewater) along the Old Derwent (Hailgate) after Lake Humber had started to silt up.

The town has a history that starts before the Domesday Book and has several royal connections, King Edgar gave his first wife Howden Manor, William the Conqueror gave the church (later developed into the Minster) to the Bishop of Durham and King John gave Howden the right to hold an annual horse fair.

Howden was a coaching town and although it does not have a railway, it is the M62 that brings people here today. AVisitor can enjoy the Georgian architecture around the Minster, shops and cafes around the Market Place, a community venue in the Shire Hall, a walk around the nature reserve of Howden Marsh or recreational time in The Ashes.

Local firms have helped to bring Howden MONOPOLY to fruition to celebrate The Ashes 90th anniversary. This edition is about the comunity, by the communityand for the community. Enjoy.

PROPERTIES
BROWN
The Bowman's / Wellington Hotel
LIGHT BLUE
Howden Station / Sacred Heart R. C. Church / Howden Methodist Church
PINK
War Memorial / Market Cross / Briggs Fountain
ORANGE
Parsons Lane / Treeton Road / Hailgate
RED
Howden CofE Infant School / Howden Junior School / Howden School
YELLOW
Vicar Lane / Market Place / Bridgegate
GREEN
Wren / E-Buyer / Press Association
DARK BLUE
Ashes Playing Field / Howden Minster
STATIONS
Howdens Manufacturing & Distribution / Howdens Worthwhile For All Concerned / Howdens Serving The Small Builder / Howdens Kitchens & Joinery
UTILITIES
Howden Marsh / Howden Show
TAXES
Ashes Playing Fields Trust / Shire Hall Restoration
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ember: Trick or Treat
description:
Can you be the Archmage’s favourite by conjuring the most powerful mythical creatures? Use their unique abilities to bolster your magical powers or hinder your enemies in this game of luck, strategy, magic, and creatures of legend.

Trick or Treat sees 30 brand new cards that focus on "take that" mechanics and the addition of Gloom creatures. It also contains all the reworked and play tested Halloween expansion cards, which were requested the fans!

The Gloom cards are a deck of cards which are shuffled and three are dealt to the table. Anyone can Conjure these cards and use them to their advantage. Each one has powerful endgame changing effects - some modify the VP of Burned creatures while others have wholly more malevolent powers designed to allow you to put those Archmage cards to good use! But be warned, the power of Gloom is powerful and unpredictable and it can easily be a double-edged sword. Gloom magic is recommended for advanced Ember players.

The creatures you collect will allow you to mitigate the “luck of the draw” and to further your chances of conjuring more powerful creatures (by drawing more cards that you need or stripping your enemies of their creatures' powers). Trick or Treat capitalizes on that giving you even more chances to attack your enemies, to weaken their creatures and to strengthen your hold over the game. It's all out war in the Halloween expansion!


It's got a slew of new art by a fabulous all-female art team.
It's all about the endgame. Now you can really shake things up with a single Archmage card.
It makes the final score that bit more uncertain. Now you can manipulate the final VPs of Burned creatures. If that wasn't enough, some of the new creatures are reactionary: when a player does something - you get to do something. It means you can wield absolute power in each game, BUT you might pay a high price for such blatant use of magic.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Trivial Pursuit: Sciences et Nature
description: This is one of many thematic boxes for the trivial pursuit. It focuses on Science & nature (the green questions) and is known for its challenging difficulty.

name: Jousting Tournament (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
When a player draws the jousting tile he must play it to an existing city. The player is free to deploy his follower to the city (if legal) or he may attempt to become jousting champion. If the tile can’t be played, it is removed from the game, the player drawing a new tile as a replacement from the supply.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Frui10
description: Put the deck of round cards face-up in the middle of the table – this is a storehouse with colorful pears, bananas, pineapples, and strawberries. The players turn into sneaky raccoons and hedgehogs whose objective is to steal from the storehouse as many pieces of fruit as possible. While selecting fruit on the basis of their type or color, you need to find a number on your card and a number on the storehouse card which make a total of exactly 10 (there’s room for 10 items in the bag). It goes without saying that it should be done as fast as possible!

name: Perplexus Mini: Cascading Cups
description:
This is an excellent introduction to the concept of the Perplexus range. The difficulty of the cups (make the ball jump!) is flexible because the course is double-sided.
Take it anywhere, play it all the time, this mini 3D maze is perfect for discovering the world of Perplexus!

Contains a 20-step jump course, double-sided and a ball

—description from the publisher

name: Franky's 1st Christmas
description:
'Twas the night before Christmas, when all through the house
Not a creature was stirring, not even a mouse;
But stillness is for those with no autopsy,
For the dead were enjoying a Christmas soiree!
The stockings were hung by the chimney with care,
In one was a foot, though we knew not from where;
The banshee shrieked carols of Christmases past,
And all within earshot lost sanity fast;
My friend, Dr. Jekyll, joined in the refrain,
But I knew that within, Hyde sneered in disdain;
With the mummy's own linen, he wrapped Christmas gifts,
Each containing a tablet of cursed hieroglyphs;
The witch mixed a potion of expensive liqueur,
Which the vampyre spurned, preferring cruor;
The ghost and the zombie had a small Christmas fight,
On which was more deader, the undead or the geist;
With twice seeing eyes, Franky took it all in.
His very first Christmas, about to begin;
But I thought I heard rustling out in the snow,
And I spied out my window Van Helsing's crossbow;
The hunter had found us and we had a plight,
For Franky had not learned of Christmas delights;
He let fly his arrow but it fell with a flub,
For his cloak had been caught on a thorn in the shrub;
Without wasting a moment to thank our landscaper,
We escaped in the night to continue our caper;
But we know he's still out there acting like an ass,
Determined to make Franky's 1st Christmas his last;
All the monsters are scared and I need assistance,
To help overcome their foolish resistance;
I beg you, dear reader, help Franky today,
Just download the game, print it, and play;

In Franky's 1st Christmas you must guide Franky to the lairs of 6 monster so that they can teach him their favorite thing about Christmas. Meanwhile, Van Helsing will be investigating the monsters and hunting them when he can.

Each monster card has two sides. The front includes their ability to persuade other monsters and a special power. The backside shows their Christmas lesson and how nervous they are to teach it. The Dr. Jekyll card is slightly different - he doesn't teach a Christmas Lesson. Rather, he turns into a Mr. Hyde. Mr. Hyde can still be used, but he's far more clumsy and less efficient than Dr. Jekyll.

The monsters will roll dice to try and convince each other to teach Franky his Christmas lessons. Each monster has distinct success values, making each roll in the game unique. Some monsters may instead use a special power to distract Van Helsing from his investigation or give other monsters a benefit. How the monsters use their actions is entirely up to you!

Each turn has 7 phases.
1. Roll Random Event - This will usually move Van Helsing further along in his investigation or give the monsters better luck in their attempts to teach Franky.
2. Select a monster to teach Franky a Christmas Lesson
3. The other monsters take actions to persuade the teaching monster to do its job.
4. Check to see if Dr. Jekyll transforms into Mr. Hyde.
5. Reset the cards and get ready for the next turn.

You win the game by teaching Franky all 6 lessons of Christmas and escaping from Van Helsing.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Horror, Humor, Print & Play, Zombies

name: Mighty Pig Tug
description: Ropes equal to the number of players extend outward from a mud pit. Each rope has room for three pigs. Players manage a hand of three cards and take turns either adding a pig card with a point value of from 5 to 50 to one of the spaces on their ropes or playing an action card. A fourth pig added to a rope causes another pig on that rope to fall into the mud pit. The game ends when the Mighty Pig Tug card is drawn; at that time, the player whose pigs on his rope sum to the highest value wins.

name: Action Cats!: The Tabletop Adventure Expansion
description:
Was available at International Tabletop Day 2018

Adds 25 cards to the base game. Each card features a cat celebrating International Tabletop Day and prompts to tell their Action Cats! story.
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: EGO Family
description:
In EGO Family each player is in turn confronted with a fun, silly or serious dilemma that he or she have to give their position on. The task of the other players is to guess what the answer will be.
The game is first and foremost a way to discover new things about your friends and family but it also initiates talks about subjects which are not adressed in everyday family life.

—description from the publisher

name: Team Yankee: Hammerfall â World War III Battles
description:
Hammerfall is an introduction to the world of Team Yankee, the World War III miniatures game.

Team Yankee is a tabletop miniatures wargame that is set in a fictional World War III in 1985 based on the novel of the same name by Harold Coyle.

The game is a standard two player miniature wargame with each player taking command of a company or battalion level force consisting of hand painted miniatures. The game provides one 6 different missions for the purpose of pickup games. There are also several scenarios in the book that allow the players to recreate some of the battles from the Team Yankee novel.

The game has an accompanying line of 15mm scale miniatures to use but it can be played with models from any manufacture.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Wyvern: Phoenix
description:
The Phoenix expansion for Wyvern introduces two new types of Action cards:

Hidden Action
Play under a face down card during an Action Phase. The Hidden Action card tells you whether to play it under one of your cards or under an opponent's card. The Hidden Action is not revealed until the card it is placed under gets turned face up during the normal course of play. You may not look at any Hidden Actions placed under your cards by your opponent until your card comes face up during play. Place the Hidden Actions sideways as a reminder of this. As soon as a card with a Hidden Action under it comes face up, check to see if the Hidden Action applies to the card it is under. If it does not apply, it is discarded and has no effect. If it does apply, follow the instructions on the Hidden Action card. The Hidden Action card remains attached to the card it was under for as long as that card is in play, unless it is removed by a game action.

Intercept Action
Play immediately after your opponent has chosen a dragon to use for attack, and has announced which card he is attacking. If your opponent is attacking a face down card, you play the Intercept Action before the card is turned face up. If the Interceptor has a base strength, the attacking dragon must kill the Interceptor before reaching the intended target of its attack. The attacking dragon and the Interceptor fight a normal battle with the Interceptor counting as a dragon in the row attacked. If the outcome is anything other than the Interceptor being killed, the Battle Phase ends immediately. This means that the Interceptor could lose the battle but survive with a Golden Apple or Fountain of Youth, and the Battle Phase would still end. If the battle is cancelled, the Battle Phase ends. If the Interceptor wins the battle, the losing Dragon dies and the Interceptor is discarded, ending the Battle Phase. If the attacking Dragon does kill the Interceptor, it then immediately attacks the card it originally intended to attack. If the Intercept Action does not have a base strength, follow the instructions on the card. Intercept Actions are always discarded after use.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Days of Daniel
description:
An exciting way to learn fascinating facts about Daniel's life.

Explore the amazing life of Daniel, his dangers, his visions and his victories, as you play Days of Daniel - the board game with a difference!

Aims of the game:
Begin on the starting stone and move clockwise around the board, progressing from the outer to the inner circle, collecting the picture cards as you go and swapping pieces, when allowed, until your game card is complete. You then have access to climb the final steps to the "end of Days". The first person to arrive there with a complete game card is the winner.

—description from the box

name: Brainbox: English
description:
Grammar, punctuation and spelling: let's face it, important though they are, these have never been the easiest topics to make fun - until now! Let BrainBox English come to the rescue, helping you sort out pronouns from prepositions, adverbs from apostrophes and synonyms from syllables.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

name: Halloween Party
description:
Halloween Party is a set-collecting game by Kuro. The game cards are placed in a grid, and on each player's turn, they choose to gain all cards in either a row or a column, after which the grid is refilled. However, the refill is irregular and as the game proceeds, each row will be of differing lengths, causing the players to sometimes gain fewer cards, sometimes more. Some cards have special powers that trigger depending on the number of gained cards, even on other players' turns, causing chaotic chain effects.

Once the deck runs out, players get final bonus points depending on a balance between gained "children" and gained "candy". Points are also awarded during the game. Most points at the end wins.

—user summary

name: Zakaznik
description:
Zakaznik is a board game about managing a special type of natural reserve in Russia. Each player take the role of a zakaznik keeper and must prepare territory for new inhabitants, populate different spices, and complete government orders.

The game consists of an undetermined number of rounds, until either one zakaznik is completely prepared or all spices are populated. Each round, players locate their workers onto spaces on the game board and immediately take corresponding actions: prepare their zakaznik by placing landscape tiles on personal board, transport new spices onto personal reserve or take government orders. After completing main action, players can take additional actions: locate spices from personal reserve onto landscape tiles in their zakaznik or play government order cards. The winner of the game is determined by the number of prestige points, which are given for preparing zakaznik, spices inside it and government orders.

—description from the publisher

name: Exploding Horcruxes
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Exploding Horcruxes is a non-authorized version of Exploding Kittens.




Exploding Horcruxes is a fast paced, Russian roulette style game where if you happen to draw the Horcrux you die and are out of the game. Every other card in the deck helps you avoid this fate with things like diving the future, skipping, and attacking the other witches and wizards playing with you.

It is full of wizarding world references and jokes that the nerd in you will love.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: The Wild Nature (fan expansion for Potion Explosion)
description:
The Wild Nature (fan expansion for Potion Explosion; TWN) is an Unofficial Fan-made Print and Play expansion for the Potion Explosion Boardgame (it is not a project by Horrible Games, the publisher of Potion Explosion).

TWN introduces a new Ingredient - Wild Nature Essence (green marbles), a new board - Nature Leaf, 4 new Potions and 9 new Professors.

Wild Nature Essence - when activated in an Explosion - will trigger a Wild Explosion (between different colored marbles). This will enhance the Explosion possibilities and your brewing Potions abilities.

The new Potions, and the newly arrived Professors each with their unique view on brewing Potions, both add more variety to the game.

You can download the rules and components from the files and adding 12 green marbles (you must provide them) you have this new expansion ready!

-description from designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Take That

name: Off The Grid
description:
Off The Grid Board Game is a fun family game played without electricity—get out your flashlights!
Use your creativity and interact with real people instead of computers and screens!
Choose 5 activities from a deck of 42 cards for a fun time!


Off The Grid Board Game is designed to get kids "off the grid" and promotes creative and interactive play, employing a deck of activity cards that specify various fun children's games, including traditional playtime activities such as match-the-pairs, guess-the-drawing, and indoor bowling. Fun for family game night, and helps get kids introduced to board games in a way that they can really get into, with simple instructions they can read and follow.

Playtime for each sub-game is roughly 5 minutes, with full game time around 30 minutes. Most appropriate for kids ages 4-11, along with their older siblings/friends and parents/grandparents/caregivers.

—description from the publisher

Rules

Shuffle the Off The Grid activity card deck.
Randomly select 5 activity cards and place on the Off The Grid game board.
Place the matching 5 station cards around your house where the activities will take place.
Time to go “Off The Grid”! Turn off the lights and all electronics.
Play all 5 activities in sequence and declare the ultimate winner (i.e. the one who wins the most sub-games). Have fun!
publishers: Off The Grid Board Game LLC

name: ã¢ã¼ã¯ã©ã¤ã20 (Arclight Twenty)
description:
The CEO Fukumoto has decided to give a bonus to just one employee. But, as he likes games, he's said that whoever can guess who that was, will share the bonus with that character.

Out of 20 roles, one is put out of the game, and the goal of the game is for the remaining players to guess what role that is. The remaining 19 roles will be dealt to the players, and the players will use these as "connections" in the company to find out what other cards the other players have. Your cards will be revealed by the actions of other players, but once face up, they will have additional effects that work to your advantage.

The first player to figure out the card that was put away, is the winner of the game.

Arclight Twenty is a game of deduction. It’s a memorabilia for 20 years anniversary of Arclight Inc., and was given only to the people that have involved in their jobs. It is said only 400 copies are printed.

name: Knowing Me, Knowing You Card Game
description:
The Knowing Me Knowing You Game from Purple Donkey tests how well you really know your friends. With this scenario game you have to correctly guess your partners reaction to 5 different scenarios. Suitable for four or more players, this fun game includes 50 scenario cards, 10 wild cards and 24 answer cards. - A.D.

Key Features:

Knowing Me Knowing You Game
Tests how well you really know your friends
Includes: 50 scenario cards, 10 wild cards and 24 answer cards
Suitable for 4 or more players

—description from the publisher

name: Codeword Thunderclap
description:
Codeword Thunderclap (CTC) is a strategic-level two-player wargame of low-intermediate complexity that covers the climactic fighting in and near Stalingrad from November 1942 through March 1943. The game’s sub-systems are crafted to present a supreme-commander’s-eye-view: it is almost fully strategic in its perspective, with only the most pastel of operational undertones added to enhance historical tone and texture.

Each hex on the map represents 16 miles (26 km) from side to opposite side. Each full turn of play represents one-third of a month of ‘real time.’ Units of maneuver are corps and armies or their ad hoc emergency unit equivalents.

Command Magazine Japan #143 in October 2018.

name: TANKS: The Modern Age â Leopard 2 Tank Expansion
description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

The Leopard 2 is a West German tank.

name: Soliti ignoti
description:
Based in the popular TV program, Soliti ignoti is the game of hidden identities in which players must guess the profession or the hobby of an unknown person. It is possible to play in competitive or cooperative mode.

In the competitive version each player takes turns in the role of host and secretly assigns the identities to 5 unknown people, choosing among the 8 available. The other players bet on the identity of the current unknown, also using the available clues.
Who guesses gains the value of the unknown, but if everyone has made a mistake, the host loses the value of the unknown. The host, therefore, must be careful to choose an identity that is neither too easy, otherwise all others earn money, not too difficult, not to lose them himself.
After having unveiled the identities of the 5 unknowns, the proof of the mysterious relative takes place: the host draws another unknown and chooses which of the 5 initial unknowns is his relative, also assigning clues to the degree of kinship and the 2 unknowns to be excluded. Who misses the mysterious relative loses 50.000 €: also in this case the host must be careful because if nobody guesses, he will lose 50.000 €. After everyone has played the role of the host, whoever has the most money is the winner.

In the cooperative version all the players collaborate to earn as much as possible. Contrary to the previous mode, the host must try to help the players as much as possible.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: ãã¤ãã¬ã³ã¸ã¢ã®å¤è­¦ (Night Watchman of Hydrangea)
description:
User summary
ãã¤ãã¬ã³ã¸ã¢ã®å¤è­¦ (Haidorenzia no yakei) Night Watchman of Hydrangea is a Japanese game, building patterns of Watchmen.

In the game of Night Watchman of Hydrangea, players are squad leaders of night watchmen of a city named Hydrangea. Their duty is to protect the city by recruiting and deploying watchmen properly. Watchmen's unity and diversity are the keys to strength of their squads. Whose squad will excel the others?

You assemble 16 member cards and deploy them in 4x4 grid. You start with four members in the center of your grid and deploy one member around them each turn. Each member has their race, favorite weapon, and religion.

When a column, a row, or a quadrant (2x2 grid including a corner) is filled with four members in your grid, you have a chance to score. For each category (race, weanpon, and religion), check if these four members are qualified by being united (all 4 have the same characteristics) or diversified (all 4 have different characteristics). Depending on how many categories they are qualified in, you score victory points.

The game ends when all players have 16 members in their grid. You win the game if you have the most points among players.

The only change for the second edition was to rotate the cards, from portrait to landscape orientation.

Publisher's summary
ãã¬ã¤ã¤ã¼ã¯ããã¤ãã¬ã³ã¸ã¢ã®å¤è­¦å£ã®å£é·ã¨ãªããå£å¡ãã¹ã«ã¦ããéå±ãã¦è¡ãå®ããªããã°ãªããªãã
4×4ã«ãªãããã«å£å¡ã«ã¼ããéç½®ããç¸¦ãæ¨ªããã­ãã¯ãã¨ã«ãäººç¨®ãæ­¦å¨ãä¿¡ä»°ã®è¦ç´ ããã¹ã¦åãããã¹ã¦ç°ãªãæ§ã«éç½®ã§ããã°ãå¯¾å¿ããå¾ç¹ã«ã¼ããç²å¾ã§ããããºã«è¦ç´ ã®é«ãã²ã¼ã ã§ãã
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Tandem
description: The game is based on cards. On each card 8 words are written. You have to associate 2 words from 2 different cards to make an expression. For example if glass is one of the words on the first card and wine is one of the words on the second card you could say "a glass of wine". All the players are playing simultanously, trying to be the first to find a valid expression.

name: Monopoly: Bojack Horseman Edition
description: A version of the classic board game based on the tragically hilarious animated Netflix series. Players take on the role of talent agents pining to sign the best clients by buying, selling, and trading Production Companies and Studios in Hollywoo!
categories: Economic, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Omen Peak
description:
A co-op survival dice game where the players take on the role of Ancestor spirits, who are guiding their living Descendants to the summit of a mountain. The tribe is making this pilgrimage to remember the Ancestors - and if the Descendants fail in their journey, the Ancestors will be forgotten for all eternity! The Ancestors must work together to help the tribe survive. The players win the game together if they manage to bring at least two Descendants to the mountaintop alive. Any fewer than that, and the players all lose.

The game is played in rounds (5 to 20 max) which represent "days" of travel. (Increasing duration increases game difficulty.) Each morning, the Shaman of the tribe rolls dice to interpret an Omen: resources that day will be Safe (neutral), Blessed (collect +1), or Cursed. Taking cursed items will result in additional Danger for the Descendant who disobeyed the Omen!

Randomized terrain cards provide opportunities to forage for various resources - food, medicine, firewood, and crystals for banishing hostile evil spirits. The Ancestors decide how best to match Descendants' skills to the resources available in any given location. The more lucrative places also contain the greatest likelihood for danger! A player rolls once for each Descendant who forages during the day.

Each player's role gives them a special power to intervene on behalf of the Descendants. Some banish evil spirits, heal Descendants, ward off sickness, or other helpful skills.

—description from the designer

name: L'Osti d'jeu: De pÃ¨re en flic 2
description: A promo pack of cards for L'Osti d'jeu release for the first weekend in movie theater of the movie : De père en flic 2.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Lost Plateau
description:
Common player comment, "This is not the game I thought it would be." It may look like a kids game but it defies labeling. It may be perfect information but it is not an abstract...

Apex Portal presents Lost Plateau, inspired by the 1912 classic novel, The Lost World, by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. On this secret plateau, dinosaurs roam a land of volcanoes and treacherous cliffs. Expeditions navigate stampeding dinosaurs while chasing and delivering eggs.

Dinosaurs! At Apex Portal we love primal physical mechanics. We evolved Lost Plateau for over 10 years. This design strived for 2 goals to produce primal tension. First, to have dinosaurs with an elegant set of behaviors (stampede, defensive facing, double dino combinations) to spawn eggs and eliminate opposing dinosaurs. Second, to balance the influence of the 2 entities, the expeditions and the dinosaur packs, so both are always in consideration for their way of scoring and to maximize the interaction between them. Each player controls a pack and an expedition. The dino behaviors are truly predatorial for the fun tactical side of the game. When will your expedition feel safe to run the gauntlet of opposing dinos for the eggs? That question and getting your packs into safe but threatening areas of the plateau is the strategy side of the game.

Game Description
This is a physical primal game.
A player turn is 2 actions – may do the same action twice.
Move Expedition Action – Pick up and deliver eggs to the Safe Camps by moving 2 spaces per action. Or use the in-game Trail Blaze expansion to allow unlimited movement on established trails -- that can be co-developed between competitors.
Move Dinosaur Action – Dinos stampede dinos and opposing expeditions. The dino is moved and then given facing to prevent stampede from one direction. If both actions are Move Dino then sly double dino stampedes appear out of the mist! This encourages dinos to stay within reach of pack mates and maximizes a true predator mind set – you always see opportunity, but often don't see the other pack coming after you.

Winning the game - Score 6 total eggs and/or dino captures.

Two unique team versions for 4 to 6 players. Can play as team mates or as competing “pack mates”. Pack mates control and share the points scored by their pack, but don't share in egg scoring by their private Expedition. The team games are unique for the speed of play. A 6 player game runs!

Trail Blaze Expansion. The in-game expansion adds a 3rd action, for experienced gamers. Each player or team has 20 blazes. The Blaze Action is the placing of 5 Blazes on any spaces of the board. On move Expedition Action, the player may move the tent into any space that is adjacent and has at least 2 Blazes and at least one is of the player's color. May move up and down connected trails with out limit on each Move Expedition action. This adds deeper strategy in avoiding opponent dinos and adds co-opetition to jump in on other player's developed trails with your own Blazes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Fighting, Novel-based, Prehistoric, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: NO DRAW
description:
No DRAW is an abstract tiles placement game based on the classic “Tic-tac-toe”.

The purpose is to compose the largest number of tic tac toe with the tiles on which it’s indicated a numeric value and carry the highest score.
The players have also some action tiles that influence the course of the game, so that the challenges can get more dynamic.
Round after round, the players can modify their strategy deciding whether to collect points or hinder the opponent.
NO DRAW is simple, intuitive and quick to learn.
Game after game, it will give you and your friends hours of fun.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Pattern Building, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Decrypto: Klingon
description: Decrypto: Klingon is a print-and-play expansion for Decrypto that adds another layer of deduction to the game (sort of) since the words that you and your teammates gives clues to one another about are all in Klingon. yIDo'!
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game

name: The Awful Orphanage: The Orphanage Awakes Expansion Pack
description:
In this exciting expansion to The Awful Orphanage, The Orphanage Awakes allows a player to take control of Mrs. Prendergast and the nefarious residents of her home for wayward children.
