These are hidden along with the other elf cards, and if a player finds at least three of these cards, he scores an additional three points that's added to his elf score. If he finds only one or two of these cards, however, he scores no bonus and must throw away one of the elf cards he collected!

name: MindMaze: Verzwickte RÃ¤tsel â Wahre Geschichten
description:
In MindMaze: Verzwickte Rätsel - Wahre Geschichten, players take turns asking questions to try to solve criminal mysteries.

In general, a referee tells a strange story, then the players must determine why and how the story happened by asking "Yes" or "No" questions, with "Not Important" also being a plausible answer. Players take turns asking questions, with a point being subtracted for each question. Players are awarded points for asking certain key questions that eliminate faux versions of the story. The list of useful key questions is attached to every riddle. This sort of gaming procedure effectively encourages players to develop careful analytical questions and eliminates random questions.

name: Sunset Blvd.
description: Each player sets out to discover the location of the four celebrities assigned to them at the start of the game from among a line of Hollywood stars placed face-down. Players, taking on the role of reporters, roll dice and move their pawns along the queue of stars in a quest for interviews. The eclectic mix of stars pictured in the game include Arnold Schwarzenegger, Cary Grant, Steve Martin, Leonard Nimoy and E.T.

name: Plevna
description:
This is a simplified Empires at War series game from Joe Miranda.

Command control and morale are given great attention. This covers a critical battle in the Russo-Turkish war of 1877-78 in which the Russians assaulted Ottoman positions. There is one large 34x22 map of which half+ is for Chancellorsville and the remainder is Plevna.

name: San Guo Sha: SP Characters 2012
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




This expansion is a collector's edition. It adds 9 new character cards to the game. 7 of these characters were already present in the base version of the game but have gotten new artwork and new abilities. These new character cards does not replace the old ones, since the abilities are different. 2 new characters are also introduced. The cards were released monthly in some issues of Zhuo You Zhi magazine as a free gift.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Role Playing

name: No Lo Testeamos Ni Un Poco: Picante
description:
User summary (Translated):
This expansion is for players over 18 years old.
Includes 69 cards that are mixed in the common deck and others that are divided into 4 decks (Picantor (Spiced Up) 1, 2, 3 and 4).
Whenever you lose you can draw a card from the special decks, and if you fulfill the challenge, you are back to the game. It also comes with a special die because you have to use when the cards do so.

User summary (Spanish):
Esta expansión es para mayores de 18 años.
Incluye 69 cartas que se mezclan en el mazo común y otras que se dividen en 4 mazos (Picantor 1, 2, 3 y 4).
Siempre que perdés podes robar una carta de los mazos especiales y si cumplís la consigna, seguís en juego. Además trae un dado especial que tenés que usar cuando las cartas así lo indiquen.
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Le Secret des Sarens
description:
The ancient reptilian civilization of the Sarens disappeared millions years ago. They knew all about matter manipulation and hyperspace travel. The remains of this civilization plunge into oblivion are spread across Heos’s realms and are full of powerful relics that defy the imagination.

Expeditions have engaged in an archaeological journey on behalf of powerful factions and their members will use all of their abilities to achieve their ends. For prophecy is that when enough relics have been found, a dimensional portal will open to go on the moon Wym, the cradle of the Secret of the Sarens...

Each player leads an expedition in order to collect Sarens relics. Expeditions are made of 3 type of cards: Regions, Classes & Factions:

On each Region card, you will find 2 to 4 relics.
Each Class card has only 1 relic, but it is balanced by abilities like looking at the other players cards or destroying a type of card.
Each Faction has a permanent effect that can reverse the situation.


Players will activate their cards in order to find more Relics than the other players and try to guess the other player's score in order to end the game at the right time.

name: Animeter
description:
The trees are full of tasty apples so it’s time for forest animals to have a feast! But to reach the fruit is not a simple task so animals decided to cooperate. One by one they climb on the tops of each other’s heads to form a tall tower. Hares use their long ears to lift their friends, hedgehogs chase off predators hiding between the leaves and tiny mice can reach apples in the hollows. How to make it to that mellow red apple?

In Animeter, each player can build up to 3 towers using 9 cards with various animals. Reach as many apples as possible and avoid dangerous predators. Use your sight: you cannot check the height of your towers during the round. Collect combinations of animals’ abilities. And, finally, after each player plays the final card, measure the towers ,and find out who gathered most apples and won the game!

-description from publisher
publishers: Blackrock Games, Compaya.hu: Gamer CafÃ© Kft., Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games

name: Route 66 Das Kartenspiel
description:
Card game with the same theme as the board game Route 66 by the same designer.

Theme
Players are driving on the historic Route 66 from Chicago to Los Angeles. Will you be "King of Route 66" by having the most money in your pocket when you reach L.A.?

Goal
Having the most money when the last state card is turned over.

Game play
At the start of the game, each player gets 3 cards and 600 $.
Players take turns playing a card, either from their own hand or the top card from the face-down draw deck. Cards normally raise or lower the speed, but there are also cards with special effects (e.g. players have to pay additional costs, player order changes, etc.).
If the speed limit of 55 mph has been exceeded and a player plays the "highway patrol" card, the previous player is caught speeding and has to pay a fine to the patrol (i.e. the player who played the highway patrol card), the amount depending on the speed and on the state.

The game ends when the last state card has been turned over. The player with the most money wins the game.

name: ShanJari
description:
From the box:
"An intricate challenge to build and create winning sequences of colors and combinations. Strategy builds as players place their colored beads. Find a winning combination before your opponent."

A sequence/pattern is decided on by all the players. The players then attempt to create this pattern by either placing new colored beads on the board, or by moving other previously played beads.

name: Talk Show
description: Scruples meets Balderdash. Players alternate roles as Host, Celebrity, and Audience. The Host asks the Celebrity a question. The Celebrity writes down his/her answer, while the host writes down a fake answer. The question and answers are read to the Audience who try to pick the real answer.

name: Wiz Kidz
description: Wiz Kidz is a children's word game similar to Scattergories. The game consists of 98 cards. Half contain a letter and a point value; the other half contain a "question". Players take one of each and then try to think of something starting with the appropriate letter that matches the question. Some example question cards are: "something a cat or dog does", "something you wear", "a profession", and "a piece of furniture". If the player can think of a correct word, the points listed on the letter card are scored. When all cards have been used, the player with the highest score wins.

name: Cranium Dice Game
description:
Players roll dice then flip a card that directs them to complete one of four different activities that incorporate the Cranium themed dice:

1. Complete sentences by spelling words with letters on rolled dice.
2. Doing simple math problems with numbers on dice.
3. Finding dice with specific pictures on them.
4. Creating a sculpture out of cards and dice.

Game was created for and sold exclusively through Starbucks during the 2009-2010 Holiday season

name: Qrazy Quandaries
description:
From the publisher's website:

Qrazy Quandaries
The third "Take Your Pick" game

Take Your Pick between two tough choices! Would you prefer to wake up with floppy dog ears or a fuzzy bunny tail? Wear the same outfit or eat the same meal for a year? Have one wish granted today or three granted in ten years? Packed with 125 questions, this game will have your family and friends "Qracking" each other up!

name: KaBoom!
description:
OBJECT OF GAME
To move one's scorepeg from start to finish on the scoreboard by using the KaBoom! Machine.

Each player pumps the machine from one to ten strokes during any one turn; the number of intended pumps is declared before the start of each player's turn and cannot be changed. Players must pump the KaBoom! Machine at least once on their turn - it is forbidden to pass a turn.

If the balloon does not burst, the player's scorepeg is moved the appropriate number of holes on the scoreboard. Scorepegs cannot land on occupied holes. If a player's scorepeg lands on a star on the scoreboard they MUST go again.

If the balloon bursts at any time, the scorepeg of the player who bursts the balloon is moved back 20 holes. A new balloon is placed in the KaBoom! Machine and the next player has their turn.

The first player to reach finish is the winner.

name: The Game of Life: Goals
description:
You can't control the cards you're dealt, but you can choose what to do with them. Build you Life Story by placing Choice cards in front of you - score the most points by achieving Life Goals, staying true to your Lifestyle card, and living life to the fullest.

—from the publisher's description

name: Pairamid
description:
Ancient Egyptians hid treasures in their pyramids, and protected them with dangerous traps. Each player picks a pair of colors, and either gains or loses coins based on where those researchers land. Support your team colors and delay the others to win!

Unlike other games, you do not play a single color in Pairamid. Each player always plays in two colors, and these are indicated by Pyramid Markers placed in front of each player. You might share Pyramid colors with another player.

The first player rolls all the dice, and selects one die to place on the board -- the die does not need to match your own color! The player places the die on the matching square on the board, then moves the matching researcher the number of spaces indicated on the die. The player then passes the remaining dice to the next player.

When moving a researcher:

- Spaces occupied by another researcher are jumped over and are not counted.
- If the researcher reaches a space with either the White Scarab or Black Scarab, they stop on that space.

The White Scarab will always be in a white chamber, which will have a positive score listed on the board. When a researcher is moved to a space with the White Scarab, all players with a Pyramid Marker matching the color of the researcher receive the number of Treasure Tokens indicated on the board. Similarly, the Black Scarab will always be in a black chamber, and all players with a Pyramid Marker matching a researcher in a chamber with the Black Scarab will lose the number of Treasure Tokens indicated on the board. In both cases, this causes the Scarab to be moved to the next chamber matching its color (from +1 to +2 to +3 and so on for the White Scarab, and from -1 to -2 to -3 and so on for the Black Scarab).

The Great Chamber may be used as a shortcut by one researcher at a time. It is also the final room for both Scarabs, counting as +7 as well as -7. When a researcher enters the Great Chamber after a Scarab has been placed there, that color is scored as normal (+7 or -7 for the matching color), and the game ends. The player with the most Treasure Tokens wins!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Working in Teams, Planning Ahead, Evaluating Options
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: FrÃ©gate noire
description:
Relive the ancient Course times, with a tormented historical episode, where the king himself elected the Corsairs. Its up to you to retrieve the torch of Jean Bart, René Duguay-Trouin, Surcouf…

Aim of the game: to become the richest and most respected of all Corsairs.

name: Das Alte Reich
description: Das alte Reich is a trick taking card game, where players try to win events by playing rulers with the right characteristics.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Medieval, Napoleonic, Renaissance

name: Telling Lies
description: There are 336 Telling Lies cards, 56 players cards; Tell the Truth or Tell a Lie. Players take it in turns to read a question and answer it according to the Truth/Lie card they draw. The other players must question them and then decide if the player is lying or not. get it right and you gain 1 point. Get it wrong and you might lose 1 point. Typical questions are; You witness a robbery. The robber is your boss's son. Do you forget what you saw?

name: Bizingo
description: Each player controls 18 pieces - 16 men and two captains. The aim is to surround the opponent and to reduce the opponent to two pieces.
publishers: (Public Domain), Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore), Geoludie, Mitra, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Kon-tiki
description:
Kon-tiki is a game that casts players as the crew of a raft as it makes an epic journey across the Pacific Ocean from Peru to a Polynesian island (re-enacting Thor Heyerdahl's voyage in 1947). A competitive atmosphere is in place as the players bid to prove their worth on the journey by accomplishing Duties and navigating through whirlpools.

A network of arrows make up the routes from start to finish. Each player equal numbers of counters (of all colors); they move the raft up to 3 arrows (and only along their direction) on their turns by using up counters of the same color as shown on the last whirlpool traversed (the initial departure from Peru can use counters of any color). When the raft moves onto a whirlpool, it must stop there. The active player receives a Navigational Certificate and changes the direction of the whirlpool's arrows and its color. Aside from these certificates, players can receive Duty cards if they land the raft on an arrow that is connected to the Duty tiles placed on the board.

The game ends when the raft reaches the island of Raroio. The players sum up the points given for their Navigation Certificates and sets of Duty cards. The winner is the one with the most points.
publishers: Aristospel, CapiÃ©pa Ãditeur: Jeux Ãducatifs, Majora, Spear's Games

name: La Grande Corsa
description:
A sort of "game of goose" (or "snake and ladders").
It has no board, but a deck of cards (square tiles), shuffled and put face down to form the track at the beginning of the game: the first player landing on each card reveals it and follows the given instructions (e.g. "move one space backward", "nothing happens", "reach the last player", etc.); these effects are valid for the rest of the game.
Each player has a pawn (shaped as a car) starting at one end of the track. The goal of the game is to bring your pawn to the other end of the track.
To play, you simply roll a six-sided die, move your pawn exactly that number of spaces forward and execute the instructions on the card you've reached. After that, it's the turn of the next player.
Thus there's no decision to take in the whole game: simply roll the die and hope.
The track made with cards acts as a "modular board" (it is different in every game).
The game was licensed by the Walt Disney Company and so the cards show some of the famous Disney characters.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Boum!
description: In Boum! players compete in a closed arena, planting bombs against each other. Boum! uses simple and easy-to-learn rules, and different special powers guarantee a great variety of different tactics to the game. No player is eliminated until the end of the game, and situation reversals are frequent.

name: Winx Club Magisch Bordspel
description:
This is a game based on the TV show Winx Club and is meant for ages 6 and up.

The aim of the game is to be the first to finish the complete path of the board. This board contains 2 parts, one round for each of the 3 Colleges and an external round, common for all players.

Each player gets 5 cards from the stack with "Magic"- cards, 2 cards from the stack with Special Cards. The cards should be kept hidden from the other players.

Each player rolls the 6 sided die and moves his pawn accordingly on the board. After finishing the inner College round, the route goes further around the outer board. The first player to reach the circle numbered 66 is the winner of the game.

On several places on the board there are things happening which can influence the course of the game. Some duals have to be solved with the aid of "Special"-cards, or questions have to be answered from the stack with "Fairy, Witch or Specialist"-cards.

The "Magical"-cards represent the ingredients needed for the spells.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monochrom
description: Abstract two-player game with short playing time. Connect all your pieces on the board. You can move in a straight line, but you cannot stop before you hit an obstacle. But you can bring one adjacent piece with you.

name: Modern Chess
description:
A Chess variant similar to Ministers Chess, yet different. The board is 9x9 and there are 36 pieces, including another pawn for each side and a new piece called a Minister. There is also a standard Queen flanking the king, with the Minister located immediately on the King's opposite side.

The Minister combines the move of the Knight and Bishop, choosing to move one way or the other each time, but not both simultaneously. This is a unique addition to the game, and is a great complement to the Queen's movement. In this way the game is different from Minister's Chess, and considerably so as a result.

Minister's Chess has the 9x9 board and adds a pawn and another Queen to each side, but renames the Queen piece to Minister. However, all Ministers move just like the standard Queen.

name: Monopoly: Harley-Davidson Legendary Bikes
description:
From the Manufacturer:

The ultimate board game and a must have collectible for the Harley-Davidson enthusiast, this game incorporates buying, selling and trading the all-time greatest motorcycles in a quest to own the most legendary bikes in Harley-Davidson history.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Box Cars
description:
“Train-themed Dice-and-scoring game for one or more players. Use 10 sided dice. 10 dice are required.”

A player starts his turn by rolling 10 dice. The player then has the option to re-roll up to eight of the dice, then up to six, then up to four, and finally re-rolling up to two. The resulting combination of numbers are scored using the names of train cars. A full game consists of five turns. The highest scoring player wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Boa Viagem
description:
Boa Viagem (Portuguese for "Have a Nice Trip"): A trip around the world in a funny competition game.

At the start of the game, each player receives a card with the destinations they have to visit in the game. Players must start at Iberian Peninsula and travel around the world collecting souvenirs of the indicated destinations received in their initial card.

Players have to plan their routes using roads, boats and plains paying attention to their money to avoiding spending all their money and consequently loose the game.

The player that will win is the first player who visit all the destinations of his card and return to the starting point.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: Kikker Speelt Tikkertje
description:
The Frog plays ticker with his friends: Pig, Hare, Rat and Duck. Try to catch an another player or run away.The first one who arrives the boat wins the game.
The game can be played indoor as well as outdoor. There is a soft dice, 10 chips and 5 pawns.

name: Monopoly: Denver Edition
description:
With majestic mountains outlining the skyline, Denver is the jewel of the Rockies. From it's rough and tumble days when the gold mining town played host to the legendary Buffalo Bill Cody and Calamity Jane, Denver has grown into a major metropolis worthy of its capitol stature.
Now you can explore the Mile High City and marvel at its wealth of resources as you buy, sell and trade prime Denver real estate. While you may already own Frontier Airlines, consider purchasing the gateway to the Rockies, the Denver International Airport. Strolling through historic LoDo and Larimer Square, you may negotiate a trade for Cadillac Ranch or pocket the landmark Union Station.
Control the Denver Mint and you may have the collateral to purchase Coors Field or the Denver Broncos. Or, Denver's wealth of arts and leisure properties may be more to your liking. In that case, collect the Denver Art Museum, distinguished for its American Indian art and purchase the fabulously floral Denver Botanic Gardens. Monkey around with the Denver Zoo, renowned for its Primate Panorama.
Avail yourself of the world class shopping at Cherry Creek Mall or step into the shoes of a hotel magnate as you buy and sell the Adam's Mark, the Inverness Hotel and Golf Club and the historic Brown Palace. Instead of merely browsing the aisles, as a Monopoly game power broker you can new wheel and deal King Soopers and Tattered Cover Book Store.
Denver has never been more accessible and its real estate market has never been more exciting. Capture the entrepreneurial spirit of the Old West and experience the excitement of the Mile High City with the Denver Edition of the Monopoly Game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: S'match
description:
A Memory Matching Game with a Spin!
A new take on the classic memory game, S'Match challenges young players to find matching pairs by color, number or category. Only here, it's the S'Match Spinner that decides which way to match-and every player gets a spin! Pictures and words allow pre-readers and early readers to play together and enjoy hours of memory-building fun.

name: IngeniÃ¸rspillet
description:
"The player who most closely resembles Albert Einstein starts the game"

OVERVIEW:
A quiz game for engineers, with questions related to exact sciences only. Therefore, this is NOT a trivia game per se. The questions on the cards are designed to please both engineers, science fans and technology enthusiasts. According to BÃ¥rd Gamnes, one of the designers, the difficulty of questions are meant for "those who are about to start with their higher education".

The questions on the cards are divided into six different terms:

Power and Forces
Chemistry and Biology
Computers and Gadgets
Experiments and Explosions
Numbers
Engineer Mix


GAME:
After each player or team has placed their token in the middle and thus "outside" the primary playing area (much as in Pachisi), the players take turns rolling the die and moving their token onto the orbital game area, starting on one of the six rhombic fields of choice. Now and on each following turn every player may choose which way he wants to move his token on the orbital playing area. Each field the player stops on, except one that gives the player allowance to re-roll the die, is linked to a category, which another player asks him by reading from the top card from the question-card deck.

There are six fields that are obligatory to visit to collect point cards, one for each category. After that the player must try to stop on of the six rhombus shaped areas to access the middle area again, where they started. Now the player is challenged in two different and randomly chosen categories, and he needs to answer correct on both two win.

The game is for 2 - 4 teams or players.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Coconuts
description:
Coconuts pits elephants against cats, and cats against mice, and mice against elephants – all while the marmosets sit on the sidelines and mind their own business.

To set up the game, four "victory" cards are laid out on the table, each with a color-coded "coconut" on top. The deck of cards – which contains nine each of elephant, cat and mouse, along with three marmosets – is shuffled and placed in front of the dealer, a position that rotates each round.

In a round, the dealer deals three cards face-down to different players (except when only two are in the game). Players reveal these cards simultaneously, then they must quickly determine which animal is victorious among those revealed – elephant, cat, mouse, "no winner" – and grab the correct coconut. If a player does so, he claims the cards revealed; if he goofs, he receives a penalty point. Collect three of these, and you're booted out of the jungle.

When the deck runs out, the game ends. Players score three points for each marmoset collected, one point for each other animal and negative one point for each penalty. High score wins.

The game includes two variants: In one, six "disguise" cards are mixed into the deck, and when a disguise is turned up, then for that round all cats are instead mice (or elephants are cats, etc.) In the second variant, the disguise cards are used along with defense cards, such as an elephant depicted with cheese; in this case, the cheese distracts the mice, so the mice will lose to elephants. Four cards are revealed each round instead of three.

name: Krims-krams
description:
Game description from the publisher:

What a mess! Squirrel Sammy Walnut likes to collect trinkets, and they are piled up all over the place in his home. The bicycle helment is in the refrigerator and the toothbrush underneath the sofa. It's time to clean up! But what will fit in which box? Only the one who helps Sammy to tidy up and find the corresponding boxes for the colors things will receive the valuable nut coins!

In Krimskrams, the players help Sammy to tidy up his trinkets. All the various things are different sizes, however, and each will fit only in one specific box. Sammy has to go from box to box to see what might fit and then place the corresponding piece. To get that nut coin as a reward, the item must fit perfectly. The first player to collect five nut coins wins!

name: Dueling Dice
description:
Roll the Master Die to determine the "Point", then its off to the races as everybody rolls their 3 dice at once to score first! Roll High, Low, Odds, Evens, 3 of a Kind, or a Straight to win.

Roll the Master Die to determine what everyone is rolling for: odds, evens, three low, three high, low straight, or high straight. Players all roll at the same time and each player may "hold out" die as they roll the correct number. For example if you are going for "odds" and you roll a 1, you can place it aside and keep rolling to get the 3 and the 5. First player to get the correct roll, moves his/her marker along the score track. First to the finish, wins.

name: Slangology
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Slangology, one player draws a card that shows several slang words and definitions. That player acts as a "judge" for the round and reads one of the words aloud. Each player then writes a definition.

The judge then reads all of the definitions (including the actual correct one) aloud, without revealing which player wrote what. Then all players vote on which definition they believe is correct, which may be correct and which one they believe is definitely not correct by placing tokens with values of 3 points, 2 points and -1 point. Players earn points when other players believe theirs is correct, so the more believable the "definition" the better!

In the next round, another player acts as judge and this time, the definition is read and all players must invent their own slang word to match the definition.

name: Atmosfear: The Ultimate Conflict
description:
Atmosfear: The Ultimate Conflict combines Atmosfear: The Harbingers with Atmosfear: The Soul Rangers, for the ultimate challenge. A VHS tape is used to time the game, but the timers have a greater challenge than time itself.

Your first challenge is to defeat the Gatekeeper, guardian of The Other Side, and host of "The Harbingers". He plays dirty, and plays to win. Players build the game board and race to choose their Harbinger and gain powers, and then fight to collect six keys which will allow them to face their greatest fear. Those who fail to become Harbingers in time will become Soul Rangers, who can only steal keys from other players.

After defeating the Gatekeeper, you can flip the reversible board over and meet your new host. The demented dentist, Dr Mastiff, leader of "The Soul Rangers". The Dr. now challenges you to lose all your keys and make your way back home. But the only way to lose your keys is to give them to the other Soul Rangers by duelling them.

Each game is complete within one hour, and no game is ever the same twice...
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers
publishers: A Couple 'A Cowboys, Mattel, Inc., Spear's Games

name: U Koryta
description:
Boardgame "U Koryta" is a satire of political and social issues, the realities of the political fictional world, localized somewhere between the fall of the Fourth Republic and the birth of Fifth Republic.
Players take the role of gray eminences. They leads political parties and their choices affect both the shape the political scene, but also the condition of the state.

http://www.bellringer.pl/u-koryta,3.html
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Point to Point Movement, Voting

name: Face Friend
description:
Face Friend is a lovely party game. Players will add friends just like what they have done in Facebook. The more they add friends, the higher marks they get in the game. The highest total friend cards score is the Winner.

The game is turn-based.
1. Play an action card
2. Can have different option:
(a) select one unrevealed card from common area to their own collection; or
(b) pick up one revealed card from common area to their own collection.
(c) end turn and pass to the left player.

Players cannot skip their turn on collecting friend card.


When friend cards exhaused in common area, the round ends and start a new round. The game ends after three game round has completed. The highest total friend cards score is the Winner.

name: Playa Playa
description:
Quickly, the coast is in danger! A lot of waste has been abandoned on the beach and there is a risk they are being swept away by the waves.
Find the hidden marine animals from the garbage and move the waste in the correct bins before the sea rises!

In his turn player rolls the die and acts accordingly:
If it shows "animal" - the player turns around a waste tile.
If the same type of animal is under that tile player may trash the waste. If not He puts the tile back on the board.
If it shows "trach can" - the player may trash any tile from the board.
If it shows "waves" - the sea rises a little bit.

If the players find all the animals under the waste they win together.
If the sea level rises so much that the waste pollutes the sea then the players lose.

name: Shootout! The High Noon Card Game
description:
Shootout! The High Noon Card Game casts you and your friends as cowboys in the wild west. The most dangerous duelist is the one who makes the best hand possible. Once you've got the best weapons, the most impressive title, and familiarized yourself with your foe, you'll want to pick a fight with someone else at the table- If they don't come looking for trouble before you're ready for 'em. Experience tense, high-stakes western duels as players square off one by one until the last gunslinger standing wins. It is best suited for 2-6 players ages 9 and up and a round takes about 5 minutes per player.

To begin every player is dealt five cards. Each turn a player reveals a card, draws a card, and discards a card before the turn passes to the next. The heart of the game is the information a player gives about what they are already holding by what they choose to take and what they discard. Using this information (or misinformation, at the highest levels of play) allows you to improve your chances by reading your opponent and evaluating your options-- It's basically the super-exciting high-stakes game of poker that only exists in the movies.

The lean, 88-card deck has been balanced to a very deliberate point to make it an ideal family game. Special cards are very clear and provide their entire ruels explanation on them in order to keep the fun moving along. The elements of chance allow children, grandparents, and those totally unfamiliar with games to still have a fair chance of turning things around and winning in the end without leaving the outcome purely to chance like many other family games. This game was built from the start to provide fast, clear, fun gameplay that rewards investment without demanding any from the player. The game is light on text and appropriate for all ages.
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination

name: Outchasers
description:
Outchasers is a 1v1 strategy card game where players pick a mech and pilot and battle each other over a resource called ‘cores’. Players use equipment cards to build weapons and armor, strike their opponent directly, and collect Cores which give lasting benefits until they can destroy their opponent. Alternatively, if a player can collect five cores before their mech is destroyed, they win the game.

Within the 72 card Outchasers starter pack is everything 2 people need to play the game; 6 Pilots and 6 Mechs to combine however you choose, 5 of 10 Cores randomly placed into each game, and 48 Equipment cards split between each player. With multiple strategic formats of varying difficulties, every single head-to-head match offers the perfect balance of strategy and luck to make sure each game is a unique experience, all brought to life by the amazing art of Brett Nienburg.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Land of Rivals
description:
Land of Rivals is a confrontation game inspired in a fantastic world called Khaos, where players command creatures of different factions. These creatures need some energy from their world to live, but the source of energy is consuming, and so their lives...But they had discovered that if they fight against each other they can take up the energy from their prey. So that's the time for each faction in Khaos to destroy the others to survive one more day and show the supremacy!

To do that, players must expand the playable world adding hex-pieces to the table and calling some creatures to move through them. When they reach any rival creature, using cards, they must combat them until the enemy faction has expired their faction points. Only one can live in Khaos!


Land of Rivals es un juego de confrontación de ambientación fantástica donde los jugadores comandan a las criaturas de una de las facciones que habitan el antiguo mundo de Khaos. Estas criaturas necesitan de la energía de este mundo para existir pero, actualmente se consume y su fuente de vida con él. Debido a la falta de esta materia vital, las criaturas han encontrado otra forma de subsistir, destruir toda forma de vida en Khaos y absorber su energía. Ahora, las pocas facciones supervivientes luchan sin cuartel entre ellas por sobrevivir un día más. Ponte en la piel de una de ellas y ¡lucha!
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Karma: Ã·+-Ã=
description:
There are persons who like numbers, for whom the letters represent a "Karma" in his lives. On the opposite side there are persons who prefer the words and the numbers are an absolute Karma.

In this game there are 104 tiles with letters on one side and numbers/math symbols on the other. In the first stage of the game you should first put all the 104 tiles on the table in a random order with the letters face up, forming a 10x10 square + 4 extra tiles at the sides of rows 4 and 6 (two extra tiles per row). Then you and your opponent will shift turns for moving your tokens for picking the tiles (you pick the tiles where your token was at the start of the move).
After there are no more tiles to pick with legal movements then is the start of the stage 2.

In the stage 2 you should form words using your picked tiles. Every player will form his own personal board with his tiles, using scrabble-like rules. The more letters used and words formed the better score you will get.

In the stage 3, the players must use the same tiles but with the numbers/symbol faced up and using the same scrabble-like rules to form equations. And again, the more tiles used and equations formed, the better score you will get.

The winner is the player with most point after adding score of both stages 2 and 3.

The game can also start with the numbers/symbols faced up on the stage 1. In this case, the "stage 3" will be the second one and the "stage 2" will be the last one.

name: Atekko Tsuitate (ãã¦ã£ãã¤ããã¦)
description:
User summary
ãã¦ã£ãã¤ããã¦ (Atekko Tsuitate) is a guessing game.

At the beginning of the game, a theme is randomly determined. Each player write down an answer that relates to the theme on a small white-board, and passes the board to another player. That player stands the board so that only other players can see the answer.

Each turn, you may ask a yes/no question about the answer given to you, and other players respond to it with a thumb up/down. When you are sure what your answer is, you may call out your guess. You win the game if you correctly guessed your answer before everyone else does.

Publisher's summary
èªåã«å²ãæ¯ããããé¡ï¼ãã¨ãã°ãå¯¿å¸ï¼ãå½ã¦ãããã«é ããã«ä»ãã¬ã¤ã¤ã¼å¨å¡ã«è³ªåããã¦ï¼ã¯ã/ããã/ããããªãã®ãã³ããµã¤ã³ã§ç­ãããããã®ï¼ãã®åç­ã«ãã£ã¦ç­ããçµã£ã¦ããã

name: Takie Å»ycie 4: NiezwykÅe przypadki
description:
In Mind Maze players will be told a story and must figure out why and how the story happened by asking questions that can be answered with "Yes" or "No". The person telling the story can also choose to answer with “Not Important” if players start getting too far off track.

Mind Maze allows players to test their skills of deduction and investigation, and to get to the bottom of the mystery with as few questions as possible. Players take turns asking questions, and lose a point for every question they ask. Points can be gained by asking specific key questions which also help players to figure out the true version of the story. This encourages players to think carefully about the questions they ask and to work together.

This is 4th edition of Mind Maze, edited especially for Polish market.

Description from the publisher:

Wieje nudÄ? Jedziecie samochodem? PociÄgiem? Czekacie na samolot? Czekacie aÅ¼ piÄty gracz wyjdzie z Åazienki lub wróci ze sklepu, byÅcie mogli w koÅcu zaczÄÄ graÄ w grÄ juÅ¼ rozÅoÅ¼onÄ na stole? ;)

WyciÄgnijcie "Takie Å»ycie!"

Jeden z Was dobiera losowÄ kartÄ.
Czyta krótkÄ, acz niezwykÅÄ historiÄ, ale wspóÅgraczom ujawnia tylko wskazany kawaÅek.
A teraz wspóÅgracze zadajÄc pytania muszÄ dojÅÄ do tego, co tak naprawdÄ siÄ wydarzyÅo!
OczywiÅcie nie jest to proste, bo historie, mimo, Å¼e wydarzyÅy siÄ naprawdÄ to sÄ czasami naprawdÄ niewiarygodne! Dlatego kaÅ¼da z nich ma kilka kluczowych pytaÅ zaznaczonych na karcie, które, jeÅli zostanÄ zadane przez odgadujÄcych, nie tylko dajÄ im punkty, ale przede wszystkim pozwalajÄ im zrozumieÄ, Å¼e podÄÅ¼ajÄ wÅaÅciwym tropem!
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Rebel Sp. z o.o.

name: Kabuki
description:
Players are divided into two teams. Each team must take a situation, character, and challenge cards. Then, they must invent a history based on those elements and finally act them.
The winner will be the team that had accomplished the largest number of situations.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bluffing Billionaires
description:
Become the richest billionaire alive! Bluff your way to keep your assets and outwit your opponent to bankrupt them while you're ahead.

Each turn in Bluffing Billionaires, the active player must play an asset card from their hand face-down to the table, claiming to be the richest billionaire with the highest card on the table. If the active player has a previously played face-down card, discard that card face-down to their own discard pile. If there are no other face-down cards on the table, the turn then passes clockwise and the next player on the left becomes the active player. If there are any other face-down asset card(s) on the table, the owner(s) of those cards may approve or challenge the active player by performing agreed gestures simultaneously, such as thumbs up or thumbs down.

Approve (Thumb Up) : You believe the active player played a higher card than yours, and therefore did not wish to challenge them. If all other players approves unanimously, the turn passess clockwise and the next player become the active player.

Challenge (Thumb Down) : You DON’T believe the active player played a higher card than yours, and therefore wish to call their bluff. More than one player might challenge the active player simultaneously.

Challenge
When a challenge occurs, all challengers flip over their last played Asset cards to compare the value individually with the active player who then will also flip over their card. Two outcomes are possible:

If the active player’s card is not higher than a challenger’s card, hence falsely claiming to be richer, the active player lose against that challenger.

If the active player’s card is higher than the challenger’s card, hence proofing his claim, the active player wins against that challenger.

The winner of a challenge then take a random card from the loser’s hand, placing it face-up on a separate Bonus pile as a compensation that will be scored at the end of the game as bonus Points. Additionally, if there is only one challenger, the winner of the challenge also take the loser’s revealed card, placing it face-up on the Bonus pile.

The active player might have mixed results in a challenge, winning against one challenger, but losing to another, which is completely normal. Resolve each result in clockwise player order starting from the active player.

After a Challenge had completely resolved, discard all cards revealed this turn to their owner's Discard pile and the play then passes to the next player on the left of the Target player.

End Game & Scoring
When an active player plays the last card from their hand, the game immediately ends and scoring begins.

All Asset cards still held in hands scores as many Points as their listed face-value. Plus, count all the Coin symbols from other player’s cards that you keep in your Bonus pile as bonus Points.

The player with the biggest Points is the winner and become the new Bluffing Billionaire. In case of a tie, the player with more sum of Coin symbols wins. In case of further tie, all tied players share the victory or play again to determine the real winner!

name: Das verdrehte Labyrinth: Happy Meal Edition
description: Das verdrehte Labyrinth - Happy Meal Edition is a miniature version of the original Das verdrehte Labyrinth. This game was distributed as part of the McDondald's Happy Meals Menu.

name: Crime Wave
description:
Summary
A fast paced easy to learn game that is fun for the whole family. Be the first to collect five diamonds and prove that you are the ultimate criminal. Each player has a limited amount of time to build a criminal empire and build up their cash reserves so that they can out bid their opponents for the coveted diamonds.
Each player will take on the role of Kingpin, Fence, Pickpocket, and Corrupt Politician to prove that they the are the best at being bad.

Game play
As soon as the dealer is ready, they start the timer. They do not have to wait for the rest of the players to be ready. As soon as the timer is started the dealer begins drawing cards one at a time from the Crime Card deck and either giving it to the player to their left or adding it to their hand and giving the player to their left a card from their hand. This continues with cards being passed around the circle this way until time runs out.
Once time runs out, starting with the dealer each player takes a turn biding for one of the diamonds. One at a time each player states the value of their bid and places the cards that they are using for their bid face down in front of them. Each bid must consist of only one type of Crime Card. You cannot have a mix of cards with different values. Once all the players have bid, the player with the highest remaining bid wins and takes a diamond from the middle pile. The first player to accumulate five diamonds wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Badmoji
description: Compete against your fellow filthy minded friends in a race to guess the lewd phrase using the iconic language of Badmoji. The player with the most points at the end of two full rounds is the winner.

name: Avocadogs
description:
A fast paced game of pun decoding chaos. Each card is a pun pairing two words to create something never before seen. With one pocket-sized, pub-friendly set of cards you can battle your friends in four different ways. The games vary in length, complexity and wildness to suit your every mood.
Each card combines 2 of 6 categories: animals, food, vehicles, body parts, clothing and places
Game 1: Juicy. Players must collect the most sets by picking up cards from the draw pile and stealing from their competitors in turn. Sets can be 5 cards with a single category match or 3 cards with a double category match
Game 2: Natter. A team based party game where players must describe the characters without using any of the words on the card. Followed by rounds using a single word description, and then acting
Game 3: Throwdown. A race to get rid of your cards, by matching one of the categories on your card to one of the piles on the table. Getting a double category match freezes your competitors in place for 5 seconds whilst you continue to play.
Game 4: Ransack. The fastest game option, a set collection game where all players can steal from each others hands whilst other cards continuously appear on the table. The player to collect the most sets of matching category cards wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Supermarket Sweep
description:
It’s non-stop shop ‘til you drop with the all-new Supermarket Sweep game, based on America’s hit game show. Play at home with friends and family – this game is made for 3+ players. Play as a contestant or take charge as the host! Race to grab the priciest items you can find! This game features question categories from the TV show. Download the Gamestar App to scan your items using the FREE Supermarket Sweep Buzzer and Checkout Scanner. Answer questions to win time for your own Big Sweep where you’ll compete in a frantic free-for-all to find the most expensive items to fill your cart. The highest cart total gets to take on the $100,000 Super Sweep and be commemorated in the Aisle of Champions.

Includes: 1 scoreboard, 3 team answer boards, 1 host board, 20 game sheets, 1 host question category guide, 166 Big Sweep item cards, 100 Super Sweep cards, 20 shopping list cards, 6 inflatables cards, 4 dry-erase markers, 1 phone holder, 3 carts, 1 Aisle of Champions scoreboard, and rules.

name: Nocturnally
description:
It is night in the forest. It is so dark that the young night animals cannot find their parents! Together with Firefly and Glowworm we will help them out. Can we reunite all the night animals before the sun rises?

Nocturnally is an exciting and challenging variation on the well known Memory game. The players help each other to remember the cards. Several levels of play guarantee many joyful hours!

name: Secret Number
description:
Secret Number is a deduction game from Japan.

The publisher says:
Players are dealt two number cards each, and the object of the game is to reveal one of the two number cards not dealt and guess the number of the one not revealed. Players add, subtract, multiply or divide the two numbers dealt to them and reveal the result of their calculation. The game is a game of calculation and deduction in which players try to guess a hidden number based on the results of calculations revealed by other players.

publisher's summary

name: Quart de Singe
description:
An exciting game of letters and bluff! Put letters on the table, but make sure there's a word containing them all. Use the special cards to trick your opponents into bluffing. The first player to win 4 Quarter Monkeys wins the game!

Components : 100 cards, 25 tokens, 1 hourglass

Heavily based on the eponymous public domain game.

name: iKnow Edycja Rodzinna
description:
A family version of a popular quiz game iKnow. ("Edycja Rodzinna" is Polish for "Family Edition".)

Like in other games from this series, to win you need more than knowledge. You have to know your opponents well in order to predict how they will answer their questions. In the family edition of iKnow, this factor is more important than it was before, because you will not only bet if your opponent answers correctly or not, but also you will have a chance to outsmart your rivals. In this edition, you choose one out of four answers.

name: Nines
description:
Nines is a simple game that uses two decks of standard cards with jokers included, and is based almost entirely on luck.

Players are dealt nine cards each, and they proceed to line them up into three vertical columns (3 cards per column). They each then turn over two cards that are in different columns.

The goal of Nines is to have the fewest points at game end by getting columns with matching cards (e.g. three 4's in one column). Matching cards in a column essentially "cancels out" that column and the total value of those three cards is zero.

After all cards are dealt, a single card is flipped over from the top of the draw pile. Starting to the left of dealer, a player's turn consists of drawing a single card either from the discard pile or the draw deck. If the player takes a card from the draw deck, they may look at it and either discard it or replace one of the cards in their current play area (can replace either face up or face down). If they choose to replace a card, they have to discard the one they replaced. Taking a card from the discard pile means they have to replace one of their cards, and then discard the one they replaced.

The game end is triggered when one person has all of their cards turned face up. Then, every other person gets one more turn. On this final turn, players do get the option of turning one of their own cards over.

After the game is over, the players turn over any face down cards. If a face down card matches the face up cards in its column, that column of cards counts as zero points. All points are then tallied.

The cards all have different values. Jokers are worth negative three points, aces and kings are both worth zero points, jacks and queens are ten points each, and the numbered cards have point values equal to the number on the card.

name: Bad Decisions
description:
Bad Decisions introduces a new line of party card games from Diamond Dust Dreams Inc., the creators of Kitsune: of Foxes and Fools. Because of the MadLibs-inspired storytelling twist to this game, each prompt (Story) card can set up literally hundreds of different situations. The judge (called the Bard, in keeping with the storytelling theme) plays cards for whichever of the categories (Fool, Crisis or Bad Decision) come up in the first two blanks on that Story card; the other Players complete the story by anonymously playing a card from their hands to fill the final blank. The Bard chooses the winning Story ending, and passes the role of Bard on to the next Player to the left.

Because you can't make the dumbest stories up, the cards in the core set have themes of bad decisions in headline news and technology, the latter being decided on by a vote of the kickstarter backers. Both themes are populated by hilariously wrong cards drawn from news stories and anecdotes researched from various online and print sources, or sometimes personally related to the creators of the game.

name: Bike About
description:
From the Box:

Travel the countryside with your friends in this fun-filled cycling game. It's unique too because there are no dice involved!

Each player has to visit five different destinations - perhaps a castle up in the mountains, a lake in the country, or a Punch and Judy show down by the sea. It certainly isn't easy though, because there are only two bikes for up to six players. Everyone keeps trying to pedal them in opposite directions and players don't know whether they're coming or going!

The first player to bike round to all his destinations is the winner.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Disturbed Friends: Suicide Deck
description:
The Suicide Deck is an expansion to Disturbed Friends that contains 40 Question Cards, 8 unique #WINNING cards, and a set of 4 bloody player cards.

It was initially available through Kickstarter as an addon to the Disturbed Friends game.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Noble Celts
description: Noble Celts is a circular chess boardgame that is played exactly like regulation Chess. There are 64 circles corresponding to the 64 squares. Diagonal moves are made along lines that spiral into and out of the center of the board. Pieces are set up along the outside of the circle and around the center ring, and play is inward or outward. The lack of a side edge to what, if uncurled, would be a normal chess board makes for very exciting play.

name: The Wild West: The Range Wars of 19th Century America
description:
The Wild West (TWW) is a game in which each player is a cattle rancher in the American West (mid 19th century), each of whom is trying to extend his “spread” to get access to the resources he needs as well as increasing his worth. TWW can be played by from two to five players. The game plays somewhat differently based on the number of players involved, but it should take about three hours.

Rustling, Poker Games, Gunfights and the Railroad are all contained in this game of the American West.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding

name: King's Cottage
description: The King has gathered his trusty advisers and has instructed them to build him a cottage down by the river. Of course it will have to be furnished as well. The advisers recognize this as a great opportunity for personal gain, and run off to shuffle their investments in the four local craft houses before the construction begins. Then as the cottage is still going up, the advisers scurry to furnish the place in the most expensive pieces that will best benefit their investments. Of course, the King is not a man to let his exquisite taste in decor go to waste, so after a couple of months he shows up to lend a hand, and some praise. After four months the cottage is completed and the craft houses receive their payments and the advisers collect their investments.

name: MiniCity
description: As hard workers of the colony, the ant players of MiniCity want to build up stocks in different colored food. While doing this, they are always anxious to control the pantries matching the color of the food stuff, but there's a lot of traffic on the streets, so only those who have the right movement cards in hand can make good progress. Whoever stores all their food first wins!

name: La Casa de Papel: Escape Game 2
description:
After your sensational robbery of the Spanish banknote printing house, you now face a new challenge!
You have a double goal: steal the gold reserves of the Spanish National Bank and free Rio. Again the professor will guide you. So follow his instructions - and you will be rich and free!
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Picture Charades
description: Too young to read? No problem! Picture Charades makes it easy for the wee ones to act out. The best part - the pictures are open to interpretation, and it's up to the children to decide what they are supposed to be acting. Lets kids develop critical thinking skills while having oodles of fun!

name: Atlas Adventures
description:
How quickly can you rebuild your world map? Atlas Adventures is simple in concept. All you have to do is replicate the map of the world on your playing board. Seems easy enough. But beware! Continents or oceans may have to be traded with other players and advanced players have to answer challenging multiple-choice questions to earn a continent, sea or ocean.

Learn and improve your knowledge of the world in this geography and general knowledge based game. With 2 different levels perfect for 7+ and 12+ players, this game is great to play with the whole family. So do you know your maracas from your mojitos? This game is made from recycled materials. All questions are in English, French and Spanish.

Players 2 - 4 players or teams,
Ages 7 -107,
Contains 48 puzzle pieces, 4 player boards, 200 question cards, 1 spinner, 1 rule booklet,

name: Medellin 1809
description:
Game with Alea Magazine issue 16.

Shadow of the Eagle (La Sombra del Aguila) is a series of games covering the battles of the Napoleonic Wars in Spain (1808-1814). A standard set of game rules is published with an exclusive set of rules for each game.

This game covers the battle of Medellin in 1809.

English rules translations are available.

Game System:
- scale = 250m/hex;
- time = 20 min/GT;
- strength = battaillons (inf), regiments (cav), batteries (art).

name: VÃ©gvÃ¡ri Viadalok
description:
Description from the gamebox:

Border Castle Battles

A strategic-historical game for children above 10. This is a stop-gap game in the sense that is provides exciting passtime activity for children above ten and even adults. The point is that the game enables you to re-play four campaigns of the 16th century /they took place actually/ with a relatively high degree of faithfulness to reality. This game is not the usual simple one you play with dice, it requires brains, tactics and good strategic ideas. If there are two players, one is the commander-in-chief of the Turkish army the other one is that of the Hungarian one. They take steps on the battlefield /the table/ which is authentic both historically and geographically.
While stepping forward - in line with their strategic ideas - they fight each other, protect or storm fortresses. In case of more players the countries may be divided among them, e.g. the players can be commanders of a Northern Hungarian castle or that of a Transdanubian fortress respectively...()
We sincerely hope that this short piece of information arouse your interest in this type of game outstanding also in its design, and being the first of its kind - since historical strategic games are just about to be spread in Hungary...()
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Hase HÃ¼pf
description:
Puzzle game for the youngest children.
There are 8 puzzles with 4 puzzle pieces and in 4 colors.
In turn player rolls the soft ball with 4 colors and take the puzzle-tile from the pile with the color ball is showing.
He must place the tile to correct puzzle.

name: Three Card Monte
description:
A quickfire card game based on the classic confidence trick. Keep your ACE hidden while you knock out opponents by guessing theirs.

Each player has three cards on the table placed face down. One ACE card and two DECOY cards. If your ACE card is taken by an opponent you are eliminated. If your opponent guesses a DECOY card then they are eliminated.

Each player has three cards in their hand. Everyone starts with a LOOK and a GUESS card as well as a third card drawn from the deck. Each turn you play only one card. If you choose to LOOK at an opponent's card this turn you will have to wait until your next turn to make a GUESS. Maybe they will use their next turn to try and knock you out, or play a SHUFFLE or BLOCK card to keep their ACE safe.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Don't Take My Word
description:
Letter cards are slowly turned one-by-one for all players to see. When you can spell a word, shout it out, take the cards, and place the word in front of you.

If no player can spell a word using the first three cards, deal additional cards until a word is found. You need not use all the revealed letters, but can use only as many of the letters as you need.

A player can also steal a word from another player at any time—Add letters to make a new word, or combine words from different players or from your own finished words.

name: Anaxi
description:
In Anaxi, players are presented with category prompts, and they want to think of words or phrases that fit multiple categories at the same time — but without matching another player's answers.

In each of five rounds, players draw a single blue, red and orange card. These round cards have clear plastic on one-third of them and a word written on the other two-thirds. Players overlap these cards on a scoring chart that shows the value of a word or phrase that encompasses two or three of these categories. Players have a limited amount of time to write down as many words or phrases as they can for each pair of categories and for all three categories. They then compare answers and score points for those answers unique to themselves.

Whoever has the most points after five rounds wins!

name: Metro
description: The Parisian metro is a true labyrinth. In Metro, you must assemble your metro line and be the first to reach your destination, taking as few connections as possible.

name: Gembatan
description:
You have been called to face worthy opponents in a contest of strategy and cunning. Armed with amulet tiles and dual-direction gems, your goal is to align colors to score points. You may only lay a tile if you have a matching gem to place within it, so plan your moves wisely. Legendary players align three or more amulets of a matching color to score bonus points. Earn the most points and you will be richly rewarded as the victor! For 2 to 4 players. Contains 60 tiles, 60 gems and rules.

—description from the publisher

name: UNO: Pirates of the Caribbean at World's End
description: This is a themed version of Uno based on the film "Pirates of the Caribbean at World's End." This version of Uno has a special card/rule which does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "Black Pearl" card.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Skunk Bingo
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Line up for Skunk Bingo, a game of log jammin' fun! Spin the spinner, then place a creature into the log. If any pop out the other side, add them to your board. Don't let the skunk nose his way in line or else he's sure to make a stink! Be the first to fill your board and enjoy the sweet smell of victory.

name: Fat Chance
description:
From the box:

Fat Chance is a rollicking game for children that nutrition-conscious parents will love. Players move Fat Man pawns around the colorful game board trying to collect as FEW junk food pounds as possible. But the temptations are many and it's hard to resist "pie a la mound", "mozzarella mess", "sunday driver" and the "tube steak special" (sic). What a combination - Ugh! Just imagine what you'll feel like after stuffing yourself with all that junk! (yuk!) If you are lucky, though, you'll be able to sweat off some of those pounds in the steam bath. Then if you challenge another Fat Man to a Weigh-In, he'll be the one to flip down the scale not you. What a relief because the fewer pounds you gain the better your chances are of winning the game of Fat Chance.

name: Jerry Kramer's Instant Replay
description:
The exciting strategy football game for "pro-watchers" of all ages"

"I'm proud to have had a part in the making of this game. While it is professional and realistic, the rules are simple enough that young and old can learn to play and enjoy it. Sharpen your competitive spirit, and good luck in outsmarting your opponent." - Jerry Kramer (former Green Bay Packer)

name: El desafÃ­o de la Historia
description:
[EN]
This is an standard trivia game... Roll, move and, depending on the area you are, answer a History question.

There are 6 different categories for the question cards: Ancient History, People, Medieval History, Arts & Literature, Modern & Contemporary History and Curiosities.

It was published & distributed by Spanish History magazine "Historia y vida" in 1998.

[ES]
Es un juego tipo trivia estándar. Tiras el dado, mueves y, dependiendo de la casilla en que estés, respondes a una pregunta de historia.

Hay 6 categorías diferentes para las tarjetas de preguntas: Historia Antigua, Personajes, Historia Medieval, Arte y Literatura, Historia Moderna y Contemporánea y Curiosidades.

El juego fue publicado y distribuido por la revista española de historia "Historia y Vida" en 1998.

name: Hacker
description:
From the publisher (translated):

To become rich, nothing easier than to crack into the bank computers and steal the money. To be the richest, this won't be enough as you will have to send over to your adversaries some virus so you can also rob them of their money. Just don't get caught as they might counter attack or neutralize you.

name: Fuddy Duddy
description:
Choices to make. Chances to take.

In this fast moving fun card game each player needs to be open to all possibilities. Be the first to collect 1,2,3,4 in one color and you've got a Fuddy and 20 points. Beware of dud numbers which count against your score unless you think you can collect them all and score a 40 point Fuddy Duddy! The first player to 100 points claims victory.

Available from http://www.made2Bplayed.com

name: Agentenjagd
description: In Agentenjagd, players are agents who must try to find the spy hiding in one of the cities on the board. At the beginning of the game, only the app knows where the spy is. Using various means of transportation, the agents search for the spy all over the world. By using action cards, the agents get valuable tips from the app that only they know.

name: The Buntu Circus
description:
The Buntu Circus was independently published by a group of UK gamers calling themselves The Buntu Circus. It is an abstract strategy game for 2 to 4 players. The board is divided into a 14 x 14 grid. Each square has a combination of one of eight colours and one of twelve symbols, arranged in a symmetrical pattern on the board.

A deck of cards has one card per square on the board, matching colour and symbol. Each player gets a hand of eight cards and a set of counters and rubber hoops in their own colour. These are metallic colours, distinct from the board colours.

In turn each player draws and then plays a card from their hand, placing or removing a counter on one of the appropriate squares on the board - each colour and symbol combination appears in two places on the board, and has two cards which can match.

The idea is to get a number of linked rows of five counters in your colour, orthogonally and/or diagonally. The target number of rows depends on the number of players - five in a two player game and less if there are more players. Once a row has been formed, it is designated by placing hoops over each of the counters in the row.

There are couple of further wrinkles. Most importantly are the "power" colours. At the start, each player has power in a single board colour, determined randomly. This allows the player to use a card of that colour to move an counter on the board (their own or another player's) either to an adjacent square of that colour or from a square of that colour to an adjacent square. Creating a row of five gains the player power over the colour of the middle square of the row - this is marked by removing the central counter from its hoop and placing it on one of the power colour markers to the side of the board. In this way players gain power over new colours. If another player already has power in that colour, their power is removed - but the player who gained power merely displaces them - they do not gain power in the colour. Gaining power over a colour in which you already have power reinforces power in the colour. The player "hoops" the power counter and this prevents any other player from gaining a row that would give them power in that colour. In effect they have a "lock" on that colour. A final wrinkle comes with the discard piles. Played cards can be discard to one of four face-up piles. Once one of the four "draw" decks is exhausted, the adjacent discard pile is turned over - but not shuffled. This allows long-term strategies of "stacking" the deck with particular colours or symbols.

The quality of the components is superb. The board is big and colourful, the symbols clear and distinct. The player's counters are chunky plastic discs which come in little cannisters like pill-boxes. The hoops are rubber-like rings which come in individual cloth bags. Very satisfying to "hoop" your rows with.

name: SjÃ¶fartspelet
description:
Players take the part of captains of cargo ships transporting merchandise over the North Sea during WWII. The board is perforated and placed over an undulated plastic landscape so that certain areas become shallow. For each of the four different orientations of the board there is a map depicting the shallow areas.
Two patrol boats move randomly around the board and the players try to avoid them. Each transport is worth money and points, the first player to reach 25 points and 300.000 Swedish crowns is the winner.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Basic Training
description:
"Basic Training is played on a small hex-based map that represents a section of New Guinea. The playing pieces represent companies of Australian Army and Japanese Army soldiers. Each player moves and attacks with his units, in turn, in an attempt to capture (or prevent from being captured) the Village hexes shown on the map. The Japanese player is attempting to capture at least two villages, and the Australian player is trying to prevent him from doing this."

Contents - a booklet containing:
- 10 unmounted counters (4 Australian, 6 Japanese)
- 1 unmounted 68-hex mapboard
- 1 combat results table
- 3 pages of basic rules
- 1 page of optional rules
- 2 pages of examples
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: On the Rocks
description:
The special dice included in this set have an image of a lighthouse on each die instead of the number one. As each player rolls, accumulating points on their way to 100, the lighthouses signal danger! Roll one lighthouse and you lose all points from your current turn, roll two lighthouses and you lose all your points from the entire game, but roll three lighthouses and you are shipwrecked and out of the game for good.

The game uses three six sided dice each of which has a lighthouse symbol instead of the conventional one spot. It can be played by 2 or more (or solo).

name: Mothers & Their Babies
description: Pre-school game where children draw puzzle pieces and attempt to match the mother piece with the baby.

name: The Thorn Princess and the Four Knights
description:
Translated from the backside:
In this game, the players become royal knights, and their goal is to reclaim the princess who has shut herself into the Thorn Castle.
However, the princess is a selfish one, and she doesn't want to leave the Castle.
In order to get her out of there, the knights must earn her trust by pleasing (resolving) the selfish wishes she constantly repeats.

The knights use their cards to move around the board looking for useful things, awaiting the chance to take the princess with them. But once they claim the princess (for example, by defeating the knight she currently is accompanied by), she starts ranting "I'm hungry", "I want to rest" and other silly requests.
The winner is the player who succeeds in earning the princess' trust by clearing three of these requests and escorting her outside the castle's walls.

Contains:
A3 Game board
4 Knight cards
1 Princess card
84 Action cards
20 Event cards
20 Rant cards
6 cardboard figures (1 for each knight, 1 princess, 1 event marker)
1 6-sided die (the irriation counter)
24 item chips
1 rule book

Designed by Seiji Kanai
Illustrations by Noboru Sugiura
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: Pomorze 1939
description:
Pomorze 1939 starts on September 1st 1939 and deals with part of the campaign called Battle of Tuchola Forest. The map represents northern part of Poland - Pomerania.

Since German advantage is huge, polish player is placed in a very defensive role. The game should be played twice - giving opportunity for players to try each side.


Wikipedia: Battle of Tuchola Forest

name: BrainBox: Dinosaurs
description:
Dinosaurs will be perfect for dinosaur lovers of all ages, with exciting graphics and fun facts. Beautifully-illustrated, well researched and pure fun.

Players will have 10 seconds to study a card before being asked a question from the back, chosen by the roll of the die. If the question is answered correctly the card is kept, if not it is returned to the box. The player with the most cards after 10 minutes wins the game!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Prehistoric
publishers: Albi, Green Board Game Co., MindWare, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Irondale: Irondale Expands
description:
Irondale: Irondale Expands, is the first expansion for Irondale. The expansion itself contains several smaller expansions, add-ons, and variants.

Irondale Expands includes 18 new Building cards (3 copies of each - 1 for each deck), including a new building type: Monuments. Also included are 3 new Special Buildings including the Architect's Guild and the Banking Institution, which enable trade withing the game and add extra options to the existing Master Plan mechanic. The City Square is also a new special building which is used to change the way Irondale is played. 4 new dedicated start city cards are also included.

This expansion is completely modular, and players may choose to use any or all included material to enhance their games of Irondale.

A copy of Irondale is required to play Irondale Expands.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: Arkana MiÅoÅci: Kochankowie
description:
The Lovers is the first expansion set for the Arcana of Love card game. It provides additional "spicy" cards for the erotic game for couples.

Components:

24 cards
1 ARCANA card
4 ASSET cards
3 DARE cards
3 SPECIAL ACTION cards
13 ACTION card



There was one version in a bigger box with additional accessories:

The Arcana of Love Cuffs
The Arcana of Love Scarf
Vibrator "Lady Finger"
2 Erotic Perfume Candles
1 Red Feather
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
publishers: Let's Play, Rebel Sp. z o.o.

name: Motocross Unplugged
description:
If you've ever dreamed of winning the Lucas Oil Motocross Champsionship, this is your chance!

A wildly fun and entertaining game for the whole family is just minutes away with easy to learn rules! Block, Pass and Knock Down your opponents, upgrade your bike, stay out of those ruts and try not to crash!

During your turn, play cards to advance your bike. Opponents may play Knock Down cards to reduce your movement. At the end of your turn, fill your hand back to 5 cards. Be the first rider to cross the finish line to win the game!

The promo page for the game shows the box cover with Lucas Oil Pro Motocross Championship as the title, but all of the supporting informational materials refer to the game as Motocross Unplugged.

name: MÃ¼ckenstich, Danger, Zwickern
description:
Mückenstich is a trick-taking card game with four suits, with each suit having cards numbered 1-12 (with two 12s) and three mosquitoes; a mosquito has no number but is the highest card in a suit.

Each round, players start with a number of cards in hand, then discard two of those cards face down. For the most part, Mückenstich follows traditional trick-taking rules. The active player lays down a card, then each other player follows by playing a single card, following suit, if possible. Whenever a mosquito is played, that player declares one color to be trump. (The game starts with no trump color.) A mosquito or 12 played later in the round is considered higher than one played earlier. Once all players have laid down a card, the highest trump card (if any) wins the trick; with no trump, the highest card in the suit led for the round wins the trick. Players keep track of tricks won, and the winner of a trick leads to the next trick.

Once all tricks have been played, the single player with the fewest tricks names one suit to count double during scoring, then the single player with the most mosquitoes names one of the three remaining suits to be worthless. Then players tally their points: The first mosquito in a suit is worth -5 points, while all other mosquitos are worth 0. Suited cards are worth 0-2 depending on whether they are worthless, scored as normal, or doubled.

After a number of rounds equal to the number of players (or twice as many rounds with three players), the player with the highest total score wins.


In Danger, players draw numbered and colored cards, trying to collect as many points as possible in each color each round without exceeding the limit of 15 points.

On a turn, a player draws the top card from the deck and places it in front of her in a row for cards of that color; some cards are multicolor, and the player chooses in which row to play these cards. After laying a second card in the round, a player has the option of securing a row at the end of each turn. To secure a row, the player must not have the lowest total in that color when compared to the other players; the player secures a row by turning the last card in that row 90º. A player can secure only one row each turn.

If a player exceeds a total of 15 points in a row, that row is now blocked and worth 0 points; the player turns those cards face-down.
