If a player draws a colored card for a row either secured or blocked, she must discard the card. The next player in turn order has the option of taking this discarded card instead of drawing randomly from the deck.

Once the fourth row of any player is secured or blocked, the round ends immediately. Whoever has the fewest points in a color (with blocked rows worth 0 points) scores nothing for this color; all other players score points equal to the numbers showing in this color in their row. Players then empty their rows and continue playing with the cards remaining in the deck. After five complete rounds, the player with the highest total score wins.


Zwickern is a public-domain card game of the fishing variety, in which the game starts with a pool of cards on the table and players try to claim these cards for points by using the cards in their hands. Most cards have a single number in the corner to show their value when being played, while some cards have two numbers (e.g., 2/12) and cards like these can be either value when played or when lying on the table; each card also has a victory point value.

On a turn, a player plays one card from her hand and either:

Buys cards from the display (using an 8, for example, to buy a 5 and 3, or an 8, or all three cards)
Builds a pile of cards (by adding or subtracting the card played with a card or pile already on the table, or vice versa)
Plays to the table (making the card available for piles or buys on future turns)


After players play out the few cards in their hand, they receive a few more cards. After a certain number of rounds, the game ends and players sum the points of the cards they've collected, earning additional points for collecting the most cards and for buying all cards on display during a turn. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Crimson Crush
description:
Description from the publisher:

Death Grip is kidnapping innocent citizens in the city, but there is hope! A new hero – Crimson Crush – is in town, and he will use his special powers to put an end to Death Grip.

In Crimson Crush, you play your cards smartly to score points with the hero, while trying to have Death Grip kidnap citizens to give negative points to other players.

name: Fou Raide
description:
Fou Raide is a party game that should awaken the craziest side of your players, only by reading the challenge cards.

Hum a great song with crazy sounds, reproduce a fresco with fellow players, make faces, mime, your guests will be Fou Raide.

A member of a team pick a card, reads the category aloud (Fresco, Mime, Humming, etc.), and attempt to have his team guess the answers before the timer runs out. If they succeed the team earn 3 points. If the timer run out, they player can reveal a hint from the card. If the team guess correctly with the hint, they earn one point.
First team to 25 point wins.

name: Big Game Night 2016
description:
Description from the bottom of the box:

AEG's Big Game Night has been a hit event at Gen Con Indy for the last three years. Now you can also have all of the same excitement without buying a plane ticket! Enjoy these great AEG games, available only in this box, this year. In this box you will find 4 games from acclaimed designer Seiji Kanai (Love Letter, Lost Legacy, Cheaty Mages):

1 copy of Love Letter -- Kanai Edition with oversized cards
1 copy of Say Adios to the Villains
1 copy of Eight Epics -- Kanai Edition
1 copy of Regality and Religion -- Kanai Edition


You will also find:

2 boxes fitted to contain up to 7 games from AEG's pocket line!
3 empty pocket line boxes to store gaming components such as dice, tokens or even other games!

name: Deer Lord!: Bling Edition
description:
The Deer Lord! Bling Edition includes the Deer Lord! Core cards plus the Socially Awkward "Geek" and "Asylum" sets. It also includes an exclusive limited edition gaming medallion.

The game contains two kinds of cards:


Duels, to play on your own turn. Challenge a friend to wacky duel - the group decides the winner.



Dupes, to play whenever you want, as long as you don't get caught. Try to complete a secret objective without being too obvious. Be cunning to avoid being called out - or pay the price!

name: Potions & Profits
description: In Potions and Profits, you are a Wizard representing one of many pharmaceutical corporations looking for new Potions to invest in. Competing Wizards will try to outbid you for Potions as you balance both your Stock Value and your Public Relations. The most profitable Potions tend to be the least ethical but that doesn’t matter so long as your investors are happy and not too many protesters are kicking down your door. Become the most profitable corporation you can by either monopolizing one type of Potion or by simply having the best pharmaceutical line around. It’s just business, magical or otherwise.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Investment, Market

name: Planet A: Das nachhaltige Kartenspiel
description:
Challenge: The earth is our Planet A. It is worth the effort to protect it, because there is no Planet B. Rising CO2 emission and a plastic torrent overwhelm our sensitive ecosystem; climate change and species extinction arise with all consequent changes. Strive against that and save our blue planet. In the process, ecological calamities and forever outdated political parties get in your way. Do not give in. We save the earth step by step - as long as everyone contributes.

Solution: By the use of 105 different cards about sustainability , the players face up with all kinds of environmentally friendly everyday items and ideas. With realistic tasks and practical ideas, the game throws a bridge into the real life and is thought-provoking. Playfully learning with a lot of fun plus making the world a bit better.

Description of the game: All players have to fulfil a secret task: either to collect certain thematic cards in their hand or to help the team Planet A get a collection in the middle of the table. Whoever accomplishes three tasks at first wins. Ecological calamity cards, environmental hero cards and environmental activist cards whirl the game and encourage discussions on sustainability.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Set Collection

name: DÃ­galo con Memes
description:
Dígalo con Memes (Say it with memes) contains 80 image cards with the best Internet memes and 240 situation cards with various phrases.

To start, each player is dealt 7 situation cards. The judge selects the image card that will be selected in the round. He shows it to all the participants and places it in a visible place for everyone.

Each player must choose which of their situation cards makes the funniest pair with the image card in play and once selected, a judge reads them out loud and defines which is the funniest combination.

The player who selected the winning situation card keeps the image card as a trophy (1 image card = 1 point) and everyone returns the remaining situation cards. The player to the left of the judge becomes the new judge for the next round.

The player with the most picture cards at the end of the game can be considered the winner.

name: The Wall: Delitto sotto i riflettori
description:
Three boxes for three stories await you: work in a team and ask the right questions... the answers may surprise you.

The Wall: Delitto sotto i riflettori is part of a trilogy: three investigating games that will keep you nailed to the table with bated breath!

Try to shed light on a mysterious event, collecting valuable clues between places to explore carefully, objects to analyze, and pressing interrogations. At the end of the investigation, you will be asked some questions that will measure how able you have been in solving the mystery, getting points for each correct answer. Each investigation is divided into several chapters that will allow you to continue the investigation. The detective's work seems to never end, and one case leads to another: if you feel able to answer the final questions, turn the card!

In The Wall: Delitto sotto i riflettori, (Crime under the spotlights), a famous actor dies on the set of his last film because of a real bullet, loaded into a gun that had to shoot blanks, while shooting the last scene. How did this happen? In the show business nothing is as it seems and everyone has something to hide.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Go Low Card Game
description:
The object of the game? Go Low! You are dealt four cards, face down, and can only look at any two of them. Throughout the round, you will swap cards in and out, trying to remember which cards have the lowest numbers. If you think your set has the lowest score, yell “Go Low!” The lowest score after five rounds wins.

Includes: 75 cards, Instructions

name: Quoridor Pac-Man
description:
Embark on a new adventure with Quoridor Pac-Man, an exclusive edition of Quoridor that allows you to play as either PAC-MAN or one of the four ghosts.

Explore two game modes: opt for the classic Quoridor challenge that has you navigating through the maze, or dive into a variant that brings back the nostalgic vibes of the iconic PAC-MAN video game!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Maze, Video Game Theme

name: Miserian Wars
description:
2 or 4 players take on the roles of up to 4 different kings. Each king is armed with an army of 4 different guilds; the beggars, merchants, thieves and knights.

The goal is for each king to position his guilds throughout the Land of Miseria. Miseria's old king has passed on and left no heir, this is where the new kings come in. Your guilds must attempt to occupy the 5 sectors of Miseria; the slums, lower and upper cities, the towers and the castle.
Through a series of attacks and maneuvers, players must strategically position their pieces, all while Miseria deteriorates during game play.

Each guild piece has a strength and move value determining its power, while certain sanctions are put in place enabling choice pieces to attack other choice pieces in descending order; knights, thieves, merchants and beggars.
Each sector also gives the defending guild a defense bonus during battle.

Occupy the 5 sectors of Miseria or simply eliminate the other players. And beware of the occasional Chaos Riot that could break out over the entire land! Good Luck!

name: Spook by Spook
description:
This is the center spread game that came in the Spielbox magazine 2010 #3.

Object of the game
The players are ghost hunters cooperating to free Baron von Hagen's manor house of haunting ghosts. The ghosts are, however, only harbingers of their queen...

Game materials required (not included):

1 playing piece per player (ghost hunters)
1 neutral playing piece (harbinger)
1 rummy card deck
1 6-sided die


Spook by Spook is a cooperative game: the participants act as a team against the game. They can only win together or lose together.

name: Slime Monster Game
description:
From the rules: The Slime Monster has invaded the town. You've got to stop him! You must get from the High School to the Armory, pick up a land mine and knock the Slime Monster over. But be careful that the Slime monster doesn't knock you over with his slime.

Movement is directed with a spinner. Each spin is used twice: once for the player and the same amount for the monster. The players try to manipulate the monster so that he winds up standing over an opponent. He then "slimes" the player and moves. If the slime covering the player causes the player piece to fall over, the player must start again. Yuck!

name: Silver Mountain
description:
Silver has been discovered on the mountain. The richest nuggets are nearest the top. Get your ore cars on the trains and to your nuggets. A mining game for 3-5 players for about 30 minutes.

Players take turns playing a card from their hand to place ore nuggets on the board, place ore car tokens on a train, or move a train. Players are awarded points when their color coded ore car token reaches their ore nuggets.

name: Katsu Curry?! This is not the time for that!
description: It is currently an era of worldwide economic deflation. The politicians of your country seek to understand the common people. Players become the leaders of an opposition party who have taken it upon themselves to reestablish economic responsibility. Each player will bid to enforce a "fair and folksy" price of a variety of goods and services. Each time a player sets a price, they will earn honor points. The winner, and new political leader, is the player who earns the most points.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Humor, Party Game, Political

name: Legendary Showdown: Presidential Edition
description:
Based on the delightfully shady history of the United States presidents, this lighthearted game is designed to be enjoyed by experienced gamers and newcomers alike. No background knowledge is needed to enjoy Legendary Showdown: Presidential Edition or plan your epic victory.

Each player controls a line of presidents. At the end of each round, the presidents at the front of each player's line will engage in battle. The victor continues battling, and the rest are removed.

To ensure your president's victory, there are numerous underhanded strategies you can employ. You can give your presidents special bonuses that increase their strength, or you can give your opponents terrible bonuses to put them at a disadvantage.

You can also play cards to rearrange the order of your line, allowing a stronger president to compete, or rearrange the order of another player's line, forcing them to use a weak president.

Facedown cards can be employed to give your president a secret point bonus or ability, so you can never be sure which player is in the lead.

Action and instant cards allow you to mess with another player's strategy or swap your weaker presidents for stronger candidates.

The round continues until all players but one declare they are ready for battle by passing on their turns instead of playing cards. Players can gain a strategic advantage by delaying their actions until later in the round, but waiting too long might cause the battle to start before you've made your move.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: Top 3: Film
description:
Which one was more expensive - "The Lord of the Rings" or "Matrix"? Try to put three films in one of five different categories in the correct order. If your guess is correct, you'll score points - the less your opponents knew, the more you'll score!

Top3 - Film was released soon after the Nürnberg trade fair in 2008 as one of three card games in a new series of trivia card games made by KOSMOS called "Top3".

The categories are so specific that even players who are very much interested in the given topic (like films in this case), probably will not know the correct answers. Instead, every player has to do the best guess.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Stumpy the Cave Boy
description:
The board is composed of 25 rooms joined by many doorways. Some of the doorways are blocked by barrels. Each turn, a player rolls a die to determine the number of steps to move from room to room. For each step, the player moves her marker one space, may then reposition one barrel, and then must move the ringmaster one space towards herself following the shortest path. Players can't move through barrels or into occupied rooms. The ringmaster can't move through barrels (or reposition them) but may move through other players. If the ringmaster 'catches' the active player, the game ends and all other players win.

Stumpy the Cave Boy was originally slated for release as CAG 012 in October 1997. A last minute decision removed it from the production schedule. The game was retooled as Escape from Dork Tower and published in John Kovalic's Dork Tower in 1999. Stumpy the Cave Boy became a celebrated martyr of Cheapass Games, and stock number 012 has been retired. It was finally published in Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack.
mechanics: Area Movement, Enclosure, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Seigo
description:
From game's web page (www.mondainai.eu):

SEIGO is a strategy game based on the Japanese writing system.

In the Basic version, the players build armies of 36 basic phonetic Hiragana characters. The military function of each letter is connected to its pronunciation. In the Advanced version, 51 Kanji ideograms are introduced. These represent the technological progress of the player's nation. Adjective Kanji enhance the powers of the Hiragana, while Verb Kanji give the player more actions to take. In the Full version, 49 new Kanji are introduced, as well as the Katakana alphabet. With the noun Kanjis come cities which add valuable infrastructures such as Forts, Factories and Railroads.

As the game goes from simple to complex, your Japanese goes from nothing to 192 characters.

name: Children's Bible Trivia
description:
Players answer questions related to the Bible to move up a rainbow gameboard. There are 2100 questions that cover seven categories (corresponding to the seven colors of the rainbow): Old Testament; History and Geography; Prophets and Miracles; Names; Letters, Numbers, and Sequence; New Testament; and Wisdom. The first player to successfully move up the rainbow and answer an additional question from a category chosen by the other players wins.

The questions are designed for children, Ages 6 and up.

name: Äesko: otÃ¡zky a odpovÄdi (cestovnÃ­ verze)
description: Expansion to Äesko (Czechia), questions and answers. Adds 600 questions/answers to the original game.

name: DestiNation USA
description:
In DestiNation USA, players will be traveling across the U.S., trying to hit as many states and as many special destinations as possible.

To set up the game, place a state token in each of the continental U.S. states, each player places his car token in a randomly drawn state (claiming the token located there), a special destination is revealed (replacing it if a player is already in that state), and each player receives six driving cards from a deck of 62 (48 of those being states and 14 being special action cards).

On a turn, a player either moves to an adjacent state – by playing that state's card or any two cards the same color as that state – or plays a special action card. The player can play as many cards as he can, then refills his hand at the end of his turn. If a player enters a state that no one else has visited, he claims the state token; if he enters the state shown on the special destination card, he claims that card and a new card is revealed.

The game ends when either all 48 state tokens or five destination cards have been claimed. Each state token is worth one point, while destination cards are worth three points. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Network and Route Building

name: Monopoly: Sonic the Hedgehog Collector's Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Vvrrrrm! The world's fastest hedgehog is teaming up with America's favorite trading game to bring you MONOPOLY: Sonic the Hedgehog Collector's Edition. Grab your token - Sonic, Tails, or even Chao - and zip around the board faster than the speed of sound! Buy, sell and trade your favorite zones, from Green Hill to Mad Gear. Own stages like Apotos, Metal City and Sand Ruin, and improve them with Workshops or Bases. Then, triumph over your competition by collecting more rings from other players! Think you can own it all? Ready... GO!
categories: Animals, Economic, Negotiation, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: KeYstoNe
description:
The Gods try to make the stars. The stars consist of the Angel, the Human, and the Devil. Sometimes you can see the Angel Human and the Devil Human.

The big star is the high score, but the biggest will be gone with the SUN. So the points are nothing.

KeYstoNe is a trick-taking game with a "must follow" rule. The winner of trick takes the cards and makes a line of the cards - either ascending or descending.

Each card has a number and points. The player pays points for each his lines and gets the points from the cards. The longest line is not scored.

After two games, the highest player wins the game.

The illustration is based on the contributors of the famous podcast "Board game laboratory". They are Kawasaki, Yoshida, and Naoe.

name: Dodge Ball
description:
In this fast paced action game, players must stack 6 balls on their cups as quickly as possible. But beware: at the same time you have to make sure that your head is not thrown off by the flying ball! Be quick and agile! Continue to dodge the ball and at the same time push the balls onto the cup. Does your head fly off? Then you have to start all over again. If you only had 3 hands...

—description from the publisher (translated)
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., Maki A/S

name: Bullseye Pizza Chef
description:
Bullseye Pizza Chef is a dice targeting push you luck dexterity game. You will roll your topping dice at a pizza crust target and see what topping you can score. but be careful not to roll to many cheese or your turn will be over. once you have collected your toppings you can fill pizza orders.

—description from the designer

name: Caption This!
description: A party game of the internet's most epic fails! Similar to Cards Against Humanity, but the judge draws a picture (Fail Card) for which the other players then submit their best caption cards. The player who submitted the best caption during a turn wins the Fail Card, and the player who collects a certain threshold of Fail Cards wins the game.

name: Comment Below...
description:
A rotating judge places a Status card on top of their chosen profile card while the rest of the group competes to play the funniest Comment card. Once everyone has submitted their chosen comment card face down, the judge awards a point to the funniest one. The person who has the most status states at the end of the game is the winner.

Contains: 75 Profile cards, 90 Status cards, 270 Comment cards, a super fancy easel, plus instructions.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Red Hot Silly Peppers
description:
A festive party full of joy, music and… chillies! Now and then, a hot pepper pops up from the crowd and disappears again. Will you be the fastest to react once the right combination of the chillies is shown?

A fast-paced observe-and-act card game for the entire family, where the situation is continually changing. The player with the highest number of cards wins.

How to play?
Put the three double-sided cards with tasks (coloured edge) within easy reach of all players in the middle of the table.
Shuffle the remaining cards and deal 12 (16) of them to each player. Players keep their cards face down in a drawing pile in front of them.
The active player turns their top card and puts it on their discard pile, face up. If one of the conditions shown on the task cards is met, the players try to be the fastest to cover the corresponding task card with their hand.

The conditions of task cards:

All cards are showing 6 different kinds of chillies (some of them can be represented multiple times but each of them MUST be represented at least once).
At least 5 identical peppers are being shown.
Exactly 2 pairs (2 peppers of one and 2 peppers of another kind) are being shown.


If multiple conditions are being met at the same time, the first player to cover the highest priority task card wins the round. The player who wins the round chooses and takes any of the discard piles with one of the cards helping to meet the condition on the top. He places these cards at the bottom of his drawing pile.
The game ends when a player discards the last card from their drawing pile. The player with the highest sum of cards in their drawing pile and their discard pile(s) wins the game.

name: The Zombies of Los Muerte High
description:
Zombies have infested Los Muerte High! As your teachers shamble about trying to eat your brains, you begin to formulate a plan. It might just work, but it’s going to take everything in your locker to convince enough students to help get it done.

Two characters come up that provide icons towards completing your plan (which you need at the end of the game) and popularity points.

Players bid a card face down from their hand. Highest bid takes first choice of cards but loses their bid card, second highest bid takes the remaining card and keeps their bid.

However, sometimes a Zombie is among the character cards who makes completing a plan more difficult.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Quiz Chef
description:
The challenge is in the kitchen!

If they say "Bismarck", do you only think of steak?
When they call out "Alfredo", do you have fettuccine on your mind?
The great chef Simone Rugiati challenges you with more than 200 kitchen trivia questions.
Play the game to get some great advice from Simone and become a better cook!

Each question has a "BEEP-ed" word: the players take turns trying to find the missing word. The first player answering five correct questions wins the game.

Some cards (the ones with the Simone Rugiati's suggestions) present a different challenge: simultaneous answer, or a greatest prize consisting in stealing a point from another player in addition to the normal prize for the correct answer.

The game presents four different levels of difficulty: at the beginning of the game, the players may choose to play a specific level or a mix of all four.

name: Vertical
description: In Vertical, you play a mountaineer on an evolving, demanding cliff face, competing against ruthless competitors to climb, which will be a problem since you've forgotten some of your equipment...
publishers: Falomir Juegos, Les Jeux du Lac

name: Tiles of the Arabian Nights
description:
Tiles of the Arabian Nights is set in the universe of the Arabian Nights. In Bagdad, storytelling has become deeply ingrained in the city’s culture ever since the legendary Scheherazade told 1001 unforgettable tales over as many nights. In honor of the queen, the Sultan now holds a storytelling contest each year!

This year, as a citizen of Bagdad, you’re taking part in the contest, in the hopes of winning the title of Master Storyteller. But coming up with a good story isn’t easy, and as every tale contains at least a grain of truth, you find yourself in search of a little inspiration…

So get ready to head out into the desert in search of adventure! As you explore, you’ll meet colorful characters, find amazing treasures, and defeat fearsome foes. Each new discovery you make will earn you an Adventure tile. Once you’ve collected enough tiles for your story, you’ll return to Bagdad to tell it to the awaiting crowds.

Exactly what your story will be is up to you…

Use the beautiful, unique illustrations on your tiles as inspiration to come up with a story worthy of the Arabian Nights! Each tale you tell will earn you points from the Sultan himself, and from other players. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Slap Cat!
description:
In Slap Cat!, you play as a mad scientist attempting to assemble the world's most adorable cat! Draft cards to your Cat Construction area by quickly slapping them as they are revealed. Earn bonus points for kitty fedoras, bows, balls of yarn and more. But be careful, slap too slow and you could be left with a hand full of fishbones!

—description from the publisher

name: Sack Armies
description:
Sack Armies is a fantasy-based battle game for 2-6 players with strategic, operational, and tactical elements. It was released several years ago, but implemented many innovative mechanisms (at the time) and an well-designed elegant system.

It was marketed as a Collectible Token Game; however, the “collectability” aspect is almost completely mitigated by two factors: 1. A clever army construction mechanism and 2. The fact that there was only one big edition published. This game is NOT an example of whoever-spends-the-most-money on starters and boosters wins, but rather whoever is the better general wins. It is probably still worth noting that the game tokens come in Starter (aka Army) packs and Booster (aka Reinforcement) packs.

There are the usual suspects in any fantasy game (orcs, goblins, elves, magic, etc.); however, this game is not about questing and adventuring, but rather about the field of battle. The key to winning is strategic planning, achieving operational objectives, and tactical execution. A player wins by capturing all the opponent’s battlefields or eliminating all the opponent’s units.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Pari-Manie
description:
Pari-Manie is basically a gambling game in which you want to become the richest player and ruin every other gambler aroud the table. Simple dice rolling is used to move along a board filled up with mini-games opportunities. Games such as: Poker, Horse racing, Black Jack, dices, Lucky 7...

Every game is played (solitaire) against a designated dealer, The only time you will be able to play against your adversaries is when you venture toward the middle of the board (instead of moving around the board). Then if you happen to stop on the middle space, called "Pari-manie", the fun begins. You will challenge an opponent to play a mini-game with you, the wager will be the total amount ($$$) of the poorest player (of the 2 playing). The player that was selected decides what game will be played from:

Poker
Black Jack
Dices
or a simple "cut a card from the deck".


If the poorest of the 2 players loses, he is eliminated (losing his whole wager). If he wins, he gets to double his money (courtesy of the loser).

Game contents:




style="text-align:right;"|1×

Board



style="text-align:right;"|1×

Plastic tray with money bills



style="text-align:right;"|1×

Traditional 52-card deck



style="text-align:right;"|10×

Horse racing cards



style="text-align:right;"|12×

Fruit cards



style="text-align:right;"|3×

Color-sided dices



style="text-align:right;"|2×

6 sided dices



style="text-align:right;"|8×

Player pieces



style="text-align:right;"|5×

Control cards
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting
publishers: Les Entreprises AubÃ© et Khacho inc.

name: Orbit Battle
description:
You are a squad commander in charge of eight spaceships and five battle rings. A meteor has destroyed your planet, and you are searching for a new home. You are now in a race to capture two of the three remaining big planets to rule the galaxy. But beware you have an enemy with the same mission.

To win this intergalactic Orbit Battle, you need to use all your skill to outmaneuver your enemy and capture the planets.

The object of the game is to be the first player to capture two of the three big planets with three spaceships on each of the big planets. The first player who has invaded a big planet with three spaceships has captured that planet. When a player has invaded the big planet with three spaceships, the other player cannot enter this planet anymore.

name: Starship Tycoons
description:
The United World Government has decided to sell the moon. Each player of Starship Tycoons is a space merchant trying to raise enough money to buy it. The first player to reach one of the Star Systems Leo, Pegasus or Scorpio with enough money to buy the moon, wins the game.
The playing pieces represent starships with from one to four Cargo Holds, according to the number of extra Cargo Holds purchased. Opportunities to fill the Carco Holds occur frequently, and the merchant makes a good profit when the cargo is delivered to the correct location. Many other events occur during the game. Trade becomes adventure!
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Chiamo!
description:
Chiamo! is a strategic trick-taking game designed for 3 players, where your partner changes round to round! Those who dare to face the other two players call out Chiamo! (I call). The high bidder leads, while the other two players team up to stop him from winning enough points to take the hand. With a fun and unique Italian suited deck, Chiamo! will make you exclaim, "Mamamia!" each time the partners change.

Chiamo! also includes instructions for Chiamo! per Quattro (the 4-player game), where players partner up, vying for the most possible points and Chiamo! per Due (the 2-player game) for head-to-head competition!

name: Sky Heist
description:
Admit it, you’d like to hit an airship bank high in the sky with the help of your not very faithful companions and a reliable single-seated airbike.

In Sky Heist you will join an airship bank robbery in a steampunk world. Being part of the gang you’ll have to take as much money as possible from the safe till the sheriff comes. But, as you know, a gangster riding a single-seated bike-plane hybrid can’t be trusted since you can get into a shootout and try to steal all the money for yourself. Load barrels, check parachutes — it is going to be epic.

Sky Heist is a fun card game that requires fast reaction. Each turn players discard cards into a loot deck using combinations. Besides they can play different special cards and also put the cards from their hands into a “revolver” area which limits their opportunities during the game but helps in the final duel. There are several sheriff cards inevitably causing the duel in which the card combinations that are put into the players’ revolvers are very important. As a result of the duel all the cards from the loot deck are shared as victory points among players. The game lasts for several rounds and the one who has got the most victory points becomes a winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Trailmazer
description: Trailmazer is a fast-paced, strategy game in which players take turns rolling their rings onto the game board. The first player to connect one side of the board to the opposite side with a criss-crossed line in their own color wins!

name: Yo! Marvel Heroes
description:
A fun game of bluff for 2-4 players Ages 7 and up, using 33 fact-filled cards on Marvel Super Heroes.

The game play is similar to a card-based version of Perudo. Each player selects a number of cards from their hand, passes to the player on the left and announces e.g. "3 Blue". The receiving player can then accept the statement as truth and take the cards or challenge it as a bluff. If they're right, the active player has to reduce their score by the announced value. If they're right, they must reduce their score. First one to lose 15 points is the loser. Bids must increase until a challenge is made.

The game box has an integrated scoring track.

There are several other versions of this game. The first set consists of Marvel Heroes, Ben 10, Baby Animals, Horses, Monster Jam, and Dinos. Other than the card art the games appear to be identical.

name: ÐÐµÐ³ÐµÐ½Ð´Ñ Ð¨ÐµÑÐ²ÑÐ´Ð° (Legends of Sherwood)
description:
Legends of Sherwood is a card game in which players use the general deck of robbers from Robin Hood tales: Little John, Will Scarlett, Maid Marian, Robin Hood himself and many others.

Players raid wealthy merchants and knights, hunt in the forest and have a good time in taverns to earn more gold. First player who will earn 15 golden monets will be winner.

All the robbers are different with their unique abilities. This allows players to create interesting combos. To earn monets you may:
• send robbers to Sherwood Forest or to Nottingham to raid reach mans — this is risk but it give more gold (if success, of course);
• to job or to hunt for silver;
• make many others actions with less risk.

The game play in several rounds, each have 4 phases:
1. Night. Players gain robbers cards.
2. Morning. In centre of the game area places Sherwood and Nottingham cards.
3. Day. Players play cards and apply card's abilities.
4. Evening. All the cards from centre of the game area are discarded.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Push Your Luck, Race

name: Pizza Time
description:
Italy needs a champion!
Are you a skilled and focused pizza maker …?

Look at the ingredients and sort your cards out quickly. You must prepare your customers' orders as quickly as possible. Put 4 cards together and make a pizza with cheese, peppers, mushrooms and olives!

As the game progresses the orders will get more and more complicated and the challenge will be harder and harder to meet!

A game requiring alertness and observation for novice pizza makers and head chefs.
publishers: Cocktail Games, Festival Ludique International de Parthenay

name: The Game of Life: Extreme Reality Edition
description: THE GAME OF LIFE: Extreme Reality Edition is an outrageous and adventurous way to play THE GAME OF LIFE. As players travel through “life” they encounter radical “real-life” scenarios – from getting married while skydiving to having sextuplets. Players can also own extreme homes, such as a castle, and assume extreme careers, such as a stunt car driver. Add even more reality to the game by going to THE GAME OF LIFE: Extreme Reality website to create and print cards that feature your own life experiences.

name: Galaxy Wrestling Federation
description:
In Galaxy Wrestling Federation, you need to overcome opponents so that you can win championship belts and win the entire event, but you have only a small hand of moves that you can make, so manage them well!

Each player receives a hand of ten wrestling cards and one victory card; each wrestling card has a strength value on it as well as an opposing value that it overcomes. On a player's turn, they choose an opponent who doesn't have the most cards on the table in front of them and challenges them to a bout of either strength or speed. Each player chooses a card in hand, then reveals them simultaneously. If your card overcomes the value that your opponent played, then you win the bout automatically — unless you each overcame the other's number, in which case the bout is a tie.

If no one overcame the other, then you compare the values of the cards themselves. In a strength bout, whoever played the higher value wins; in a speed bout, the lower value wins; in a tie, the bout is a tie. If a single player played their victory card, then they automatically win — unless the other player did the same, in which case you tie.

The winner of the bout returns their victorious card to hand (except for the victory card, which is a one-shot effect), while the loser places their card face up on the table in front of them. The winner receives a championship belt token, then the next player in clockwise order chooses an opponent.

In a bout, before both players reveal their cards, they count to three, and while they're doing this, a third player can interrupt by playing one card against one of the cards in the bout. If the interrupting player overcomes that player's card, they win the bout and receive a championship belt token, returning that card to hand. If they don't overcome the card, they place their card face up on the table, then the bout resumes.

When one player has three pairs of card values face up in front of themselves (e.g., 1/1/2/2/3/3), then the game ends. This player loses, and whoever has the most championship belt tokens wins!

name: Antique
description:
Antique is an auction game in which each player represents an important collector of the world of art and antiquities.
Each player will have to manipulate his rivals to get the most valuable collection of the table and pay as little as possible for each of his pieces.

—user summary

name: Schlag den Raab: Blamieren oder Kassieren
description:
Based on a famous German TV show.
In this game, one player is chosen to play Stefan Raab and competes against all the other players. In each round, a question is read out. Stefan Raab and the active player have to try and hit a buzzer first if they want to answer the question. A correct answer yields 100 Euros, a wrong one costs 100. After 10 rounds, the difference in money between the two contestants (Raab or the team) is put aside as a trophy that cannot be lost anymore. Three sets of ten rounds are played, afterwards, whoever has most money is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Battle B-Daman
description:
Battle B-Daman is a dexterity-based game where players shoot marbles at various kinds of targets. The marble launchers are little plastic robots; several different robots are available, each claiming to afford different levels of power, accuracy, and control. Other accessories introduce new target types and various kinds of loading systems.

The game is played in a four-foot long arena, bounded by plastic runners. Several events can be set up in this arena using the supply of pins, gates, sliding pucks, and knock-down targets provided by the game. The game details ten of these events, eight of which are playable out-of-the-box (with two others requiring "Direct Hit Battle" accessories, which are sold separately).

The ten events are:


Direct Hit Battle: Shoot at each other from across the arena, trying to disable your opponent.



B-Daman Blast : Shoot knock-down targets.



Hard Target: Shoot marbles through a five-arch gate at the five pins standing on the other side.



B-Daman Invasion: Knock a sliding puck across your opponent's goal line.



B-Daman Assault: Similar to B-Daman Blast, except that now your opponent is also trying to hit the knock-down targets from the other side of the arena.



Shoot the Gap: Shoot your marble between pins without knocking any down.



DHB Havoc: Shoot marbles through two-arch gates, attempting to disable your opponent.



Battle Hammer: Drive the sliding puck for distance.



B-Dachallenge: Set up a free-form obstacle course and challenge the other player to make a trick shot.



Ultimate Strike: Six-pin bowling.


For tournament play, a spinner chooses which events will be contested. The player winning two out of three events is the tournament champion.

name: Meine ersten Spiele: Kleine Baumeister
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Master builder Matt is the head of the large construction site and there are lots of things to do! He has many plans for the colorful houses that have to be built today. The children help Tim the laborer transport new building blocks from the quarry to the construction sites.

In Little Builders, however, time passes quicker than you might think. Will you finish your houses in time before Matt and Tim's working day is over?

name: Paradox
description:
Paradox is a deck of 44 cards in four suits of face value 0 to 10. There are three games that can be played: Costly Tricks for 2 players, Buddy On Your Left for three players and The Third Man for four players.

From the publisher:

Costly Tricks: a trick-taking game for 2 players in which you must pay for your tricks!
The players see the entire deck after it has been dealt out to themselves and their "invisible partners". They take turns playing cards for themselves and their partners with trump shifting when they cannot follow suit. Cards are worth their face value (0 to 10), but tricks cost 20 points! Thus they want to take the valuable tricks and make their opponent take the costly tricks.

Buddy on your Left: a game for 3 players where each player's score is his own plus that of his left hand neighbor!
A card is led then players in turn play cards either higher or lower than the lead card. As long as the played cards are lower, the pile continues to grow. As soon as a card higher in value than the initial card is played, that player sweeps the entire pile. Cards from 1 to 6 score their value, 7 to 10 are worth nothing. After the last card is played, you score for the cards you collected plus the cards your left hand opponent collected. Highest score wins.

The Third Man: an outrageous bidding game for 4 players
The game consists of a series of auctions, for each of which the house puts up a prize fund of 10 points. Highest bidder gets the 10 points, less the number he had bid (ex. if he bid 9, he earns 1). The second highest bidder loses the full amount he had bid (ex. if he bid 7 he loses 7). Whereas the third highest bidder receives from the house double the number he had bid (if he bid 5, he pockets 10!). Therefore in each auction your objective is to be third--and in any case not second

name: Wild: Rummy Edition
description: Rummy game with a 75-card deck, consisting of: the 52 standard cards; 13 "quadrate" cards bearing a rank and all four suits, with the effective suit determined by the roll of a special die; and ten wild cards.

name: Bulls and Bears
description: Acquire $200,000 by buying and selling stocks, mutual funds, fixed-income securities, foreign currency, gold, and real estate.

name: The Incredible Crash Dummies Crash Test Game
description: Those lovable crash test dummies (Spin, Slick, Darla and Spare Tire) are in a race to get safely home. On the way, they may lose and get back parts (heads, limbs, torsos), sometimes as a result of a crash. First one to make it to the finish line with a complete set of parts (not necessarily his own) wins.

name: Dynamite Nurse 2: Bloody Temple
description: Sequel to the original, this is a stand alone game. It retains the theme (with a fantasy setting) of curing various ills of patients. Problems such as "critical hit" (an arrow in the forehead) abound, and events such as an uncured patient turning to an Undead can occur.

name: Assembly Line
description: Players each control nine workers on an assembly line. As the products roll by, players will get a chance to score at certain points in the game, based on what product they're working on at that moment. This game won the 2003 Simultaneous Movement Board Game Design Competition sponsored by About.com Board Games and Abstract Games Magazine.

name: Saturday Night Live Trivia Board Game
description:
(From the back of the box):It's the Saturday Night Live Trivia Game! Test your knowledge of nearly two decades of hilarious television comedy from Saturday Night Live. Every card brings another SNL sketch to life! You and your teammates are challenged to dramatize or draw various character references, famous phrases or funny scenes from the show. Impersonate Roseanne Roseannadanna or the prim Church Lady - imitate the outrageous antics of Wayne's World and the Coneheads. Also included are over 500 trivia questions that test your knowledge of obscure SNL humor! It's great fun for everyone.

In this beer-and-pretzels game 2 groups of 2 players(minimum of 4 players to play the game) compete by answering trivia or by trying to get their partner to guess something SNL-related by drawing it, charading it, or by acting it out.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Sky Travelers
description:
From the box:

You are visitors from Outer Space whose Scout Craft has crashed on an island. Your Mission is to search the island, the Shore, the Sea, Nearby Forests and even Mountains for the Elements to repair your Craft. The Mother Ship is coming close for a pick up of Scout Craft. Don't let it pass by! On Earth, you meet UTOC's (Ugly Things Out of Control) and use your Powers to deal with them. However, your world is without violence and your people so deeply peaceful that you cannot harm anyone. If you use a Special Power in a violent way, your Being disintegrates! An exciting game of skill, team work and decision making. But. remember ... the Mother Ship is on its way and coming nearer.

name: Admiral
description:
Strategy and tactics, perfect navigation under water, at sea and in the air combined with different ways of assault are the essentials of the modern naval game ADMIRAL.

Two admirals struggle to rule the waves, they engage vessels and aircraft in battle, they occupy islands and install bases. The task is to defeat the enemy on the ocean. Admiralty’s orders to the captains and commodores are given with relating dice numbers.....----short extract from the rules

name: The Road Runner Pop-Up Game
description: Avoid desert obstacles and outwit opponents as you move each of your road runners to a new cave. The road runners must be moved from their starting cave, each to a separate gameboard cave. The first player to find a new cave for each of his/her road runners wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Snuggly Bugs
description:
CONTENT:
a central board
a number of square tiles depicting parts of caterpillars: heads, bodies, tails

OBJECT
to match the heads, bodies and tails to score the number of points shown on the bodies.

An entertaining game for children which plays very similar to Carcassonne. Place a tile wherever it matches and claim the points.
I introduced the variant of providing each player with a counter, so they can claim one bug as their own to be finished later, like in Carcassonne. That way, players are not exposed to be stolen their bugs and encouraged to build longer bugs.

It turns to be quite fun due to the pictures and also when any child by mistake place two heads or two tails together.... X-Mutant bugs!!

name: A Kingdom For A Horse: The Battle of Bosworth
description:
"A Kingdom For A Horse" is a Renaissance wargame that covers one of the more important battles in English history: Bosworth (1485), wherein, Henry, Earl of Richmond, defeated King Richard III - the much maligned, but still infamous, supposed killer of those two poor little Tower Tykes - and gained the English crown for the House of Tudor as Henry VII."

Desktop published containing an 11" x 17" color map, 140 color paper counters (to cut and paste), played an indeterminate number of turns until one side achieves Victory.

name: Slik Move
description:
Even though the maximum is 8 players any number can play (I've raced with 30+ cars before now).

The idea is to get round the board as quickly as possible. There is a racing line that each driver must find which is quickest by 15% but this can be hard to find if you are caught up in a race long battle!

Movement is via two SLIK Moves dice (6 sided but with numbers only from 3-6) to ensure close racing. There are red and blue cards that can bring good or bad luck. These have to be acted upon immediately. Red are for entering corners and blue are for exiting corners.

You can dictate how many laps to run around a really nice and detailed board. The idea is to reflect real racing where passing can be difficult as you may have to go off the racing line and and make it stick! So, essentially it is a mixture of skill, luck and good dice throwing.

name: The Dice of Wrath
description:
The game comes with short rules, a pad of scoring paper, and five dice. The dice show the characters from the comic book Knights of the Dinner Table: 1 = B.A., 2 = Bob, 3 = Dave, 4 = Sara, 5 = Brian and 6 = Hoody Hoo!

The theme is RPG characters dividing up treasure after defeating a dragon. The score sheet lists 11 items, with six "voting" blocks for each item. Most of the items are positive points; some are worth more to certain characters than to others; one gives negative points and one is neutral, but grants a special ability the second and third round.

Each player takes on one of the roles and has his/her own score sheet. It's an interesting Yahtzee variant, where you roll the five dice three times on your turn, keeping any faces you want. You then assign the faces on your own score sheet. Once a player is done, the next player takes his turn, etc. When all have gone, start a second round. The first two rounds are public knowledge: if asked, you must tell how you voted on a given item. The third round is secret, however.

After three rounds, count up the votes for each character for each item. There are tie-breaking rules. High score wins.

During the game you can make deals and break them - this will be no surprise if you've read the comics. You must record your votes in ink, though!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fantasy, Negotiation

name: Rally
description: Rally features a car road rally. The game has a unique movement system where movement is determined by by making lines of tyres/stop watches/fuel/spanners on a 3*3 grid, by placing cards from your hand. The more identical symbols in the line you make, the faster you can go. Blocking on corners and single lane roads can also be used to your advantage. Quite a unique system.

name: Tir et But
description: Bearing the sponsorship and endorsement of the French Football (that's "soccer" to our American chums) Federation, Tir et But (shot and goal) is a bespoke dice-fest football simulation. The playing area is a well-designed plastic arena, with a football pitch embossed on the green baize playing area. Players take it in turns to launch attacking moves based on combinations of dice throws. The defender then has a chance to save the shot, before launching a counter attack. Mechanically, Tir et But owes quite a lot to poker dice, the strategy depending mainly on assessing the risk after the first attacking throw and selecting which dice to retain, whilst re-throwing the remainder. Instructions are in French only, but are very easy to grasp, with a simplified crib-card on the back of the box. A Rugby version of the game, employing identical mechanics, is also available.

name: Ouija Oracle Card Game
description:
Now you can search for the answers to all of life's questions with this game of fun and surprises base on Parker Brothers' popular Ouija Board. Fifty-two cards ask questions about life, love, and fate. Players score points by selecting the same answer as the Oracle.

Contents:
52 cards
6 Forecaster stones
2 Answer wheels
1 score pad

name: Kassle
description:
Players take turn placing tiles onto a 5x5 square board.
As an alternative to placing a tile a player may shift a row or column lengthwise,thereby possibly dislodging an opponents piece (which re-enters the board on the other end of the column/row). The goal is to get five of your tiles in a row.

High production value makes this abstract strategy game an interesting acquisition. Rules and equipment to play Chasse are included in the box with Kassle.

name: Path Of Pharaohs
description:
Path Of Pharaohs is a Free Print and Play card game provided by Crosstown Games (http://www.geocities.com/crosstowngames) comprising of a card game which plays like a board game.

You are one of many young pharaohs attempting to be the first to build a pyramid upon the ancient ruins of Alexandria, but first you must build upon 12 sites in the lower Nile River valley battling other pharaohs for exclusive use of construction locations.

The game plays out as you place number cards in the shape of a pyramid in front of you. Specific block locations allow for your pharaoh to be moved spaces along the path. No pharaoh may be building in the same location which causes loss of ground and time... Time? Watch out for the mummies that become disturbed as the game unfolds. They are jealous of their ancient site and allow no building upon them. Sandstorms, thieves, and opponent sabotage await your every move.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Number, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Trick-taking

name: Assault on Cherbourg
description: ASSAULT ON CHERBOURG is a two-player operational level (brigade/division) game covering the American drive through the bocage toward the French port of Cherbourg after the Normandy invasion in June, 1944. Daily turns, US airpower, supply, command control, more. (Includes map, 36 counters, rules.) Designed by Gary Graber.

name: Dr. Seuss' How The Grinch Stole Christmas Game: Movie Edition
description:
From the back of the box: Only you can stop the Grinch!
In Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas! Game, players race between their homes and Who-ville's Main Street stores, collecting presents on each trip. But while they're away from their homes, the Grinch is sneaking around, stealing their presents. To win, players must beat the Grinch, by collecting and keeping three presents.
Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas! Game is a great way for you and your children to enjoy the excitement of one of Dr. Seuss' favorite characters, all year 'round.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Quattuor Vincet
description: Goal is to get 4 pieces in a line. First all pieces have to be placed on the board. And you do not only put yours but also pieces from your opponent on the board. When all pieces are placed, pieces may be moved on free spaces.

name: Micro Fleet: World War 2
description: This wargame is a part of the Micro Warfare Series covering World War II naval combat. It is a miniatures-style game that includes cardboard ship counters. The rules cover individual ship command/gunnery rules, as well as rules for aircraft, weather, specific critical systems hits, flooding, and ramming. Specific counters are included to fight the Battle of the River Plate (Graf Spee vs. Exeter, Achilles, & Ajax) and the Sinking of the Hood (Bismarck & Prinz Eugen vs. Hood & Prince of Wales).
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Armored Stand
description:
Armored Stand is a an expansion for Advanced Squad Leader that uses the Platoon Leader campaign game system. Terrain overlays are included.

From the Publisher:

The new Platoon Leader 2.0 'Booster Pack' depicts the battle for San Manuel in the Philippines of 1945. Using Critical Hit's PL 2.0 campaign system, fans of ASL will be able to command the units of the late-war Japanese 2nd Tank Division in its battle against the American 25th Infantry Division and support units. It all plays out using your existing game components, using your choice of two campaigns, one short, one the whole 'nine-yards' covering the entire battle.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Quibble
description:
Quibbles is a word-forming game for one, two, or more players. When the Quibble sticks are laid side by side, they join to form then lines of ten letters each. Each stick has four sides, with a different combination of ten letters on each side, so that whenever the Quibble sticks are scrambled, a new combination of letters will appear. In each game, the players form words of three letters or more from the letters appearing across the Quibble sticks.

By mathematical calculation, it has been determined that there are 1,048,576 permutations possible in each line of ten letters. This represents the number of different letter combinations possible in each of the Quibble sticks. So, ten time this figure is the number of possible combinations within a game of Quibble.

The players write down their words simultaneously and the scores are tallied after each round. For a faster, more vigorous game, play with 2 players and a recorder in which players call out the words. Only the first one to say a word can score for that word. Points are scored based on the length of each word written down (ex: 3 points for 3-letter word).

--According to Sid Sackson's "A Gamut of Games":

Ten generously sized wooden sticks have ten letters arranged vertically on each face. These are randomly formed into a square array. Variations range from finding words in a single row, up to the entire array.

name: Laurent Fignon, le Vainqueur du Tour
description:
In this cycling game, there are 12 stages (including two time trials, a prologue and three mountain stages).

The game plays like Mille Bornes, you move by playing cards with a number of kilometers on them, and can hinder other players by playing handicap cards. After each stage you get points in order of finishing. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

The player who is in the lead after each stage must wear a yellow cap (included).

name: Word War: Competitive Crossword Game
description:
From the box,

"It's a war of words as players use vocabulary skills and the turn of a card to compose words, letter by letter. Player’s rack up points as letters merge and cross, forming completed words. The more "word power", the higher a players score."

Contains 9 wipe off boards, 4 felt tip pens and 54 letter cards.

name: Moolah
description:
Moolah is a traditional roll-the-dice move along the track game, wherein the object of the game is to have one million dollars in your bank account. Interest comes from the risks of keeping cash on hand vs. in the bank, as these are two mostly independent cash sources. Deposits and withdrawals can only be made at the 'Bank' or a few other squares, so attention must be paid to how much cash one has available.

Re-implemented by:

Moola Money

name: Dead & Breakfast
description:
Dead & Breakfast - A Spooky Game for 3 - 6 Players

"Your Goal: To Scare the Bejeezus Out of Tourists in a Haunted Bed and Breakfast"

Published in the October 2000 Issue of Dragon Magazine (#276). The pull-out board depicts a the 6 rooms of a Bed & Breakfast. Every card of a standard 52-card deck is represented by one of the spaces on the board.

Also needed: 8 D6 (including 6 of different colors for the guests of the B&B), plus 2 white dice for rolling; a score pad and pencil; about 30 chips in a unique color for each player; a standard deck of cards without jokers.

The 6 colored dice represent the guests, with the number showing representing their level of agitation (each starts at 2, mildly spooked). Each chip represents a ghost that can haunt a room on the board. Different ghosts belong to different players, which is why each player needs their own color of chips.

Play:
--Draw your hand up to 5 cards.
--Play a card and 'haunt' the room containing the card you played. To haunt a room, place a chip of your color on the top of the stack of chips in that room (unless a chip of your color is on the top of the stack), or begin a stack if none exists. You also haunt adjacent rooms that are already haunted (have chips of any color in the room).
--Move one guest according to the roll of 2 D6

When a guest lands in a haunted room, points are awarded to the ghosts in that room. Points (equal to the guest's spook level - number on the guest's die) are distributed among the ghosts in that room, with more points going to the top ghost.

If a guest stops in a room that is not yet haunted, the player (if any) holding the card for that room can play the card and 'surprise' the guest, scoring points for scaring that guest.

Each time the a guest lands on a numbered room, their rank (number on die) is increased by 1. If the guest is a 6, they 'freak out'. Freaked-out guests are worth negative points.

Play ends when the last card is played. Player with the most points wins.

A few variants are also included in the rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Arclight Games, Cheapass Games, Dragon, Paizo Publishing

name: Indix Junior
description:
20 Questions is the popular panel game in which the panel ask up to 20 Questions to guess the Person, Place or Thing. This edition should be called 20 Answers because you get 150 cards with 20 answers and the players in turn ask the Reader a number, and from that clue try to guess the answer. For each attempt a chip is paid, when the Guesser gets it correct, the Reader scores the chips paid, the Guesser scores the remainder. So getting it correct early scores you loads, getting it late scores the Reader loads. The board has a scoring track and there is an element of beating the Guesser too.

This Edition is especially for kids Ages 8 - 12.

name: Wings over Arras
description:
Wings over Arras is a card wargame that simulates the World War One air battle over Arras during the British offensive of April 1917. The British Player is trying to carry out air missions over German territory while German the player tries to intercept and destroy them. Successful British missions directly influence the success or failure of the Arras Offensive.

Game Components
• 18 Cards
• 1 Play Mat
• 2,7 pages of rules.

You also need a couple of dice and few markers to play the game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Wargame, World War I

name: Double Trouble
description:
A card game for 2 – 4 players with 60 cards.
The cards have 3 parts: below, in the middle and at the top of the cards.
In every part there is a colored symbol (yellow triangle, violet star, green circle, blue square).
Every card has a number.

At the beginning there are 4 cards on the table.
You have to place one of your cards aside of one of these 4 cards, so that 2 parts are in the same colors. Then the next player.

name: Nymble
description: In the first of three rounds, players roll a 30-sided die to choose a set of nine letters. They then have a limited amount of time to find pairs of synonyms, at least one of which is formed from the selected letters. Word pairs which match those found by other players don't count, nor do any pairs which are voted down by the other players as not being true synonyms. Bonus points are given for word pairs both of which are formed from the selected letters. Then a new set of letters are chosen and a second round is played using antonyms, followed by a third round with homonyms. High total score wins.

name: Trollig
description: The trolls have robbed the king's treasure and are holding it under a spell. Whoever uses his skill to strike the stone tiles with the magic stick can flip them face up and reveal a part of the valuable treasure. But watch out: if a Troll appears on a tile the magic in your stick is lost and your turn ends!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory

name: Verticon
description:
Mid-Air Combat

(from the back of the box)

Discover a sport unlike any other as you enter weightless mid-air combat. Choose your warrior, position your weapons, then go to battle ! Prove your superiority and overthrow your opponents one..by..one.

A game where one outfits a ping-pong like ball with 2 to 5 scale, plastic weapons. Place your ball in a stream of air against your opponent's. The balls will twist, turn and spin attempting to knock your opponent out of the arena. Each loss costs your opponent some of their weapons. When all of their weapons are gone, you win !

There is some strategy when selecting your ball and the color and type of weapons as they allow access to combat abilities that may give an edge during the elimination process.

Think of it as a 3D version "Battling Tops"... with weapons.

name: Zzzymble
description:
Zzzymble is a card game inspired by Sudoku and is a fast paced card game that is fun for all ages.

The box contains cards with five suits, containing the numbers 1-9, plus various special cards that affect gameplay. Players are trying to play their cards into a 5x5 grid. Cards may not be played adjacently (orthogonally or diagonally) to another card that match either number or color. When the grid is full, players sum card values remaining in their hands. Over a number of rounds (playing to 100 points), the winner is the player with the fewest points.

A planned forthcoming expansion is called "It's as Zzzymble as Zzzat."
publishers: 5 Minute Games, INK, JcT Designs LLC

name: Dice Alley
description:
This is a game with 5d6 where the "poker hand" you roll plus the total of the pips determines how "good" a ball you rolled. If not a strike, you roll all five dice again - if the poker and pips are good enough, you will pick up the spare.

A "five of a kind" is an automatic strike; failing that, a total pip count of 10 or less is a gutter ball.

From the back of the box:
"Finally -- A chance to experience the spine-tingling excitement of the bowling alley without leaving the comfort of your own living room! Hold your breath as you roll the dice -- will it be a Straight for a Strike? Will 2 Pair pick up the Spare? Or will you fall and roll a gutter ball!

Fun for the whole family! Scores just like bowling.

(Shoe rental not required, loud shirts recommended)"

Game Contents: Game result board + four "chips", 5 dice, Rules, and a pad of bowling score sheets with five entries on each.

Item #DA9901

name: Agvato
description:
Players attempt to get their pieces to the other side of the board first by using their cards. These cards are acquired on every turn and allow certain moves, either in direction or distance.

---

Jeder Spieler verfügt über 9 Spielfiguren einer Farbe. Der Zug eines Spielers wird durch Spielzugkarten bestimmt. Im Spiel sammelt man möglichst viele Chips ein.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Square Grid

name: Space Dreadnought 3000
description:
Space Dreadnought 3000 is a fast play game in which military and economic conflicts are fought out and decided through strategic skill and daring. Battlefleets leap across light years to compete for control of strategic stars and star-clusters.

Contents: 48-page rules booklet. Counters are provided for play without miniatures.

The rules are designed for use with Kallistra's Space Dreadnought 3000 1/3000 scale starships and 1/600 scale fighters, but spaceship models from any manufacturer may be substituted. A model represents one ship or a large number of fighters.

A 6ft x 4ft table is required if using miniatures or 3.5ft x 2.5ft table if using counters.

Rules are included for playing Tactical, Strategic and Campaign Games.

The TACTICAL GAME is played for 10 turns. Each turn is composed of the following steps:

1. Secretly write movement orders
2. Simultaneously execute movement orders
3. Secretly write combat orders
4. Resolve combat

Ships are grouped into fleets which move together between a dozen or so giant hexes representing a star system. The hexes are positioned in any of ten recommended configurations. The hexes are not arranged in a hex grid, but rather form paths or rings. Fleets unable to trace an uncontested path to a supply planet hex are at an extreme disadvantage in combat.

Aggressive movement plots can have dire consequences; fleets plotted to move THROUGH hexes occupied by a NON-MOVING enemy fleet are summarily destroyed.

Opposing fleets in the same hex battle. There is no movement during battle. Players simply roll a twelve sided die for each attacking ship and reference the ship's offensive table. The result is compared to the target's defenses. Combat may last several rounds until one side is destroyed or withdraws.

After 10 turns, the player with the greatest point value for all surviving ships is the winner.

The STRATEGIC GAME includes a couple scenarios played out using tactical rules.

The CAMPAIGN GAME is played on an area map for which players fight for supremacy. Each area represents a star system. Players may build naval bases. Conflict is resolved by playing a tactical game.

Optional rules include supply ships, command and control, alliances, team-play and multi-force campaigns.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Newton's Apples
description:
From the Press Release:

Red and green apples are placed on “crates” in one of eight rows at the top of an elevated game board. Apples away! By strategically moving apple crates and using Newton’s law of gravity, be first to get all of your apples to fall to the bottom row, while blocking your opponent’s apples. In the race for gravity to do its job, players move crates vertically or horizontally, and even line up crates to build bridges to move apples into new rows. Complete game rules are included along with the three dimensional, molded plastic game board, 8 apples and 16 apple crates.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational

name: Life on the Farm: Preschool Edition
description:
From the publisher:

Preschoolers love the happy animal scenes, deep colors and soft feel of We R FUN’s new preschool edition of “Life on the Farm”. Designed for the Ages 3 - 7 demographic, the soft non-toxic foam playmat (for floor play) is a huge 5-piece puzzle. When assembled, the playmate becomes the gameboard. Match colors to move - land on an animal square and get a matching animal puzzle piece to put into a soft barn puzzle. Fill the barn with animals to win. This game quickly became a favorite when tested by early education specialists.

name: Xombies Attack!!!
description:
Following on the heels of his extremely popular Treasure Quest, Steve Lefort brings you Xombies Attack!!!

Xombies Attack!!! is a whole new zombie experience, finally bringing you the look and feel of a classic Romero film that fits on your dining room table!

Terrain Note The terrain shown in these photos is from WorldWorksGames "Urban Mayhem"
product line. (Please note that ANY terrain will suffice for this game and this is NOT an endorsement of the WorldWorksGames Products)

In this grid based miniatures game, Xombies have overrun the city, lusting for flesh. Four very different squads must work their way through the city, fighting off hordes of Xombies while trying to reach their individual objectives. Search buildings, rescue panicked civilians, find weapons and items while avoiding nuclear obliteration. Quick paced tactics will award you victory! Recklessness will infect you with the bloodlust of the undead...

"Xombies Attack!!!" is currently under development and is slated for a 4th Quarter 2007 release.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Alle meine Entchen
description: The players take their ducklings for a swim. During their outing, they dive to collect water plants. The lucky duck that collects the most water plants wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fritze Flink
description:
Content:
31 character cards: the x,y,z,q are out

The active player draws himself 10 cards for his hand.
Now he has 90 sec of time to build words with his characters. A word must have at least 3 characters.
For a new second word he has to use the last character of his former word.
The not used characters of the first old word can be taken in the hand again.

When time is over, the active player gets as many points as characters are in his words.

name: Ghoul!
description:
The frightful ghoul is hanging around in Scary Castle. The little ghosts quickly hide! Will the frightful find and frighten them with a loud "Booo"? A wickedly frightening guessing game for 2-5 players.

Further info: Each ghost must choose a room within the castle where they can hide. One player chooses a room card and keeps it hidden from the other players. Who will be frightened when the ghoul shows up in their room? Ages 4+. Included: 1 game board 5 little ghosts 6 room cards 15 eerie tiles 1 set of game instructions - For Age Range:

name: OHMU War Machine
description:
A science fiction miniatures wargame with very streamlined rules to enable large scale battles to be played in reasonable periods of time.

The rules allow for a whole range of unit types from basic flak-jacket and assault rifle infantry, up through power-armoured infantry, tracked/wheeled/hover AFVs, WIGE (ground effect) units, enormous OGRE-style nuclear powered cybertanks and all kinds of mech (akin to Battletech, Robotech etc.) units - two, three four and six-legged are all accounted for.

The rules are for 1/300th scale units, enabling players to easily assemble an army from a variety of sources and manufacturers including Battletech figures, Epic WH40K figures, Ground Zero and a plethora of small white-metal figure manufacturers.

Included are outlines of the eight major power-blocs in the future world of OHMU, each with their own particular "flavour" - from the ultra high-tech Pacific Rim Coalition to the more direct approach of the Russian Commonwealth; however all the army lists are very well balanced having been extensively playtested.

Although nominally a 2-player wargame the mechanics do easily permit more players to participate either as sub-commanders on two opposing sides, or even as a three-way (or more if you're ambitious) battle.

A very effective command & control framework is a key element of the game mechanics. Another innovative concept, far ahead of its time, is the inclusion of scenarios that players bid on, attempting to undercut each other's force values. The scenarios (if one opts to use them) themselves provide variety to the battles thus avoiding the typical "line up two equal armies and attack" situation.

96 page softcover A4 rulebook. Black & white illustrations throughout, with 8 colour plates.

(And in case you were wondering, OHMU stands for Oversized Heavy Mechanized Unit...!)

name: WreckTangle
description:
WreckTangle is a designed for Icehouse Pyramids. Players form a rectangle with their pyramids and capture pieces on the edge of the rectangle or the interior. A player is eliminated when three of her pieces have been captured. The object is to be the last player left in the game.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - 2nd place in 7th Competition

name: Bar
description:
The object of the game is to get rid of the chips on the board with good dice combinations by trying to make as many points as possible.#

This is game No. 5 (of at least 12) in a family called "Miniplays".

name: Huaiquiman y Tolosa 2
description:
In Huaiquiman y Tolosa players receive objective cards. Each card shows different characters and the places of the board where they should be.

In a turn, a player can move two of the six characters, trying to reach their objective and gain the victory points the card gives. But this is not easy, since the next player can move the characters in the opposite direction.
You can also gain victory points when someone fulfills their objective on your turn, in which case both players share their points.
There are also action cards that can change everything in a second.

The first player reaching 20 points wins the game.

This game was developed for the second season of the TV Show of the same name, and the situations are a reflect of the ones happening in each chapter.
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tippecanoe Game
description: The game is about 20 inches long, 14 inches wide, 1 1/2 inches deep. There is a lid which slides out through the top end to reveal the playing board inside. There are yellow wood slats and blue slats that connect to them to let them slide up & down. Some versions of the game come with red wood paddles which are 8 inches long with 2 different length yellow pegs attached which fit into the holes along the sides, but not all versions have this. The game comes with a wooden dowel over 18 inches long and two small steel balls with etched symbols on them. The goal of the game is to move the ball down through the tipped slats so that it ends up going through the 150 metal loop at the bottom in order to score maximum points for your turn.
