name: Leapfrog
description:
Leapfrog is one of those games about whose origins we know very little. It was invented some time before 1898, as the game historian H. J. R. Murray invented his own variation on it in that year.
It is an unusual game in that any number of people can play, almost without limit.

It is played on a square grid, whose size is 15 to 18 squares on a side. It is essentially a multi-player solitaire, where a player can make multiple jumps as in draughts. The winner is the person who has captured the most pieces when no more moves are possible.

In the original, pre-1898 version, the pieces are undifferentiated. In Murray's 1898 version, pieces have colour to denote scoring, some pieces being more valuable than others.

name: Mahlzeit!
description:
"Feed me!" the little yellow seal begs the zoo keeper.
"No, feed me first – I’m much more hungry!" the green seal whines.
And at once all four seals open their mouth and start howling. Desperately the zoo keeper looks from one seal to the other – which one should he feed first? A smart idea occurs to him; "Lets play a game together.Whoever wins, gets a fish!"
"Hurray, playing games is fun!" the seals cheer and flap their flippers. Impatiently they wait for the game to start.

Game 1. Feeding the Seals
Roll the die. If a colored seal appears either open or close it's mouth (on the game board). If a fish appears, and the corresponding seal's mouth is open, feed it. The game ends as soon as a player has fed a seal with their last fish.

Game 2. No, no – I Don’t Like Fish!
This is a variant of Go Fish, but with the fish tiles and the open mouthed seals on the board.

Game 3. I want fish!
As in Game #1 but each players has a secret seal (color) identity. When feeding a seal, if your color's mouth is closed, you must feed someone else's seal. The player whose seal has eaten the most fish wins.

name: Staggers
description:
From the publisher's website:

Easy to learn….hard to put away!
Just one round and you’ll be hooked!

Introduction

Staggers is a low-intensity social dice game involving two or more players. The object of the game is to score the most points possible during each turn. Players score points when a die or dice combination matches one or more numbers on the field of play. Players use glass markers to cover those numbers as they compete.

Game in a Nutshell

The first player rolls three dice onto the field of play, called the leather , then uses glass markers ( paddy flats , or flatties ) to cover numbers that match an individual die or dice combination (see Basic Roll). A turn ends when a player is topped —unable to use all three dice to cover one, two, or three numbers on the leather . On the final roll of a turn, a player is allowed to cover as many numbers as possible, even if all of the dice cannot be played. At the end of each turn, points are added up and recorded by the scorekeeper. The dice are then passed to the next player.

Players must always roll three dice. If a roll results in stacked or cocked dice, including those cocked against a flattie , all three must be rolled again.

The player with the most accumulated points wins the match.

Basic Roll
Dice can be added together or played as naturals. For example, a 2 , 4 , 5 roll offers five options:

Cover the 2 , 4 , and 5 .

Cover the 6 [2 + 4] and the 5 .

Cover the 9 [4 + 5] and the 2 .

Cover the 7 [2 + 5] and the 4 .

Cover the 11 [2 + 4 + 5].

This is just an overview….

You will also learn how to score the game. The 6 basic dice rolls. The Lexicon of Staggers, and much more.

name: Clash of Steel: The Card Game (Fantasy Edition)
description:
From Publisher's Site:

Clash of Steel the Card Game (Fantasy Edition 1.0)

Rounding out our suite of games, this card game is quick to learn and play. Each game lasts ten game turns. For two to four players, it features a common deck and a variety of creatures to keep things interesting. Players collect resource cards to win, and attack each other with creature unit cards, augmented by number cards. Optional house rules are given to make gameplay more challenging.

16 Different Creature Unit Types
12 Different Resource Card Types

name: Hold that Line
description:
Hold that Line was published in A Gamut of Games, a word by Sid Sackson:
"If all people who played Tic-Tac-Toe were laid end to end they would promptly fall asleep. That's is the kind of game it is. Yet put two people together with a pencil, a scrap of paper, and some time to kill and chances are they'll wind up playing endless games of Tic-Tac-Toe, with never a winner.
"Hold that Line is a game I devised to fill just such an odd moment. It, too, is played with a pencil and a scrap of paper, but there is a chalange and a winner in each and every game."

This game is played in a dotted grid similar to that of Dots and Dashes, but the objective is not to control boxes inside the grid, but to not be the last player drawing a line in the grid. Each line must be straigh and each player must play on either end of the line draw. The entire line must be continuous, without branches, crossings or a dot being visited twice.
publishers: Dover Publications, dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson, Random House, Inc., RBA Libros S.A.

name: Bible Journeys Number 1: Egypt to Canaan
description:
Bible Journeys Number 1: Egypt To Canaan

This is a religious trivia game. Players draw cards and answer questions about the Bible. If a player answers correctly that player moves foward the number of spaces shown on the card. First player to the Promised Land wins!

Includes a board, two decks of cards, 6 tokens, rules, answer book, and storage insert.

name: Im Neandertal
description:
From the same publisher of Vom Neanderthaler zum Ãtzi, another card-driven educational game with a prehistoric theme.
The cards represent typical elements in the life of Neanderthal men: companions, resources, dangers.
40 cards are distributed face down on the table: the players uncover one of them at every turn. In some cases they can keep the card (if, for example, it represents food, a companion or another useful resource), in other cases they have to remember the card position, because it can be useful later, for example to defend the player against a dangerous animal.
The winner is the first player to collect seven cards that he or she can keep (resources or allies).

name: Flea Circus
description:
From the publisher:

Roll up, roll up, hurry to pick your performers before they hop it! By throwing a dice and moving the ringmaster around the circus ring, players can collect or lose performing fleas. If your big top isn't complete when the audience arrives, your fleas will escape and you will lose the game !

name: Kamasutra Dice
description:
From the game presentation:

"Kamasutra Dice is a fun game where the player who comes first, comes last.

Do not worry if you do not complete the first game, this is quite common. Your endurance will improve with every game."

This game is a variation of the bluffing dice game "Little Max" (Mäxchen).

From the rules:
"First, everyone takes off their cloths. Then, if anyone still wants to play, someone should be assigned to go find the dice."
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: One Night in Taranto
description:
One Night in Taranto (makes a bald man humble) is a solitaire game on the attack of the Swordfish of the Royal Navy against the Italian Fleet in the port of Taranto, 11th November 1940. It resulted in serious damages to the ships, without much losses for the British planes. It was a great and bold success.

This game is a simple (4 pages of rules) recreation of that air raid, with a single map and 144 counters.
It plays fast and has a lot of variants, to make it re-playable several time.

Bought by LPS, has been published on the 2011 annual of Against the Odds, with the name of Terrible Swift Swordfish
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: X vs Y
description: This is a trivia game of men versus women in which all the questions are based around gender and have numerical responses. Each team answers questions about the opposite gender in regards to love, life, work, appearance, etc. Women could be asked: What percent of men report cheating on their taxes? Men could be asked: On average, how many pairs of shoes does a woman own? Teams attempt to place several cards in order from least to greatest based upon their guessed answers. Packaged inside is an electronic card scanner with automatic scoring (no more cheating here) and an adjustable volume. This electronic base communicates with players throughout the game, so there is no need for an instruction booklet.

name: Code Sudoku: My First
description:
This is a childrens version of the game Code Sudoku by Kod Kod International Games. This version uses two sided tiles with numbers with a corresponding colour and shape on one side or cute little pictures on the other. Puzzles range in difficulty with 4 x 4 grids of pictures at their simplest and 6 x 6 grids (unusual but it works) with numbers for the older / more experienced players. The puzzle sheet being attempted is placed into a plastic frame with a clear plastic cover over the top. The cover has a raised grid to hold tiles directly above the squares of the puzzle sheet. score tacks for 4 players run along the side of each puzzle sheet for competitive play in which each correctly placed tile earns a point.

Rules are in English but the game is language independent.

name: Arithmanix
description:
From publishers website:

There is no waiting around as everyone plays simultaneously against one another using mental arithmetic to add, subtract, multiply or divide the right combination of cards in their hand to equal the Arithmanix number.

The excitement builds as you race to be the first player to crack the calculation and then turn the timer to put pressure on your opponents to make their calculation before time runs out.
Pile up the points by equaling the Arithmanix number, or minimize your losses by getting as close to it as you can. Keep it simple to score quick wins or go for bonus points with a more complex calculation, but be careful not to get caught out by the dreaded order of operations!

Will you be the master of multiplication or be defeated by division? Every round throws up new number combinations and a new calculation to crack, in this clever game you will want to play again and again. Suitable for age 8+

Quick + Simple x Fun = Arithmanix

name: Wrath of Gods
description:
Wrath of Gods is an area control game set in ancient Greece where players take on the role of Gods (Ares, Poseidon, Aphrodite, and Artemis) in an effort to gain enough control over the people to overthrow Zeus. Each god in the game has unique powers and interacts with the game in different ways. Players will use these powers to try and gain control over the people, and build temples and fortresses for themselves to help solidify their victory.

The game is played over a series of rounds, in which players will simultaneously select one of their available action cards, and then execute them. Playing action cards costs the players wrath, which is the main resource in the game. While enslaving, converting, and battling your opponents followers can gain you the precious tribute and points you need to win the game, doing so will increase the other players' wrath, making their ability to respond that much more powerful.

- User Summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Play-Doh Toy Time Race Game
description:
Back of box: Things are going haywire in the toy factory! It's up to you to move your toys safely along the conveyor belt and into the gift box. But watch out for the other toymakers. They'll try to squish your toys or send them off the track! The race is on to see whose toys will make it to the gift box first!

Players mold different color play doh into their game pieces. There are 4 different molds and 4 different colors of play doh. They then spin a spinner and have a choice of 3 actions: Moving along the board, truning the crank mechanism (to make the pieces turn around...either making them closer or further to the goal) or to "recycle" an apponent's game piece by squising it. The player who gets 2 of their game pieces into the gift box first is declared the winner.

name: Welches Tier passt hier?
description:
In Welches Tier passt hier?, each player places an engine tile in front of him/her. The wagon tiles, each of which contains an animal, are placed face down on the table.

The active player picks up a tile, looks at it, and makes the appropriate sound of the animal. If it is an animal that fits to his/her train – each wagon can only be followed by a wagon containing a certain other animal – it is placed at the player's train; if not, it is returned to its place. Later, players should remember where to find the tiles they currently need. There are some conductor cow cards; these serve as jokers and can be placed behind any other wagon.

When three conductors have been added, the game ends and the player with the longest train is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: What's the Link?
description:
Each player has a card that features seven one-word clues. Each clue calls for a one-word answer that will complete a compound word or two-word phrase. For example, the clue may be "Black" and the answer "Jack".

The reader reads the first clue from his card, and the other players shout out as many possible answers as they can think of in ten seconds. The first player to guess the correct answer moves his playing piece three spaces on the board. If no one guesses the correct answer, the reader makes up a sentence to help out the guessers, such as, "Ben likes to visit Vegas to play Black ________." A correct guess now earns both the reader and the guesser two spaces on the board. The next player becomes the reader, and play continues until one player reaches the Finish line.

name: Outrider: (Not So) Passive Agression
description:
This expansion will include quite a few additions to the game:

Dropped/Deployed Weapons. Sometimes there's no better way to get away than to put something in your opponent's path, like oil, smoke, caltrops, mines, cinder blocks ... you get the idea - this expansion includes passive and deployed weapons with expanded rules to incorporate them. But that's not all ...

Auxiliary Weapons. Sometimes there's no better way to finish off your enemy than with something explosive, like rockets - This expansion brings with it new goodies that can take the place of your secondary weapon slots. So say goodbye to Mr. peashooter and say hello to Mr. flamethrower.

Contact Weapons. Who said auto-combat wasn't up close and personal? For those who prefer ramming to shooting, this deck will include a wide range of options of Rams, blades, snares ... if it's vaguely pointy, it's in here
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Crazy Tower
description:
The excitement is building with the Crazy Tower! Use the 10 bamboo discs, 19 bamboo pillars and 2 balance figures to stack your tower higher and higher, but be careful, or it all might come crashing down! It takes nerves of steel and a steady hand to make crazy towers.

In his turn player places a game-piece to tower and be careful not to collapse the tower and score minus points.

The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Rombalette Tischkegelspiel
description:
Objective: score most points
- acting by turns -
translation of 'Tischkegelspiel': playing table skittles
there are numerous different games (& publishers) with 9 skittles;
speciality of this game: unballanced ball
well known game:
each player rolls the ball three times into nine skittles;
numbers are summed up - highest sum wins

name: Friday the 13th: The Game
description:
Do you have what it takes to defeat Jason Voorhees? Jason and his evil creatures stalk the campers at Camp Crystal lake. Can you and your fellow campers survival?

Roll and move through out Camp Crystal Lake going into cabins and battling Jason & his terrifying creatures! Cabins are filled with weapons players must find to battle Jason & his creatures. Campers are all unique and also feature special abilities they can use when in a battle.
Objective of the game is to be first camper to kill Jason!
Game features a bonus scenario for players to play: Save the Kids! Based off the hit video game; campers will need to find missing kids hidden somewhere in Campy Crystal Lake before Jason kills them!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Witty Chronos Temple
description:
Witty Chronos Temple is an expansion for Witty Chronos. It contains

- material for a sixth player
- cards "Hydra" and "Minotaur", which provide an alternate path to victory
- cards "Wind", which multiply your score when you have several of them
- cards "Temple", which represent Gods with special powers that
can be activated by offering them cards. Each game features 5 of the 26 different gods.
- a variant for 2 players
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Negotiation, Party Game, Real-time

name: Was ist Was: Das groÃe Quiz
description:
Was ist Was: Das große Quiz is a combination board game/app facilitator, with players trying to answer questions on topics ranging from nature, wildlife and art to geography, history and culture. On a turn, the active player rolls a die and moves on the game board to see which topic she'll be quizzed on. Some locations show a bonus space, in which all players compete in one of five different app games, with the winner being the one who first:


Recognizes the correct animal.
Identifies the right sound.
Determines which animal is heavier, which building is taller, or which vehicle is faster.
Knows where to find a particular country.
Excavates a dinosaur first.


(If you're playing without the app, the active player chooses one of the topics for the bonus question presented to all players.)

name: Pescadores IntrÃ©pidos
description:
A game about fishery. You go out by dice rolls with your diver and take chances fishing sea creatures for points - harder game is tricker to get and rare, easy game worth less points. Once everyone has gone around once and is back, the one with the most points wins.

-----

Um jogo sobre pescaria, onde cada jogador movimenta seus peões pelo tabuleiro, conforme os pontos obtidos nos dados. O objetivo é chegar à zonas de pesca, onde tentarão conquistar troféus e pontos em cada pescaria. Criaturas marinhas pescadas em profundidades maiores valem mais pontos. Vence o jogador que possuir mais pontos no final da partida.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Battle of Midway 1942 AD
description:
From the publisher's website:

The selections of some of the “decisive battles” have sparked conversations over the years. Vicksburg over Gettysburg? The Metarus over Zama? Syracuse?

No one has ever questioned the selection of Midway as the decisive battle of the Pacific War. All agree that this one changed everything, as the Japanese plan to “lure” the remaining US fleet to its destruction led to a strategic defeat, due to code breaking, heroism, and remarkable timing.

Now you can play out this exciting battle and see if you can do better. The Battle of Midway, June 3-6, 1942 gives you all the parts you need to gain insight into the questions facing both sides. Paul Rohrbaugh’s design blends clean simplicity with a fine level of detail (even accounting for the Japanese planes intended to be assembled and used on the captured island!). It includes an overview map-board of the area, an off-map battle board, and a variant map with Midway in detail, where, for the first time, you can pursue the actual Japanese invasion of the island and see what might have been.

Rules cover battles in the air, planes versus ships and versus land, surface to surface, submarines, seaplanes, and more, all in rules designed to be fast, combined with challenges that encourage replay.

You know the history.

Now, see if you can change it.
Part of the TPS "Decisive Battles" series

That means straightforward rules, key insights into the history behind the game, and designs aimed at one-session conclusions and high replay value."

The Battle of Midway 1942 AD includes:
• One 11” by 17” map (containing the Game Map and Battle Board)
• Two Naval/Air Unit Deployment Charts ( Japanese and US)
• 176 counters
• This set of rules
• Four six-sided (D6) dice
• Two 8.5” by 11” inserts (map and rules for the optional variant game)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Just4Fun Colours
description:
Players play cards to occupy coloured fields on a map. A player wins by owning 4 directly adjacent fields horizontally, vertically or diagonally. If no player wins after 20 rounds, the player who owns the largest contiguous area (number of horizontally and vertically related fields) is declared the winner.

There is the version for 2-4 players, with bigger package (also bigger board and cards), colored (but same sized !) playing tiles :
Just4Fun Colours - 2-4 players.

_______________________________________________________
And here the predecessor from 2005, with numbers instead of colors :
Just4Fun.

name: Sackjeseech: Das Rheinische Schimpfwortspiel
description:
Memory-style game to build Rhenish-German swearwords out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting Rhenish dialect words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun. The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to discussions about local dialects, but the one finding most (new) matching pairs is the winner.

name: Ou-sama no Macaron
description:
This abstract game uses pieces shaped like macaron cookies in five different colors (pink, blue, brown, green, and yellow) with four different colors of filling (pink, brown, green, and white). The pieces are played on a cloth board with a checkered grid playing area.

The game comes with two sets of rules. For rule set #1 (2 players only), players begin with 7 pink, 5 brown, and 5 green pieces each and take turns placing them on the board. The winner is the first person to line up at least three pieces of the same color in a row. If both players place all of their pieces without getting three in a row, the second player wins.

For rule set #2 (2-4 players), players take turns drawing random pieces from a bag and placing them on the board. If a player manages to surround any number of pieces in a line (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) with two cookies of the same color (one on either end), the player captures all of the surrounded pieces. The captured pieces are worth points at the end of the game. Bonus points are obtained by capturing sets of certain color combinations. When all pieces have been played, the person with the most points wins.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â Sakharov Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for the "Peak Performance" episode Organized Play event.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Word Dominoes
description:
Take turns placing dominoes which link pictures together to suggest words and phrases. Earn points when others guess your phrase or when you guess someone else's phrase. Each domino consists of two simple icons placed at each end and representing common items such as "head", "house", "sun", "knife", etc.

Every person starts with two dominoes in their hand and play on a starting tableau of 4 dominoes in the center of the table. They also have pen and paper to record their guesses.

On your turn play one of your dominoes onto the tableau to form a word or phrase from the two adjacent pictures. Any combination is allowed but you're only joining two icons. Write your phrase secretly on your paper. For example, "bird" and "hand" could be "bird feeder", "a bird in the hand", "pet bird", etc.

Others now write on their papers what they think your word or phrase is. Once everyone has made their guesses score points as follows: everyone scores one point for guessing correctly, the turn player scores one point for everyone that guessed his phrase or just one point if everyone guessed his phrase. A 2 point bonus is awarded the player who solely guessed the phrase.

First player to 11 points wins the game.

name: Criminal 're In Detective
description:
User Summary:
Among a group of detectives there is the perpetrator of a murder.

The culprit is one of the players, and the other players become detectives. The players investigate the "time of the crime", "weapon", "motivation" and "perpetrator" of this incident. The detective who manages to correctly identify these four elements wins. Otherwise, it will be the culprit's victory.

Will any detective manage to identify the culprit's trick and find the evidence to drive a confession from the culprit!?

Designer Summary:

æ¢åµéã®ä¸­ã«æ®ºäººäºä»¶ã®ç¯äººãç´ãè¾¼ãã§ãã¾ãã
