name: Hints
description:
The only real gestures game.

"Hints" is a game in which you can not be speak. You must make word or words combination clear to the rest of your team without speaking it. The categories 'saying', 'film', 'TV', 'songs', 'books' and 'radio' have fixed gestures. Your teammates have 60 seconds to guess what you gestures mean.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: En Passant
description:
In a distant kingdom, the royal palace is in turmoil. After one of the king's tasters dies of poisoning, the king no longer knows who to trust within his closest circle of confidants.

There is the Queen, who he married to secure the relationship with the neighboring kingdom, but who does not share the love he has for her. Their daughter, the Princess, next in line to inherent the crown and friends with enemies of the king. The Bishop, who has spoken aloud that the king should be replaced by a spiritual leader. The Knight, just back from war with the neighboring kingdom and in a rage that the war had ended through marriage and not bloodshed. The Rook, who has become senile in his old age and now wandering the halls of the castle aimlessly. And the Pawn, ready to rise up in the ranks of the royalty by any means necessary.

Can you help protect the king through the seasons of time and ensure that he remains atop his throne? Or will the tyrants prevail and take his crown from you?

En Passant (from French: in passing) is a special move in chess that allows an opponent to capture another pawn "as it passes" which was the inspiration for this game.

In this 16-card playing card game each player is dealt four cards. The player with the King card in their hand goes first. Starting with that player, each player plays a card and performs the action listed. For example, one card may have you steal another players card. Or another card may have everyone pass their hands to the player on their left.

Your goal is to keep track of the King Card as he travels from player to player. Once someone is only left with one card the round ends and the player with the King Card gets a point. The first player to 3 points wins the game.

name: WyrmRider
description:
WyrmRider is a 2 player microgame in the one page "postcard" style

Setup: One player places the 3 wyrms anywhere on the 6 spaces on their side of the board. The other player places the 4 riders anywhere on the six spaces on their side. Players may orient the counters in any direction.

Play: Beginning with the wyrm player, each player takes a turn by rotating, moving and combatting.

Rotating - A player may rotate their counter 60° clockwise or counterclockwise.

Moving - The player may then move any counter 1 hex in distance in any direction, maintaining the counter’s current orientation. If the player chose not to rotate a counter they may instead move a counter 2 hexes in distance.

Combatting - After rotating, and/or moving, a player may attack one adjacent piece of the opposing player with any of their counters. A player may only attack in the directions indicated by the red arrows (arrows must point perpendicular to an adjacent hex side). Players each roll one six-sided die, the attacking player gains a +1 to their roll.

If the attacker’s roll is greater than the defender, the defending piece is removed.

If the defender has more than one counter adjacent to the attacking counter and they have lost combat, they may immediately combat once as a new attacker, before the start of their normal turn. The +1 rule applies.

Win: A player wins by moving one of their counters on to the
opposing player’s home space.

name: HARTU!
description:
A family friendly abstract strategy game designed for two or four players played on a multi colored checkered board.

The object of the game is to score as many points as possible by moving both your own pieces and those of your opponents off your colored edge of the board.

This is accomplished by rolling the die and deciding whether to choose to place a new piece on the board, move one of your own playable pieces, or move an opponent's piece that is currently located on your colored half of the board.

At the end of the game, players tally the points in their booty bags and the player with the highest point total is the winner.

name: Molon Labe
description:
This game is an exciting family war-game.
Atmospheric, beautifully executed game.

Very simple rules.
The aim of the game is to capture (to destroy) towers of opponents and to save own. You have 4 generals, which you can develop.
The peculiarity is that to win you have to capture at least one tower of each opponent.

The objective of the game is as follows: the value of the cube + the overall level of a General (1....4) + 1 (if you are near the tower) + the value of the coin of reinforcements.

As in real war, the victory happens with a genius commander + luck!!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Solitaire Survival
description:
You are stranded in the wilderness and must gather resources and craft items in order to survive while maintaining your health and food levels.

On a turn, you perform one action (claim resources, craft item, or rest) then roll the die to see which event impacts you. You win if you craft all 5 survival items. You lose if your health or food drops to zero.

This is a postcard game. The board is printed on an oversized postcard. 12 small tokens and a d6 are not included and are required to play.

name: Superfight: Tabletop Day 2016 Promo Pack
description: This mini-expansion for Superfight: The Game of Absurd Arguments features 9 characters and 9 attributes from the minds of Geek and Sundry. Shuffle these cards into your deck to destroy your friends as Felicia and Wil, or arm yourself with magic missiles and awkward silences. Huzzah!
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Ninja All-Stars: Howl & Yip
description:
Miniature expansion for Ninja All-Stars.
Includes 1 additional character and Reference Card.

Heuler, an outstanding warrior with a temper, and the small child he calls Fieps are traveling over Kagejima and living the hard live of Ronin.
It is told he fell in love with a Kunoichi in his past.
He didn't know about her engagement with the prince of her clan until the birth of their son.
To keep his honor he forsake his name and swore vengeance to the prince.
publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ulisses Spiele

name: Robogem: lisÃ¤kortit
description:
An expansion to Robogem board game. Contains 24 new cards, 8 new tiles and new rules.

- Repeat statements allow commands to be repeated infinitely or five or three times.
- Conditional statements allow for finer control: conditionals can check if it's possible to move forward, left or right, or if there's a diamond in front of the robot.
- Special cards allow robots to hijack diamonds, turn towards the closest diamond, jump over obstacles or destroy obstacles.
- Equipment cards include a rocket motor, super powers, extra card powers and the possibility to hijack someone else's robot for a turn.

New tiles include hologram plates that are safe spots for robots.

The new cards allow for more complicated programming.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: The Worst Game Ever: The Best Expansion Ever
description:
Description from the box:

55 new and annoying ways to frustrate your friends in this maddening (and hilarious) expansion to the game that everybody loves to hate: The Worst Game Ever!

name: Eclectica
description:
Eclectica is a word-based game for two or more players. Teams compete to decipher clues, get words, and phonetically rearrange them to find answers. The first team to identify the correct answer wins the point!ââ

Clues are based on all subjects - ranging from art to mathematics to idioms in the English language - so there’s plenty of room for everyone to play!
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game

name: Ninja All-Stars: Yobuko
description:
Yobuko is a Clan Ijin-themed Hero for Ninja All-Stars. Heroes bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. Each Hero is themed to a single clan and make must-have additions for players who pick up the clan box.

Tall, strong, and fierce, Yobuko is also young and inexperienced compared to his Ijin counterparts. This blend of natural ability coupled with an, as yet, unrivaled capacity to fight might be the most frightening aspect about him. His power is already so incredible that he is already the rival of many of his masters, and he is also constantly testing his mettle against full-blooded oni twice his size to the amazement of all of his clansmen.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Ferocious and Powerful Ijin Clan Hero
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: No Mercy
description:
Based on the card game "War", but with a twist. Take part in the epic battle between gun-toting kitties and power-hungry aliens.

If you have ever played the game of "War", then No Mercy will be instantly familiar. "No Mercy" follows the same game mechanics, in which each player turns over the top card of their deck, and the player with the highest card wins.

But there is a twist: the player with the lowest number has the option to pull the facedown card from the top of the modifier deck; modifiers can add or take away from your card's number, and can also be an action that has a positive or negative result on your hand.

As with war, the winner is the first person to lose all their cards, or, optionally, the player with the largest deck when a time limit is reached.

Each card contains an imaginative drawing by the children's book illustrator and comic artist Travis Hanson.

name: Furor Barbarus: Lyndanise 1219
description:
This battle shows the Estonians fighting the Danish in 1219 on the northern shores of Estonia.

Ownership of a game from A la Charge! series is needed to play this scenario.

The scenario includes 1 new map & 30 new counters.

name: Korocchi!
description:
In Korocchi!, you try to find the correct card that is determined by two (or three) unique dice, and whoever touches the correct card first score points. Each of the two dice in the basic game has two pieces of information:

• Color die: Shows you the outside color and inside color.
• Shape die: Shows you the outside shape and the inside shape.

Three different creatures (cat, bat and obake) are depicted on the cards, with these creatures appearing in three colors. Each card depicts one large creature in one color holding a tiny creature in another color. By pairing the two dice, you know precisely which one card to touch from all those face up on the table.

For an additional challenge, you can roll the third die as well. The faces on this die might just show that you play as normal scoring one or two points, or it might show the shapes or colors being reversed — which means you need to look for the opposite card (sort of) instead.

name: Quick Fingers
description:
Pay attention and concentrate!

You must be a keen observer to win Quick Fingers. Turn over your cards, and after making a quick calculation, decide what move to make, always trying to be faster and better than your opponent. Will you be the one to bring home the most booty? Pay attention to the challenges and never drop your guard in this game for clever, crafty crooks.

name: Cut the Rope: Magic
description:
OM NOM!

Mobile devices are unable to constrain Cut the Rope in digital form. The game managed to escape to the table — MAGIC!

Little green monster Om Nom loves candy. But it is so hard to get it! Help him get the sweets by playing chains of cards. Don’t forget to use the scissors card at the right time. Be careful – your opponents want to become the best friend of Om Nom too! To win, you will have to play smart and watch other players carefully.

In the beginning of the game, each player gets a pile of numbered cards. The goal of each player is to get rid of all the cards from their pile. A top card from a player’s pile can be played to any one of three available “levels”. However, you can only play cards to form chains in “levels”.

Cards in chains have to go in ascending or descending order and no number can be skipped. Players also have a hand of cards. Cards from the hand can be used to form “supplies”. Cards from “supplies” can be played to “levels” as well.

Cut the Rope: Magic is a bright successor of Cut the Rope: The Card Game set in a magic world of the broadly known mobile app expansion.

name: Flip Ships: Enemy Ship Promo
description:
During set up, add this card to the enemy deck.
During the enemy advance phase, this ship moves one row towards the atmosphere. If it enters the atmosphere, it inflicts 4 points of damage to the player's city. On the other hand, if this ship is destroyed, players will not receive damage this turn.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Crazy Ducks
description:
Turtles have 4 legs, flamingos only have 1 and the ducks have 2... Except the player's secret ducks which have 3! Can you uncover your opponents' ducks by counting legs?

Each player starts by drawing a secret duck tile. For that player each duck of that colour has 3 legs, all other ducks have 2 legs. Turtles have 4 legs, and flamingos have 1 leg.

Each player starts with 3 tiles on their hand, and 1 tile is player centrally in the table. On a players turn the player have to play 2-3 tiles in a row or column, adding it to cards already on the table. The following player have to announce how many legs there are in the just played row/column; according to that player. Once you figure out which secret duck a player has, you shout out the colour. If you guess correct you score all the tiles on the table. If you guess wrong the player you tried to guess score all the tiles on the table. Then a new round is played until all tiles are used. The winner is the player with the most scored tiles.

name: Jeu du Moustique
description:
Be the fastest to imitate the sound and the gesture of the biggest animal! An original game of war that mixes mimes and sounds of animals!
—description from the publisher (translated)

Soit le plus rapide à imiter le cri et la position de l'animal le plus gros ! Un jeu de bataille original qui mêle mimes et cris d'animaux !
—description from the publisher

name: Spellcraft Academy
description:
Classes are almost out at Cliffspire Academy. As a first year Arcana student, your final exam is to create a functional spell scroll. The more impressive and varied the spells, the higher your marks.

Of course you can't get your cauldron tuned quite right, and your quill of inscribing is on the fritz, and what does "Aveum" mean again?

Spellcraft Academy is a solitaire roll-and-write game played on a grid of letters. The player rolls a die to navigate the grid, selecting letters and copying them on a separate, blank grid. Points are scored for each completed word, chosen out of a word bank. The words in the bank are classified as either "aspects," "elements," or "methods," and combining them -- having one word use letters from another -- is the way to score big points.

After there's no space left on the grid to inscribe more letters, the game ends, and points are tallied. A grading rubric tells the player whether they've passed the test... or failed, and need to take it again.


Released in the April 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

name: Ancestral
description:
The ancient Huarpes who habited the region of Cuyo performed different competitions to see which tribe was the favorite of the Gods. Of these competitions, the most daring one was mastering the Zonda wind. The most skilled of each tribe spent years practicing to master the aspects of the wind and other elements of nature that surrounded them. With these skills they faced each other in great competitions to obtain the favor of the Gods. Let the Ancestral tournament begin!

The objective of the game is to eliminate the other players, filling their hut with leaves.

—description from the publisher


Los antiguos Huarpes que habitaban la región de Cuyo realizaban distintas competencias para ver que tribu era la preferida de los Dioses. De estas competencias, la más osada era la del dominio del viento Zonda. Los más habilidosos de cada tribu pasaban años practicando hasta lograr dominar los aspectos del viento y de los demás elementos de la naturaleza que los rodeaba. Con estas habilidades se enfrentaban en grandiosas competencias para obtener el favor de los Dioses ¡Que comience el torneo Ancestral!

—description from the publisher (Spanish)
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Ludus Senatus
description:
Ludus Senatus, designed by Brian Compter,  takes its inspiration from the Roman Senate. Players control a tableau of three cards and take turns either revealing one of their cards and performing the actions listed on it or placing a card in the middle of the table and drawing a new card face-down to their tableau. When the center of the table fills up with the appropriate amount of cards each player checks the votes on their cards and compares them to the votes in the middle of the table. If the majority of their votes matches the majority of votes in the middle than the player scores points.

Contents:
18 Poker Cards
Folding Box/Rules

—description from the publisher

name: A Night Out: the party game!
description:
A Night Out is a quick and fun party game, that takes around 45 minutes each round.

The aim of the game is to collect 5 drinks that correspond with your player quality, and collect 1 going home card.

You'll be able to visit 5 locations, have 6 playable characters and dozens of action and drink cards!

Each turn, players:

Pick 1 token or action card
Can play up to 2 action cards
Are able to buy or exchange 1 drink card


The action- and going home cards are shuffled in 1 deck. This means action is guaranteed, and you’ll need to balance your choices between token or action cards!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Something Wicked
description:
Players become witches gathered around a large plastic cauldron. Starting with 2 wands of each color, each turn players choose to take one of 3 actions (Bubble, Toil, or Trouble) with the goal of being the first player to have 13 wands of the same color.

Round and round the cauldron go,
Magic wands you use to throw,
Into the bubbline caustic stew,
The items of a witches brew.

With bubble toil and trouble played,
Collect wands of a single shade,
From the broth a boiling green,
Until the wands you have thirteen.

From whence the best witch screams in toungues
Something wicked this way comes!

There is no hidden information. The witch that has taken 13 wands of the same color wins!
(Description from the publisher)
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: Watch on the Rhine
description:
Watch on the Rhine: The Siegfried Line Campaign, 1944-45 (WotR) is a two-player (solitaire adaptable) historical simulation of the final operations of World War II in northwest Europe.

Each hexagon on the map represents 10 miles (16.2 km) from side to opposite side. The units of maneuver are almost all divisions or brigades or their ad hoc equivalents. There are two corps-sized units representing the First Allied Airborne Army when it’s used in paradrop operations. Each full game turn represents 10 days to one month of ‘real time,’ depending on the time of year.

The maps illustrate the militarily significant terrain found in and around this border area of western Germany in 1944-45 when portrayed at this scale. The national boundaries shown are the final internationally ones from just before the war began in 1939.

A hexagonal (“hex”) grid is printed over the map to regulate the placement and movement of units across it, much like the squares in Chess and Checkers. A unit is considered to be in only one hex at any one time. Every hex on the map has a unique four-digit identification number printed within it. They’re provided to help find exact locations more quickly and to allow for the recording of unit positions if a game has to be taken down before it can be completed.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Bullrings
description:
Bullrings has a different approach and feel in the way that a game is played. Your opponent places your six pieces on the board in any configuration they want. Each piece is placed on a white dot. Your task is to reunite your pieces into one stack. The first one to do so wins. Players start out with six numbered pieces; one (1), two (2), and three (3). The numbers on the pieces indicate the number of spaces (dots) a piece can travel. Pieces can pass over their own or their opponent’s pieces, but cannot land on a dot occupied by an opponent, only their own. When a player lands on their own piece it is combined into a stack with the top piece number representing the number of moves that stack can travel. Players can have multiple stacks that they create as they are striving for their single stack. This simple and easy to learn game will surprise you on how fun it is to discover the complexity of moves and strategies that will keep this game fresh and challenging.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Fletter
description:
What you have in your hands is an exciting, challenging, adrenalin-pumping word game.

The way to play it, is to shout out words from letters placed before you, before the other players can. There is no timer. But, you gotta think fast and act faster than your opponents to claim your words. The words you claim give you points.

The game is played in 4 rounds, starting from 3-letter words to 6-letter words. At the end of the last round, the player with the most points is the winner. But, know this, if you wanna win, you must be prepared to lose your voice. Go on then, give it a shout!

—description from the back of the box

name: Grazing Sheep
description:
Keeping sheep well fed and happy is not as easy as you’d think. And these particular sheep are not the brightest of the flock as they need to be shown where the next area of fresh grass is.

If they don’t eat they soon get angry, and you don’t want to be faced with raging sheep. And their eating habits are erratic to say the least. Sometimes they’ll graze a whole quarter of the field, other times they just fancy a nibble.

You do have a sheepdog, Ollie, but he’s pretty lazy and will only help calm the sheep down if there’s a doggie treat in it for him. Now, is that the sound of irate bleating in the air?....

GAMEPLAY
A number of sheep (and four leaf clover) are randomly placed in a field. Your task is to help the sheep eat as much grass as they can. Each area of grazing is determined by the dice you roll. Completely grazed fields score more points.

There is a certain amount of push your luck - do you risk losing one of your limited supply of treats (lives) by going for that final grazing area to complete a field or move on to the next field and lose points for ungrazed areas? Lucky clover can help increase your chances of success.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: MÃ©zvadÃ¡szat
description:
Simple strategy game for every family members. In this game you can make a field with flowers. On this field your bee-family make honey.

- - - - -

A méhek azon szorgoskodnak, hogy nektárt gyÅ±jtsenek a virágokból és azt a kaptárba vigyék. Ott építenek belÅle méhsejteket. Ez kicsit sem egyszerÅ±, mert a nektárt át kell válogatni. Az is elÅfordul, hogy a méhek a közeli cukorkagyárból is elcsennek egy kis édes italt. A méznek ilyenkor szokatlanná válik az színe. A játék a mézért olyan logikai játék, amelyben a játékosok igyekeznek minél több pontot szerezni. Ennek érdekében kétoldalas, háromágú elemeket helyeznek az épülÅ rendszerhez úgy, hogy a jelek passzoljanak egymáshoz. Az a méh, amely a legnagyobb és a legtisztább méhsejtet készíti, a kaptár vezetÅje lesz.

name: Know Nine?
description:
Get ready for the fast-paced lateral thinking game that will make your palms sweat, your brain buzz, and your mouth ramble!

Link all the words on the grid, but be quick, you’ve only got a minute!

Only unique answers count and you’ll need to use your powers of persuasion to score.

Your competitors decide if your answers are allowed, so you need to be convincing when you argue your case.

Do you know nine, and will you score at all?!

—description from the publisher

name: Spank the Monkey (Second Edition)
description:
Spank the Monkey is a fast-paced, humorous card game with sneaky tactics. All players are working in a junk yard where a teasing monkey has appeared. Your job is to climb up to the monkey and spank it.

There are 5 types of cards in the game. Junk cards, like the totem pole, surfboard, and garden gnome, are used to pile on top of each other and form the "board" in front of each player. Each junk card has its own height, strength, and often a special ability when played. The combined height of your junk cards is used to see if you have reached the monkey. Some junk cards are a bit fragile, but they can be strengthened by reinforcement cards like duct tape, ivy, and a hired security guard. Each junk card also belongs to at least one category of which there are 7 in the game.

During the game, you attack the junk card of other players in an attempt to make them fall down, or at least lower them a bit. There are three kind of attacks; throwing attacks (bowling ball, flock of seagulls, and dynamite) that you can use on any junk card, hand attacks (chainsaw, blind, and crowbar) that you can only use on cards at the same height as yourself, and the sneak attacks (lawyer, wasp’s nest, and ball cannon) that all have special abilities.

A die roll is used to solve the attack. You add the attack value of your attack card and compare it to the combined strength of the attacked junk card and any reinforcement cards it might have. The defending player may play defense cards that either lower the die roll (umbrella, satellite dish, and wok) or completely stop or redirect the attack (electric force field, tennis racket, and trampoline).

If a junk card is destroyed, you have effectively lowered that player's height by the height of the card, and if there are junk cards above the destroyed card, they fall down, and the defender is forced to make a collision roll to see if the junk cards also are destroyed.

The fifth card type is called special, and it is a kind of catchall for all the crazy special effect you may do in the game. There are all kinds of tricks, like giving you an extra turn, starting an earthquake, and having a police raid.

NOTE: The expansion Monkey Business has been included in the base game since 2007.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Take That

name: Bom Láº¯c
description:
A super ridiculous, stupid, nonsense game but extremely suprised and fun!

Roll a dice and see who is gonna exploded, the one standing still in the end is the winner.

With special ability cards, you can play up to 50 people!

—description from the back of box

name: Unsolved Case Files: Max Cahill
description:
On October 26th, 1995, the campus of a small Georgia college, Tubman University, was shocked by the brutal murder of the newly-appointed dean of the history department.
â
The victim, Max Cahill, was working late in his office when the killer bludgeoned him to death. Despite several viable suspects, police were forced to close the case because they couldn't determine how the killer got to Max while avoiding detection by video surveillance cameras.

Your job is to solve the mystery by finding evidence that will re-open the case and convict the real killer. But who was it?

In order to solve this cold case murder mystery game you’ll need to find 3 separate clues that crack open the case. First figure out how the killer got to Max. Then disprove a key suspect's alibi and finally identify the clue that will put the real killer behind bars for the murder. With 3 different mysteries to solve in order to play the game, this case will challenge your investigative abilities.

To get past each step of the case you’ll need to visit an online answer page that requires you to prove you cracked it. If you don’t have the answer right you can keep investigating without being spoiled by the right answers.

name: Exodus
description:
Campaign with your friends through each mission to unlock the secrets of the Xenohunter universe. Where did these mutative effects come from? How could an alien outbreak such as this spread so quickly? Is there something more sinister behind their sudden appearance? ... do your team know more than they say?

—description from the publisher

A choose-your own adventure style game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Pilgrimage: Start your journey
description:
Go on a journey through Europe for the most beautiful pilgrimages.
Create your own route and be the first to visit the most beautiful places. Choose the right means of transport and outsmart your fellow players. Go on foot, by plane or with the boat. Collect as many holy objects as possible to earn some extra points. Choose the fastest route, and be the first player to collect 12 shells and win the game!

Pilgrimage is a 2 to 4 player game that takes about 45 minutes to play. Players make a pilgrimage in search of beautiful pilgrimage places. To prove that they have reached one, they collect route tokens. With these route tokens, players commemorate their pilgrimage. Use boats and planes to speed up your journey and collect artifacts to make your commemoration worth more points. Which of your family or friends makes the largest pilgrimage?

During the game, players use the cards in their hands to move around the board. Each turn you play one card that indicates how many steps you're allowed to move forward. When you reach one of the four destination that are shown in the top corner of the board, you may pick that tile an place it in front of you. Players instantly receive the shells shown on the tile. Keep in mind that the tiles should always fit in your collection by connecting the lines, if not, you cannot collect them. Players also have personal powers and ways to bother their opponents. The first player to collect 12 shells wins the game.
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Movement Points, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Hool!
description:
Hool! is a traditional Korean rummy game also known as Hoola. You can play with a traditional deck of playing cards, with the cards ordered A23... up to ...JQKA23... so that they loop. Each player starts a round with seven cards in hand and one card face up to start a discard pile.

On a turn, the active player must draw the top card of the deck or the discard pile, but they can draw the latter only if that card will be part of a new meld. After drawing, they can meld a set or sequence of three cards. If this player has a meld in front of them, whether from this turn or an earlier one, they can add to melds already on the table, adding a fourth 6 to a set of three or adding a 2 to a QKA sequence. Additionally, you can meld a 7 on its own to the table.

To end your turn, if you still have cards in hand, discard a card. If you now have no cards in hand, the round ends. Players are then ranked by their points still in hand, with an unplayed 7 being worth 14 points, and players give points to the winner based on their ranking. The worse your rank, the more you pay. Additional penalties might double what you pay depending on what you have in hand.

Alternatively, if you have melded no cards, you can end the game with a blast by having a point total that is small or large enough based on all seven cards in hand. Also alternatively, if you have at most 10 points in hand at the start of your turn, you can call for the end of the round. If you have the smallest total, you're ranked first, but if anyone has fewer points than you, you're automatically ranked last.

name: Way of the Mandalorian
description:
In the board game Way of the Mandalorian you will take on the role of one of the four characters from The Mandalorian series. Rescue little Grog and make a name for yourself! Your goal will be to complete increasingly difficult missions, for which you will receive credits. The player who obtains the most credits at the end of the game will be the winner.

—description from the publisher

W grze planszowej Way of the Mandalorian wcielicie siÄ w jednego z czterech bohaterów z serialu The Mandalorian. Uratujcie maÅego Grogu i zyskajcie sÅawÄ! Waszym celem bÄdzie realizowanie coraz trudniejszych misji, za które otrzymacie kredyty. Gracz, który pod koniec gry uzyska ich najwiÄcej, zostanie zwyciÄzcÄ.

—description from the publisher (Polish)

In dem Brettspiel Way of the Mandalorian schlüpfen Sie in die Rolle eines der vier Charaktere aus der Serie The Mandalorian. Rette den kleinen Grog und mach dir einen Namen! Ihr Ziel ist es, immer schwierigere Missionen zu erfüllen, für die Sie Punkte erhalten. Der Spieler, der am Ende des Spiels die meisten Credits hat, ist der Gewinner.

—description from the publisher (German)
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Contracts, Income, Market, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Monique
description:
Monique is an absurd party game of word associations that promises to spend delirious evenings!

The first player places a face-up card of his choice and reads it aloud, example "Goat". 4 choices are available to you:

1. Place a Word card face up. Your word must be related to the previous one. If the word has an obvious connection, for example "Cheese" with "Goat", your turn is over. If your word sows doubt, another player says "I don't see the connection". You have to justify the relationship between the 2 words. Everyone listens to your explanation and then they vote.

2. Place a Word card face down. This card may or may not relate to the previous word. A player can then say "You're bluffing!". You return your card and must justify yourself. The voting phase follows to find out if you have been convincing enough! If no one calls the bluff, it's the next player's turn. We start from the last Word card revealed.

3. Draw a card. You can play it immediately or skip your turn.

4. Play a Monique card instead of a Word card. Each card has its rules written on it. The next player starts from the last revealed Word card.

And the humor in all this? If you manage to make your accuser laugh, you win! The first player to play all his cards wins.

Spice up your games with the red cards: only to be taken out when the children and other sensitive souls are in bed. ;)

name: The Maniac
description:
The Maniac is a hidden movement horror board game for 1 to 6 Survivors in which you will have to survive the murderous rampage of a psychopath, but you could also be the murderous Maniac! A group of college students decide to reopen the old Black Pine Lodge in the mountains of Crystal Country. A place closed several times due to various misfortunes that have occurred over the years, but as soon as they arrive they realize that the place actually seems contaminated by something ancient and evil. They decide to explore the place, but it will only be when one of them finds a cursed mask that the real nightmare will begin! In The Maniac at the beginning of the game everyone is a "Survivor" but the real game begins when one of them finds the cursed mask. From that moment on he will become "The Maniac" and will have the goal of eliminating everyone else. The Survivors instead will have to try to escape from Black Pine Lodge by activating one or more endings. The Maniac is a hidden movement game where no one will ever know exactly where the other is.

-description from publisher

name: BrÃ¶wl
description:
Bröwl is a game where taking risks, opportunism and luck are the keys to victory!

Draw, play and anticipate, but beware of the value written on the cards of the different Peoples. As soon as the sum of a People's cards on the table reaches its value, that People wins the battle! All players with cards of this People in play can secure them and collect points for the end of the round.

Be sneaky, win battles quickly, don't let your opponents recruit too many creatures from each Folk, and be the first to reach 100 points!

Once you've mastered the basic game, variants and special cards are available to boost your gameplay.

—description from the publisher

name: Schwarz Rot Gelb Extreme
description:
Schwarz Rot Gelb Extreme is a quick-playing pattern-building game — well, anti-pattern-building really. The game includes 80 symbol cards and 30 point cards; each symbol card features some number of symbols on it, with multiple types of symbols and multiple colors of symbols.

Shuffle the symbol cards, then spread them out on the table. Reveal as many points cards as the number of players. Each player takes a starting card and places it at the beginning of a row. Simultaneously, players start flipping over cards to find one that fits next to their rightmost card, with "fits" meaning that neither the number of symbols on the card nor the number of types of symbols nor the number of colors are repeated on the new card. If you draw a card that meets this description, add it to your row and draw again; if not, place it face-up on the table.

Once a player has seven cards in their row, they call "Stop!" All players check their card rows for errors, discarding any mistaken card and all cards played after it. The player with the longest row of cards claims the highest point card on display; the player with the second-longest row the next highest point card; and so on.

Shuffle the color cards for a new round of play. After five rounds, the player with the highest point total wins the game.

name: Irish Wolf
description:
Irish Wolf is a betting card game for 3 to 4 players.

The game consists of 25 cards (5 each in five different colors and values from 1 to 5) showing a figure of a greyhound, 25 tokens (5 each in five different colors), and chips (e.g., 20 of value 1 and 20 of value 5). The game is about racing with greyhounds and its progress can be influenced by the cards each player plays. To begin, the cards are shuffled and distributed to all players. The remaining cards are placed on the matching color group, causing the greyhound of this color to take the lead in the race. Thereafter, all players play a card from their hand and the greyhounds then move forward according to the number on the respective cards. Players use their tokens to wager on a greyhound of their choice. The game ends when no tokens remain of one color. Players receive chips according to their tokens of the same color as the winning dogs. The player with the most chips wins.

Originally published in spielbox 1992 #1.

name: Wo liegt denn Honolulu ?
description:
This is a trivia game about knowledge of geography.
The map shows the northern hemisphere of our earth and above the 6 categories of questions: Continent, Surface area, Capital City, Inhabitants, Currency and Miscellaneous.

Each question card consists of 5 questions. Every player has to put between 3 and 5 chips on the corresponding categories. This indicates he claims to know the answer.
Correct answers allow him to change 4 chips into a knowledge marker, false answers will make lose him a chip.
Goal of the game is to get 3 knowledge markers in 3 different continents.

There are catastrophic cards that threat players losing their knowledge markers, but they can save it by answering additional questions from special card pile.

name: Caution, Under Construction!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Foreman Ben oversees a large construction site, making sure that all machines and vehicles are at the right place at the right time. But watch out! Sometimes Ben has to run to the menÂ's room. Who is the fastest worker, carrying out the most tasks for Ben?

Caution, Under Construction! is a high-speed construction-site card game.

name: Camino de la Gloria
description:
Camino de la Gloria (Path to Glory) recreates an Allied commando attack against a Nazi heavy water factory in Norway.

Heavy water is necessary to build an atomic bomb, so the Germans captured this Norwegian heavy water factory. An Allied commando of Norwegian soldiers were sent to sabotage the factory.

name: Safari Tours
description:
Memory game with a twist...
Who can remember where its animals are hiding? Flip three cards and see if you can find them!

Game components:
15 double-sided animal tiles
30 expedition cards (4 degrees of difficulty)
instruction sheet

name: Gutsy
description:
PLAYERS WILL EXPLORE THE UNSEEN WORLD OF MICROBES LIVING IN AND ON US

The American Museum of Natural History is introducing an original card game in conjunction with its exhibition The Secret World Inside You, which opens on Saturday, November 7. While working on the development of The Secret World Inside You, exhibition co-curator Susan Perkins, an avid tabletop game enthusiast, pioneered an idea to create a card game allowing players to learn about the community of microbes that live in our guts, known as the gut microbiome. Gutsy is based on the various ways we interact with those microbes on a daily basis and turns those interactions into a fun and educational card game.

The object of the game is for players to attempt to be first to create a healthy gut by diversifying their gut microbiome, which is influenced by what we eat and drink, whom we interact with, and the medicines that we take.

Two to four players draw from a common card deck, collecting microbes and pathogens to build their respective guts.

The first player to have six different kinds of gut microbes wins. The game is intended for players ages eight and up.

Perkins worked with the Museum’s Associate Director for Digital Learning, Barry Joseph, and high school students in the Museum’s Lang Science Program, educators, as well as Eric Teo, from the New York University Game Center MFA program, to create Gutsy.

Playing on the popularity of social card games like Sushi Go! and Killer Bunnies, the developers used illustrations, photos, and information created for The Secret World Inside You exhibition.
publishers: The American Museum of Natural History

name: Miracle Five
description:
Published in Japan, Miracle Five is an advanced version of Go-Moku. As in Gomoku, the aim is to get five of your pieces in a row. Unlike Gomoku, some of the pieces can be moved on the specially-designed board.
It was designed by Goro Hasegawa, who, according to the game box and website, was the inventor of Othello.

name: Need for Speed Trading Card Game
description:
Every Car you race will have its own combination of attributes in the areas of acceleration, handling and top speed. These strengths and weaknesses will be tested when you are forced to complete Driving Tests, either as you pass through certain Checkpoints on the Track, or from Events or Maneuvers cards played by your opponents. Fail the test and depending on the card, you’ll need to sacrifice an Upgrade from your Car.

Cars are moving on the Track built from cards and face different combinations of challenges from Checkpoints on the cards.

Theme Decks available are: Beach Blitz, Canyon Rush and Downtown Dash.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Racing, Video Game Theme

name: Adam Games Football
description:
Adam Games Football is a statistical replay game. The charts that are included create by dice roll a replay of past seasons. The game is simple to play. You call a running play or passing play and then roll the dice. There are charts for individual teams and on those charts are listings of who throws the pass or makes the run and then influenced by the defensive rating of the opposition another roll determines how large the gain is on a run or whether or not the pass is complete. There are the possibilities for fumbles and penalties and sacks.

The publisher used to have many years of pro and college teams available, but the website is now defunct.

name: The Decades
description:
When was the first iPhone released? In what year was Nirvana's album Nevermind released? The Decades is a wonderful party game that takes you on a journey through time.

Make two teams try to guess the exact year a movie premiered or a song was released, something happened in the world that had a big impact, and more. Make smart use of the time extension tokens and action cards and score with your team most points.

The team with the most points at the end of the game, wins.

Are you ready to put your memory to the test?

—description from the publisher

name: CastellaÂ³
description:
In turn, players each place a wall of their colour, building up a grid. When a square in the grid has three or four walls of the same colour a castle of that colour is placed within the square. When players run out of walls, they are allowed to reposition one of their previously played walls. The first player to play all five of his castles wins.

This is a three player variant of the previously released game Castella, by the same designer and publisher.

Re-implements:

Castella

name: "Express" Card Game
description:
A card game in which the players have to "make up a train by collecting the necessary five cards which match his station," (quoted from the rule book). The train cards are played to the table in lines. The object is to move your station along a line of trains to the end of the train, simulating the train moving into the station (or leaving the station). Various event cards can be played, some of which allow your station to move forward 1 or more 'spaces' (train cards), or send other player’s stations backwards. Wild cards that can match any train or station type also exist.

This game first appeared in 1947. There are at least 2 editions of the game, one of which included "fold out stations"; one edition came in a blue and white box, the other in a red and white box. The Pepys second edition was published in 1955. The first edition included station cards that were folded within the box. The second edition only had stations the size of normal cards and the train liveries were updated.

Real trains are featured, from the LNER, GWR, SR, and LMS lines (London and North Eastern Railway, Great Western Railway, Southern Railway, London, Midland and Scottish Railway).

name: Kargo
description: Kargo or Card Golf is a game of golf played with cards. No knowledge of golf is necessary in order to play. A pack of 53 playing cards and an instruction booklet are included. Play of the cards determines what happens to you out on the course.
publishers: Gamecard Limited, Gaymes Ltd., KUM-BAK Sports, Toys, & Games, MFG Co. Ltd, Pepys (Castell Brothers)

name: Tank Attack! Board Game
description:
A light "Wargame" played on a board made by hexagonal tiles randomly placed on the table.

The hexagons represent different kind of terrains (plains, hill and forest) and player try to conquer them in order to attack the enemy's HeadQuarter.

Players army is composed by small plastic tanks, a trademarked gaming piece by Editrice Giochi.

Combat is resolved rolling special dice.

From the box:

Tank Attack! is a strategy and conquest game. Each player has an army made of "Carrarmatini-EG" (tiny tanks), with which he will try to conquer the General Headquarters of the other players, eliminating them. The scope of the game is indeed to be the last player left in the game. Tank Attack! is played on a battlefield made of hexagons that represent the various land types which are placed on the table, always in different manner. The battlefield will be different at each game and therefore you must learn to adapt your strategy to the different game situation, exploiting at best the characteristics of the land on which the battle will take place.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Monopoly: Astronomy
description: Another Monopoly variant. Utilities are replaced by observatories, railroads by telescope manufacturers and properties by celestial bodies. The pewter pieces are: radio telescope, telescope in dome, Hubble Space Telescope, Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope, binoculars and lawn chair.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Homestretch
description: Homestretch, the wild, wacky, horse race game where four steeds, cabbage, banana, girdle and beetle bohm, stand on springs. The race begins with a spin and they're off. Each player moves one of his horse's legs by the direction of the spinner. The object is to move your horse down the track and split away from the bunch. Each player must move his horse over a fence and hedgerow. As you move your horse into the stretch and down to the finish line, try to avoid getting all tangled up, or your horse may be left trailing the pack. The first player to have two of his horses feet across the finish line wins.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tuba-Ruba
description: Connect the tubes, wrap them about, pop in the marble, Wow look out. Now you're bending, up and down forward, backward, all around. Try to get the marble from the starting point to the ending container in the quickest time. Play alone or with a partner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Marvin's Magic Game
description:
The object is to gain a set of costume props for your playing piece by predicting the outcome of five different, simple-but-clever magic tricks, using numbers on the cards to move around the board.

Tricks are Magic Wonder Wand, Find-the-Lady Card Trick, Rabbit (or carrot) out of the Hat, Peek-a-boo Bow Tie and The Great Cape Escape.

Each successful prediction gives the player an accessory: Hat, Cape, Wand, Fan of Cards or Bow Tie.

Cute and entertaining game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dominaedro
description:
Dominaedro is a abstract game played with 9 d12 dice, pieces of dominoes and some counters.

Players roll the d12 dice to create a 3x3 grid. Then they pick 3 dominoes pieces, and on their turn they put one piece between the dice, following placement rules. Players try to make the best combinations to get the most points.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points is the winner.

name: Love 2 Hate: A Party Game for Inappropriate People
description:
From the publisher:

Love 2 Hate is the card game of finishing sentences (and laughing at the result!). The rules couldn't be simpler.

There are two types of cards, sentence starters and finishers. At the start of the game everyone draws a hand of 5 finishers. Players then take it in turns to act as the judge. A judge draws the top starter card. Example starters include Cosplayers, Moist Towelettes, Crabs, and Mimes.

Then the judge has a decision to make: love or hate?! Let’s say the judge draws the Hippies card. That can be played one of two ways:

I love the way hippies…

Or

I hate the way hippies…

The remaining players now look through their finisher cards and chose one to play, face down. The judge reads these aloud and then chooses the best one. What does best mean? That’s up to the judge, so know your fellow gamers! It might be the funniest, craziest, or most outrageous, depending on the judge, so choose wisely!

The winner keeps the card and play continues until one player gets 5 cards.

name: Kerak
description:
From the publisher:

Kerak is a two-player, abstract strategy board game. Players take turns moving their pieces across the 62 space hexagonal board, with the goal of capturing their opponent’s castle.

Each player controls 18 pieces: 9 infantry, 3 archers, 2 cavalry, 2 knights, 1 hero, and 1 castle. Pieces are distinguished by their movement and strength values. Pieces also support each other, meaning that attacking and defending pieces are “strengthened” by those around them.

Therefore, Kerak plays in two strategic dimensions: that of individual pieces, and larger strategic groupings.

Also, since players set up their pieces one at a time, in any order or configuration, no two games of Kerak start the same. Every game starts and ends uniquely.

name: ãã«ã¼ã¬ (Beluga)
description:
In ãã«ã¼ã¬ (Beluga), you play as a mother beluga whale whose echo location system isn't working properly, which is a problem as your daughter is lost and you want to reunite with her.

The game is divided into two halves: "Journey" and "Reunion". In "Journey", players collect ice cards that contain clues to the daughter's location while trying not to be found by their natural enemy, the polar bear. The closer you get to a polar bear, the most cards you have and the more of your daughter's clues are available, but should you accidentally find the polar bear, you will be eaten.

In "Reunion", you try to find your daughter by revealing the ice cards that you collected in the first half of the game. Once again, you must avoid polar bears. Thankfully you can reference magpies in the sky that know the location of these bears, while also reaching out to "old sharks" to find shortcuts to your daughter's location.

Can mom find her courage and reunite with her daughter?

name: Of Mice and Lemmings
description:
A desperate tale of rodents and river crossings, Of Mice and Lemmings sees between five and eight players attempt to cross a thunderous stretch of water in order to reach the safe haven of a brand new cheese factory on the other bank. However, while the mice will be looking to fill their stomachs with all that high-quality dairy product, the lemmings have another idea: Scupper the bridges that are being built and plunge into the torrent below! Combining elements of both teamwork and individual play, you'll be looking to choose the right time to reveal your true nature while screwing over your opposite numbers.

In the game, players add cards to the central pool, numbered from 0 to 10. Depending on how many people are playing, a certain target number must be reached; 35, for example, with eight players. Each round, one player MUST reveal whether she is a mouse or lemming, then rely on her fellow rodents to get them all across the bridge — or not, as the case may be! Reveal too early and you could be putting too much faith in the other players; reveal too late and there's a good chance you may not be successful!

Of Mice and Lemmings is a quirky update on the trick-taking genre and adds hidden identities, a healthy amount of bluffing, and rodents with one-track minds.
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Math
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Bzz Out
description: Bzz Out is an entertaining card game that teaches about numbers and counting as well as elementary strategy. Through the game play, children learn about the relationships between numbers and practice their counting skills by deciding which number is higher. Players also learn some basic probability and strategic thinking skills as they decide whether to keep or swap their cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Number

name: Flying Cheese
description:
Thankfully Flying Cheese does not challenge players to shoot cheese into one another's mouths – but you will be launching "cheese" skyward to try to land it in your mouse home.

Each round starts with players laying their home tiles (4, 6 or 8 depending on the number of players) and 1-2 cat tiles one by one in the 25 slots in the game tray. The center is reserved for a 2-4 point tile, depending on the round.

Once everyone has placed their home and cat tiles, players take turns launching the cheese dice into the tray using their spoon-shaped catapults. Players have two chances to try to land a cheese die in the tray. If they land on a home tile, the owner of that tile earns one point immediately. Landing on a cat costs the player one point, while hitting the center tile earns 2-4 points. Land off the board or in an empty slot, and you get nothing.

After all twelve cheese dice have been launched, tally the face-up dots on each player's home tiles; each die has three blank faces and 1-2 dots on the other faces. The player with the largest total earns two additional points.

Flying Cheese lasts three rounds, and the player with the most points after three rounds wins.

name: Fly Home!
description:
Night falls, and the birds are still a long way from their nests! Young bird watchers join forces to help them find their natural habitats in good time because soon the owls will wake up!

Fly Home! is a co-operative game that combines observation and memory with a dose of chance. Turn the cards over and look for the common characteristics of the birds: networked legs or claws, white or orange plumage, migrating or sedentary — everyone has something in common with their neighbors! Can you remember the exact location of the birds? Or are you taking risks by looking for other birds? Binoculars can help, but be careful as the owls are ready to go...

name: I've Created a Monster
description:
"I've created a monster!"

The objective of this game is to be the first one to complete a "Monster man" with all his body parts (head, arms, torso and legs). The mechanic it's a simple "retrieve a card from the deck, discard the one you don't need" (although there are several specific cards wich triggers special events) until you complete your monster. To achieve this, the player can use different parts, as long as the creature is complete.

From the box: A "ghostly" card game. Play the mad scientist and be the first player to build a whole monster (2 arms, 2 legs, body and head) to win. Add an arm, take a leg! A fun and simple card game with no reading required. Features colorful monster drawings.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement
publishers: AMIGO, Falomir Juegos, Fundex, Gibsons, International Games

name: Story Makers
description:
In Story Makers, you can create over 100 million different stories. The basic version is cooperative and the party variant in the basic game can be played with up to ten people.

The Story Maker creates a game by using words of their choice from the story cards. The other players have to guess first how they think the story goes and if it will end happily or dramatically. Any story may be created! This makes it tougher for the players. Luckily, they may ask for one hint (per round) and they can use their deduction skills.

This game is for families with children aged 8 years and up or for adults, especially the party version with team play challenges them to think out of the box. Also includes a variety of difficulty levels.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Storytelling, Team-Based Game
publishers: SD Games, The Game Master BV

name: Amundsen: KapplÃ¸pet til Sydpolen
description:
A fast to play and easy to teach dice game with a push-your-luck mechanism. Players are racing to be the first to reach the South Pole. The dice are rolled up to three times, while you try to form one of the combinations directly ahead of you on the game board. You can continue moving as long as you dare before setting camp, but if you fail, you must return to your previous camp. Choose your path carefully, and perhaps visit one of your depots to get some additional resources.

Components are language independent.

Reimplemented by:

Roll to the South Pole (According to the designer, the games share theme and graphics, but differ in game play, with Amundsen being a light game and Roll to the South Pole being a more strategic affair.)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: iCubo
description:
The objective of iCubo is to solve puzzles in the shape of cubes in the minor leasttime. The game includes an hourglass, cards of different values with which to pay for time and to see of one and in order of numeration 7 tracks that will help you to arm the iCubo; and the most incredible thing: 10 iCubos that generate 5 iCubos multicolored too, shaping a real game of revolutionary ingenuity in construction 3D. The game begins the hourglass is turned, which gives 5 minutes to solve the iCubo. From there, everything depends on you and the strategy that you use.

El Objetivo del Juego es armar rompecabezas en forma de cubos en el menor tiempo posible, donde podrán jugar hasta 4 jugadores. El juego cuenta con un reloj de arena, fichas de diferentes valores con las cuales pagar por tiempo y para ver de a una y en orden de numeración las 7 pistas que te ayudarán a armar el iCubo; y lo más increíble: 10 iCubos que generan a su vez 5 iCubos multicolor, conformando un verdadero juego de ingenio revolucionario en construcción 3D. El juego comienza cuando damos vuelta el reloj, contando con 5 minutos para armar el iCubo. A partir de allí, todo depende de vos y la estrategia que utilices para desplegar toda su capacidad.

name: BOURPIF
description:
At the bottom of the vast lands of Mornifle, is a legendary place... The dungeon of BOURPIF!
You are valiant adventurers in search of fame who will cross the dungeon of Bourpif.
Your goal? Get out with the most fame points, i.e. the most cards.
Test your observation skills, dexterity and speed to become a renowned adventurer!
If you don't have any of his skills then ruuuuuuun!
—description from the publisher (translated)

Au fin fond des vastes terres de la Mornifle, se trouve un lieu aussi malfamé que légendaire... Le Donjon de Bourpif !
Mettez à l'épreuve votre sens de l'observation, votre dextérité et votre rapidité pour devenir un aventurier de renommée !
Si vous n'avez aucune de ses compétences alors fuyyyyyeeeezzz !

—description from the publisher
publishers: Muduko, PaÃ¯lle Editions, Trefl Joker Line

name: Cows and Leopards
description:
Cows and Leopards is a traditional game from Sri Lanka and India for 2 players, where one plays with 2 leopards and another with 24 cows. Beginning with all tiles outside the board, the players take turns first placing the tiles inside and later moving them from one intersection to another. Every player has a different objective. The one with the leopards must capture all the cows jumping over them while the one with the cows attempts to immobilize the leopards.

This is one variant from a family of similar Asian games played with varying numbers of tigers/leopards/goats/cows/etc and varying board topologies. See also Bagh Chal.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers
publishers: (Public Domain), ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore), Guild Publishing, HABA, Hausser, Historische Spiele Zander, Missio, Oak Games, Steidl Verlag

name: Slimetrail
description:
Slimetrail is a two-player, abstract game played on a rectangular grid (or a rhombus made of hexagons, as in Hex). Each player takes turns moving a piece around the board. The piece can be moved one space, and may not re-visit a visited cell. Two goal cells are located at diagonally opposite corners of the rectangle (or in the obtuse corners of the rhombus). You win if either player moves the piece into your goal cell.

The rules at Game Cabinet state that "the piece starts on any mutually agreed upon square". But since this is a finite game, with enough computing power it can be determined which player has the winning strategy depending on the initial placement, so in principle no cell would be mutually agreeable. In practice, the Pie Rule can be used.

name: Carry On: Drafting Card Game
description:
Carry On is a drafting game where players pick a card to pack and passes the rest on. The heavier items you pack the more points you accumulate, but be sure to stay within your luggage limit or pay an excess baggage fee.

A game of Carry On consists of 3 rounds and the player who collects the most points win. Players assume the roles of different characters and can accumulate bonus points by collecting specific cards. There are 4 different types of Basic Item cards that players can choose from: Clothing; Document; Gadget; and Hygiene cards. Collect one of each Basic Item cards and receive extra points. You can also collect souvenir cards along the way, upgrade your luggage limit, or simply pack some carry on.

Watch out! there’s a catch. Players do not know how much they can pack until it’s too late.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Math, Number

name: Escape from Dead Town
description:
The Outbreak is quickly spreading, one bite at a time, and your group of survivors need to make it to the evacuation pick-up point before you’re all turned into drooling, mindless zombies! Will you manage to escape before the town becomes completely overrun by the undead?

Hour 42 of the Outbreak: Supplies are dwindling, morale is low and the streets are now filled with the moaning, shuffling, flesh-hungry undead! Your only shot at escaping the Outbreak in one piece is to get to the military pick-up point and hitch a ride to the safe it's a no-brainer!

Gather your friends and get ready to test your braaains with this zombie escape room game! With 12 different extraction points to choose from, every player must solve each of the four puzzles individually gain clues to the right exit location. Will you be able to crack the puzzles and find your way to the safe zone, or will fall victim to the Outbreak?

—description from the publisher

name: Everybody Knows
description:
QUICK! What’s the capital of California? Who played Forrest Gump? What’s 5 X 16? What animal is the “King of the Jungle”? What letter comes before “J”? What new game is all about answering questions EVERYBODY KNOWS the answers to in 60 seconds or less? Sure, the questions may seem easy, but try going 10 for 10 in 60 seconds! It’s the game of questions Everybody Knows… but can you answer UNDER PRESSURE?

—description from the publisher

name: SkyCapers
description:
One of the original five games produced by Winning Moves.

From the box:
SkyCapers is a stacking game which features 48 handsome wooden blocks cut into several different shapes. Matching pairs of blocks fit together allowing players to build many unique towers. As each tower grows taller, it may become unstable. Your very next move might cause one to collapse. But to score, you have to risk performing "Capers" -- the transferring of a whole stack of blocks from one tower to another. If you play your blocks right, you'll outscore your opponents and win the game!

name: Macadam
description:
From the designer's website (edited):

Macadam was born on the street and now spreads out on the web. It's an easy strategy board game. To play, you just need a chalk and a few stones. Each game takes place in 15 minutes or less.

This game resembles football or basketball: you simply need to bring your pawns to your opponent's side and 'score' a goal.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Almansa 1707
description:
Simulates the battle on 25 April 1707 between Franco-Spanish troops under the Duke of Berwick and an Anglo-Dutch-Portuguese force in the War of the Spanish Succession (1700-14).

Includes 200 counters which need mounting, a 58x42cm map and a Player Aid Chart. There are 8 pages of low-complexity rules, simulating basic chains of command, facing, fire and shock combat.

name: Monopoly: United States Marines
description:
From the website:

USMC Monopoly® Game an Exciting Salute to Bravery, Commitment, and Patriotism! 6 Unique Collectible Pewter Tokens! - This has to be one of the most original ways you and your family can salute the United States Marine Corps - a super-exciting USMC Monopoly® game! Be the first to fight as you buy, sell and trade the most prized assets of the U.S. Marines. It's your chance to control and command the branch of the armed forces that has never - in its entire history - retreated in war!
Brought to you by USAopoly, this exciting Monopoly board game has players vying to own the battle ready AV-8B Harrier II, CH-46E Sea Knight Helicopter, EA-6B Prowler and much more! And each player gets to choose from 6 unique collectible pewter tokens: Assault Amphibian Vehicle, HMMWV, AV-8B Harrier II, Helmet, Boots, or the USMC Initials. Get in the action, and order now!
MONOPOLY® ™ & ©2005 Hasbro.

This USMC Monopoly® game from USAopoly features:
From the Monopoly American Classics series! An exciting and innovative version of the classic Monopoly game, designed to honor the United States Marine Corps
Comes with 6 collectible pewter tokens: Assault Amphibian Vehicle, HMMWV, AV-8B Harrier II, Helmet, Boots, and USMC Initials
Board, playing and packaging showcase dynamic artwork and graphics of Marines on parade and in action
For 2 - 6 players, ages 8 and up
Box measures 20" W x 1.25" H x 10" D
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Cranium Doodle Tales
description:
FRom the publisher:

Get your pencils ready for a game of creative fill-in-the-picture fun. Combine silly sketches with imaginative captions to get everyone laughing like crazy!

Draw the missing parts of funny photos, then swap to create wacky captions for each other's creations. Everyone takes turns being the judge, awarding points to the players with the silliest drawings and most creative captions.

After the game, you can even showcase your one-of-a-kind masterpieces with an outrageously cool magnet that comes with the game!

name: Pack the Pack
description:
Pack the Pack is a fast paced tile laying, gem matching inventory management game for players of all ages. As adventurers who have just slain the dragon and survived the dungeon you must stuff your sack full of treasure and make it back to town to trade it all in for filthy lucre.

Players draw tiles from the loot horde in the center of play and arrange them in their backpacks. Race to align gem portions and fill your pack with treasure before announcing your return to town. Quick looters can demand a higher price for their booty but careful treasure hunters can use the precious extra seconds to maximize the value of their haul. After the dust has settled and the assets liquidated the adventurer with the most money wins.

Pack the Pack combines set collection, pattern building and dexterity play for 3-6 gamers ages 8 and up.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Line Links
description:
This great game was created by renowned German games Inventor Reiner Knizia.

To play Line Links, simply make as many links as possible by placing tiles next to any side to make multiple links with existing tiles.

Players take turns to play a tile and make links. As the pattern expands, more lines can be linked.

The winner is the player linking the most lines.

name: Sequence Dogs
description:
From the publisher:

Enjoy the great game of Sequence featuring a unique collection of cuddly canines. Be the first player to get 5 chips in a row by matching the pooch pictured on your cards to the same ones on the game board. Each card also has a brief description or fact about the dog shown. So go 'fetch' your family and friends for a fun strategic game of Sequence Dogs.

As in traditional Sequence, the object of the game is for one player or team to form a line of five or more consecutive chips, either orthogonally or diagonally. Players take turns drawing and playing cards, using a card from hand to claim one space on the board matching the played card. 2 or 3 players can play; higher player counts are supported via team play.

name: Stinky
description:
User summary
ã¹ãã£ã³ã­ã¼ (Sutinki) (Stinky) is a dexterity game. You throw dice from a certain distance toward Stinky. If some dice, whose total pips are six or more, are on the Stinky cards, this trial is successful. You score one victory point if a certain number of trials are successful.

Before throwing dice, players play items to make the trial easier, such as additional dice, shortening the distance, and enlarging target. First, the active player declares what item is needed. Then any player including the active player plays the exact card if they have. That player becomes active player and declare another item or make a trial in the manner described above.

The first player who has scored a certain victory points total wins the game.

Publisher's summary
