Letter Go

name: Trivial Pursuit: TV
description:
This TRIVIAL PURSUIT Special Pack contains color-coded question-and-answer cards that you can use with any TRIVIAL PURSUIT Master Game ato add a variety of different subject areas. Or use the deck as an on-the-go pocket game -- it's perfect for travel fun!

A small pocket pack of 120 cards.

The questions in this deck are not divided into specific sub-categories.

Note: this is not Trivial Pursuit: Pocket Player Set â Boob Tube
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Asterix: The Board Game
description: Who can find the most valuable trophies under the menhirs.

name: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: Wild Card
description: This Mini or Pocket Pack was made for use with the Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Set Game but also featured color coded questions for use with the regular Trivial Pursuit games. This set contains 120 questions in miscellaneous categories.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Par Fore The Course
description:
This game is an indoor game designed and developed by golf professionals to simulate the thrills and excitement of actual outdoor competition. The object of the game is to run up your opponent’s score, while completing your own round in as few strokes as possible.

Par Fore the Course is an indoor game designed and developed by golf professionals to simulate the thrills and excitement of actual outdoor competition. As much as possible, Par Fore the Course is played the way real golf is played. But there’s added excitement, because Par Fore the Course goes beyond the gentlemanly rules of the Royal and Ancient Game. In this competition, if you play a shot that lands you in trouble, your opponent does not stand back politely while you escape from your predicament. No! He gleefully drops you into a lot deeper trouble! And you do the same to him!

To start, cut the cards and the low card becomes the dealer and also plays first, play then follows clockwise. Once all first shots have been played, the player furthest from the hole plays. When two players are the same distance, the player arriving first plays. Once on the green, continue to putt until in the hole. Winner of each hole plays first on the next hole. In case of a tie, the player who played first on previous hole plays first for the next tee.

Begin each hole by drawing up to 5 cards to your hand. To begin par 3’s roll 2 dice and to begin par 4’s and 5’s roll 3 dice. The roll of the dice determines your ball's landing point and do the following based on the par of the hole and where it landed:


If on the fairway - play a card trying to match the suit of the position you landed. Whether it matches or not will determine what happens next (water, sand trap, out of control, make it to the green, etc)
If in a sand trap — roll 2 dice (and/or play a card). The number rolled is the distance you are from the hole, unless doubles are rolled. In that case, the result will depend on whether you have a matching numbered card in your hand.
If in the water — count one penalty stroke. Then, move your ball to a drop area on the board represented by a circled D. Any numbered card can be played to the green. The number on the card represents the distance from the hole.
If off the fairway — You are out of bounds and count a 2 stroke penalty and roll dice again.
If on the green — you can putt. The number of the card played to make it to the green determines the distance to the hole. Roll dice to see if you putt into the hole.
If the number cannot be found - You have a lost ball. Count 2 penalty strokes and roll dice again. (Note: A number is missing on each hole. The missing numbers are: Hole #1—9, #2—12, #3—5, #4—10, #5—12, #6—12, #7—15, #8—13, #9—9)


OUT OF CONTROL:

Your ball is considered OUT OF CONTROL if you don't have a matching suit card for your numbered location OR number is off the fairway, but not in the water, a sand trap, or out of bounds. In this case, the player to your left plays a card and it determines what happens to your ball.


HOLE IN ONE:

When a player rolls two 1’s and holds the Ace of the suit shown in the middle of the green, they score a HOLE IN ONE!


SCORING: Each time a player rolls the dice from the tee or on the green, count 1 point. Each time a card is played either by the player or his opponent, count 1. At the end of each hole add penalty shots incurred to your score. Lowest total after 9 holes wins. (Use far right of score pads to count each stroke.)

name: Kiki & Bun-Bun
description:
A checkers variant inspired by characters from the web comic, Sluggy Freelance. One player takes the role of Kiki the free spirited ferret, and the other the role of Bun-Bun, the homicidal mini-lop (that's small bunny in English :). While the Kiki players moves and captures in the traditional checkers way, the Bun-Bun player cannot jump over any pieces, and instead capture Kiki's pieces by moving onto the same square.

Additional rules/variants are also available for other Sluggy Freelance characters such as Torg, Riff and Gwynn, but the original game was written around Kiki and Bun-Bun.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Comic Book / Strip, Print & Play

name: Gladiolus: the Game of Gladiatorial Combat in the Roman Arena
description: A simulation of single combat between gladiators in ancient Rome, based on a system of drawing and playing from a pack of combat cards. Each gladiator (represented by miniatures or counters on a combat map) has a set of cards giving options suitable to his style of fighting. The players maintain a hand of combat cards from which to choose their actions. The game is played in alternate moves, and features a hidden "hole" card, chosen by each player at the end of each turn, and revealed at the start of the next turn. Six types of gladiators are represented.
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Trains
description:
Players race to complete a train journey by "travelling" the exact distances shown on their route card.

An example route would be King's Cross to Edinburgh, calling at Peterborough, Grantham, York, and Newcastle. The distances between the stations are shown on the route card. Players must play combinations of distance cards to match the required distance, followed by the appropriate station card, all the way from one end of their route to the other.

name: Krabbel-Trabbel
description:
Your monstrous self has been infected by creepy-crawlies, and you want to rid yourself of them to make yourself calm again, but to make them leave, you need to put in some effort...

In Krabbel-Trabbel, first released as Fleckenmonster, each player starts with up to ten crawler tokens on their monster card, while thirteen action chips are placed face down in a circle. On a turn, the active player reveals one of these action chips, then carries out the order depicted there. Perhaps you need to memorize, then reveal certain actions chips, but often you need to participate in "monster games". You might have a task like making faces, naming ingredients in a soup, or imitating animal sounds, and on your turn you must first imitate in order everything done by the other players, then complete the task in your own way. Complete the task or win the game, and you can remove one of the crawlers on your body. Eliminate all of your crawlers to win!

name: Cubical
description:
Cubical is a fast-paced die rolling racing game with a twist.

The goal of the game is to be the first to move three dice from one side of the board to the opposite overcoming walls and obstacles along the way.

Edition Spielbox No. 62
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Move it!
description:
Move it! is a simple game simulating the transport of containers at the Europe Combined Terminals. You have to move little wooden containers from a boat to one of a maximum of six stacks (rows) and then onto a truck to be transported over land. Players can block each other by stacking containers on top of each other. Decreasing the amount of stacks in play makes the game harder.

The game was commissioned by ECT (European Container Terminal) in Rotterdam, The Netherlands, on the occasion of the completion of the Delta/Sea-Land Terminal.

name: Harvest the Wind
description:
"A microgame of tactical combat in the 19th Century American West."

This man-to-man scale wargame features three historical scenarios, one of which involves a major battle between Plains Indian tribes.

Part of the Microgame Design Contest 2002.
categories: American Indian Wars, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Matchbox Traffic Game
description:
Each player has a Matchbox car which is moved on the board. Players travel between destinations to accumulate mileage. The center of the board features a rotating turntable and rotating traffic signal. The turntable changes "shortcut" paths across the center of the board when it rotates, the traffic signal changes game play.

Ages 8 - 14

The original game included two Matchbox cars; examples of the game that still include the cars and the boxes are highly collectible.

name: Postie Game
description:
The scene, a small town. You are a local Postie, with your daily assortment of mail to deliver hustling from call to call despite the few minor set backs you may stumble across. You prod onward, only to encounter more obstacles. Even these cannot dampen your spirits. But you have one fear, a constant threat to your well being and your ability to complete you deliveries "The Family Dog". Waiting to defend its personal domain. Once the mail has been successfully delivered, you must return to the Post Office before you fellow Posties. But beware of the 'Loose Dog'....

Postie is a game that delivers excitement, suspense, hours of fun, and the mail.

As you enter the world of the Postie; an occupations filled with adverse weather conditions, perils of walking over all kinds of terrain and that age old enemy of the Postie, the dog. Postie is a game of luck and strategy in equal amounts. No attempt had been made as they become familiar with the game. Postie is not difficult to play.

So pick up your mail, sling that mail bag over your shoulder, hit the streets and be careful out there.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spellbound
description: This game is used to teach spelling. As players move around the board they are required to spell selected words to be allowed to continue. Words can be added to the game to make it more difficult if required.

name: OMMS: On Map Military Strategy
description:
OMMS is the board game that everybody already owns.
It uses an everyday map as the board, coins, playing cards and matches for counters and cards. Every game is different, because you can just try out a different map.
The aim is to defeat the other players by battling their units, sieging settlements and fortifications, and expanding your territories faster than they can.

Full rules available via the Web Link section near the bottom of this page
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Warfighter 101: Movement to Contact
description:
Components: Four pages of color rules, four operations orders, two player aids describing the units, one sheet of mounted 7/8" counters (not die cut) and an 11x17" map (double-sided).

Game covers clashes at the National Training Center between a heavy battalion and an OPFOR motor rifle force. Both sides have supporting artillery and helicopter assets attached.

Mechanics are straightforward with both players moving and then firing - damage takes effect after combat. Fire is resolved by rolling a handful of dice, counting the hits and then subtracting the target's armor - units may be stunned, forced to retreat, take losses or be killed outright. The advanced rules add a sort of opportunity fire where a unit may interfere with enemy movement by declaring it as a target (provided the enemy is within a certain distance).

The Operations Orders set up victory conditions and other effects (such as defensive positions) - thus, in a 2 player game, some information will not be shared between players. A blank template for scenario creation is provided and blank forms may be downloaded from the publisher's website.

name: Election
description: Players move across a map of Europe to gain popularity for the upcoming European elections. Points are scored for completing secret goals indicated on different colored cards.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Wargaming Ancient and Medieval Periods
description: Featherstone examines sixteen battles of the ancient and medieval periods. 143 pages. 32 battle maps.
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Stora kojakten
description:
Promotional game for the Swedish dairy Arla designed by an advertising agency. Artwork is done by children's book illustrator/author Sven Nordqvist.

Players pick up cows from the field and deliver them to the barn.
mechanics: Acting, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Presto Pippo!
description:
from the box:

Brief description: We have a lot of fun at the "Da Pippo" restaurant. "Pippo" the hard-working headwaiter rushes around quickly from table to table collecting dishes. Soon the dishes are piled high and the children need a lot of balance to prevent the plates and cups from falling down. Who can load up the headwaiter with the most dishes?

The box also claims that the game is "an amusing game of skill for 2-6 calm hands Ages 4 and up."

There is a nice game board, a pouch, and lovely wooden dish pieces.

Basically, this is a much prettier, themed "Jenga" for children.

name: Afterworld
description:
Panini is proud to announce Afterworld; our newest Trading Card Game.

In the Afterworld, the greatest champions from the civilizations of Atlantis, Viking legend, Ancient Egypt, and Ancient Japan are pitted against each other for dominance. With stunning original artwork and exciting gameplay, Afterworld offers players the best of both worlds, a complete and compelling game experience with the fun of chasing rare cards to enhance the experience.

Will the Atlantean commander be able to stop the Norse Commander from razing the beautiful undersea territories of Atlantis? Will the Japanese Commander be victorious in subjugating the best units from Ancient Egypt? Play Afterworld and find out.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Mythology

name: Trilli-Trilli
description:
It is spring again. All nests contain already eggs. 16 cards are showing which bird should be on every nest. Only one card at a time is revealed. The player who, after having luck with the die rolling and some tactical dexterity, gets the right bird to the right nest, can keep the card.

The game box contains 16 nests, 16 cards, 4 birds and 1 die.

name: BS Chess (Bluffing Style Chess)
description:
Played on a 6X6 square board BS Chess uses similar pieces and movement patterns to chess. however the identity of a piece is only know to it's controller. This allows players make normally illegal moves. Like a knight's leap with a pawn or a pawn's capture with a knight. After each move the opposing player may or may not call BS (short for bluffing style) in that case the moving piece is revealed, and a penalty is given to moving player if they cheated or to the calling player if the move was legal.

One other big change to chess is that the players pieces start in stacks along the back row of the board. This allows for a bit of meta gaming and reduces the number of choices each round even though a standard 16 man chess army is used.
mechanics: Acting, Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Where's My Bone?
description:
From the box:
A game for 2-4 players, aged 5 years and over.
These little dogs have hidden their bones and don't know where they are. Let us join in the search for them. The first one to find his 6 bones is the winner.

name: Nelly Natter
description: The players move their snake in order to surround face-down markers which will indicate what action will then occur - for example an apple which enables the snake to grow. The snakes are made from wooden sections which link together. They are moved by holding one link in place and moving another section so that the snake wriggles to its destination. A turn ends when another piece is touched. The winner is the player to first get his snake to full size - a head plus 12 body sections.

name: Hamertjesspel
description:
Hamertjesspel (Dutch for "The Little Mallet Game") is a traditional pub-game that was popular in the Low Lands of Belgium and the Netherlands and can be traced back as far as 1750. It could be regarded as an early form of Pinball, but despite its erstwhile popularity, it was all but forgotten in the latter half of the 20th century. Recently replica boards are making a bit of a comeback, and "het Hamertjesspel" can be seen again at village fêtes and other occasions that encourage nostalgic throw-back entertainment.

Four players sit on each side of a square wooden board with raised edges, defending their goal. A marble or small lead ball is dropped in the centre, either by hand or, on the more evolved board versions, through a "fair" central dropping device. Players try to get the marble into an opponent's goal, and keep their own one safe, by using a small wooden mallet ("Hamer" is Dutch for "Hammer"). To make life difficult for the players, the goal is split up in two by a centre isle, and spanned by a rail, so that it is impossible to block both halves simultaneously, or swap the hammer between goal sides easily. The board itself has a few obstacles (usually exposed nails) that deflect the marble. Game play is best typified as frantic fun.

The boards tend to have a slight slope towards the centre point. The square versions commonly use 4 wood sections in a pyramid style. The "Karrewiel" (Cart Wheel), which is the round board version usually had more panes to create a nicer circular slope. Occasionally it would also be able to accommodate more than the standard 4 players, or have each player's goal area split in three gaps, rather than two. Most boards would have only one marble in play, but, reportedly, there are variants that had multiple balls simultaneously in the battle arena. If less people were playing, parts of the board could be blocked off using temporary wooden walls.

Traditionally, the first player to lose a certain amount of goals would have to buy the next round. Like all pub games, it was also played for money, and onlookers placed bets on the game's outcome.

In 1995 Battle Dome appeared, which is a modern flipper version of this traditional game, with a few added bells and whistles. In 2000 Felsburger produced the traditional Karrewiel version under the name Chüngel. Needless to say, most versions of the game keep coming from the Low Lands wood crafts cottage industry, that is slowly "rediscovering" this lost gem. And since the dimensions have never been standardised, quality and appearance are as diverse as the woodworkers making them.

name: Kristall
description:
In Crystal 2-6 players try to find some hidden treasures and bring them back to the 2 starting points.

A special die not only lets players move 0-3 fields, it also determines if a treasure is found and if other special features, like the arising of a crystal wall, appear.

A funny aspect are the 4 transparent "glass-witches" which are mainly used to annoy other players. Much luck after all, but nice components anyway.

name: Granat
description:
Granat (=garnet) is played on a 9 x 7.5 grid board and both players have an army of 14 pieces and 2 "Granat"-balls. Each wooden playing piece has a crater-shaped top, which enables to hold one of the metallic granat balls.

Object of the game is to capture all opposing pieces. Normal pieces can move 1 grid, but pieces holding a granat ball can move as far as they want. The granat ball can easily be displaced in your half of the board, but on the opposing half, you can only move it to an adjacent piece.

name: Chicago
description:
This is a race between 2-4 gangsters and up to 23 policemen. The board depicts a town with 170 hex spaces. 60 of them are specially marked and are filled with turned down "houses".

1 player takes the role of the police and the others take the role of the gangsters. The gangsters can enter the houses and take the tiles laying there. Some of them are worth just money, but there are also tiles with several transportation possibilities like cars or planes, which allows faster movement than normal or robbing a bank.

While the game proceeds, the police player will get more and more policemen. He must try to eliminate the gangsters by surrounding them completely. The game ends when all gangsters have left the town.

A little strange the victory conditions: the gangster with the highest amount of prey is the winner. There is no given victory condition for the police player, but it's suggested to play as many games as there are players, so each player has been the police once!

name: Tennis Match
description:
This game comes with 4 special dice in 4 colors. They are rather big (2.4 cm or 1 inch per side).

Each die is different and has positive, negative or neutral results printed on:
- the white Serve-die: 1 positive, 2 negative, 3 neutral
- the green Forehand-die: 1 positive, 1 negative, 4 neutral
- the blue Backhand-die: 2 positive, 2 negative, 2 neutral
- the red Volley-die: 3 positive, 3 negative, 0 neutral

Scoring is done exactly like in professional Tennis. At the beginning and after each point, the "serving" player rolls the white Serve-die. Every following throw is done with one of the other dice - at player's choice.

The neutral results mostly mean, that the ball is played well and that the opponent must return. The exception for this is the Serve-die: a "net" (1x on the die) simply voids the throw, an "out" (2x on the die) is a little dangerous, because it can result in a double-fault.

name: Last Chance
description: It's explosive action in this fast movin' target game. You have only three pellets to shoot...and there are four targets that come, one at a time, rolling down the center ramp. Quick thinking and strategy is just as important as straight shooting...and remember your opponent can also fire at the same target...so plan your shots...let your eye follow the target as it rolls down towards high-scoring territory...take careful aim and CRACK! The target whizzes into a scoring pocket. Be the first player to win three rounds by scoring the most points in each round.

name: The Rainbow Fish Memory Game
description:
The Rainbow Fish Memory Game is based on the traditional game of memory and can be played that way, with players turning over cards, two at a time, trying to find as many matched pairs as possible through luck or by remembering the location of the cards.

The game also includes 12 special Rainbow Fish cards which make possible numerous variations of the traditional game. Some of these are easier to play; some more challenging; all are great fun.

Game includes: 72 cards (30 regular picture pairs and 12 special Rainbow Fish Cards), all are in full color, 20 with holographic foil stamping; instructions and a convenient plastic tray for storage.

name: Block the Clock
description:
Look out...here comes the runaway clock!

Players must arrange the tiles and create a "track" for the oncoming clock before the alarm goes off and it's too late!

The clock has speed levels for players who dare to rev up the frantic fun in this family game of split second action.

A cross between a sliding 15 puzzle and a pipeline game.

name: Cirkle 4
description:
Cirkle 4 is an Abstract strategy game. Four Armies based in the four corners of the board. Players can play on teams or as individuals. The object of the game is to capture an objective square or destroy an Army or a set of pieces. Players needs to write on a paper their secret winning target/ objective at the start of the play. Cirkle 4 is based on Cirkle 2 system/combat (see Cirkle 2) adapted to a 3 or 4 players situation.

Home Page: http://www.1-2-3-games.com/en/cirkle-games/cirkle-4

name: Gibberish
description:
Listen to clues to guess who, what, when, where, how and why. Your team only has 1 minute to guess them all! To make it even more challenging, you must remember the words you guessed so you can write a funny Gibberish story. The better your team, the more points you earn.

The hilariously competitive guessing / memory / storytelling / beat the clock game is fun for the whole family. There are rules for a 2 or 3 player game, too, so you don't need a crowd to have a Gibberish good time!
categories: Humor, Memory, Party Game, Word Game

name: Super Stick Super Jock Hockey
description: Similar to other Super Jock games, the player pounds the jocks head to propel the puck. The other player is the goalie, which is a plastic piece with a handle, and tried to prevent the jock from scoring. The players take turns trying to score and the winner is the one that scores the most.

name: Devine ce que je mime?
description:
A game where a player spins the arrow and picks a card of the indicated category. He must then mime what is shown on the card and the other players have to guess. The first one to guess right gets the card. The player with the most card wins. Can be played in teams. From 5 years old.

There are four categories :
- Qui suis-je ? (Who am I?)
- Que fais-je ? (What am I doing?)
- Quel animal suis-je ? (What animal am I?)
- Qu'est-ce que c'est ? (What is it?)

name: Operation Survival
description:
Operation Survival is a strategy game for budding adventurers as well as experienced explorers. And no matter what happens, you'll be sitting on the edge of your seat, laughing your head off!

Game Objective:

Your plane crashed in a remote land, and now you have to survive in this hostile territory. You and the other survivors from the wreck face extremely harsh conditions, but only one of you will come out of this alive... It's the survival of the fittest! Your best allies - courage, toughness and the ability to hit the ground running - will get you through the trials and tribulations Nature has in store...and help you outsmart your unlucky companions!

Contents:
- 25 cardboard tiles which make up the game board
- 120 "Survival" question cards (a total of 360 detailed questions)
- 27 "Challenge" cards
- 3 "Object" cards
- 5 "Adventurer" pawns
- 1 "Creature" reference sheet
- Game rules.
mechanics: Modular Board, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Crazy-Cups
description:
The aim of Crazy Cups is to stack the Crazy Cups in stacks of varying heights and then take the stacks back down such that the cups are stacked neatly back into each other.

It is essentially a game of dexterity and you are aiming to beat either your best time to do a particular routine or the time that was set by the other people playing it with you.

Similar to:

Kup Stax
publishers: Speed Stacks, Inc., Twin-Act Connection Pte Ltd

name: Joe Quadri's Action Tennis
description:
Learn to play the percentages – quite literally – with this tennis board game.

Players simulate a real match by spinning the wheel, picking a card and learning their fate. Just like real life, there’s also some rolling of the dice involved. It’s not all luck, however – winning consistently requires mastering the strategies behind the game.

name: Lari Safari
description:
A fun childrens game that trains both the memory and their portraying skills. Cards are face down, acting as a memory, when your turn, you have to portray the animals gesture drawn on the card(s). The drawings are very cute, and so are the kids acting them out..

Very simple game setup, lots of fun for smaller kids. or....

Also loads of fun on a late night with family or friends that had just a little to much to drink !

name: Gwyddbwyll
description:
Some scholars say that the Welsh name Gwyddbwyll originally meant the same tafl game played in Ireland under the name Fitchneal. Like the latter, the Welsh name has confusingly come to mean Chess in modern Welsh. Most other scholars however disagree that this is the same as the Irish game which was played on a 7×7 grid.

Two opinions exist among those who maintain that the name Gwyddbwyll refers to a purely Welsh game. The Wikipedia Gwyddbwyll page describes chess at the top of the page, and this game below, referring to it as Gwyddbwyll Geltaidd to avoid confusion. It notes however that the game is properly called merely Gwyddbwyll, the longer name meaning merely "Celtic Gwyddbwyll". This website also shows the initial set-up and gives a brief but incomplete description of the game in Welsh. The game according to this opinion is played on 9×9 grid and the object for the defending player is to get the king to a corner. Rules are otherwise presumably like Brandubh.

The alternative opinion that the game was played on a 7×7 grid is described at Celtnet. The initial set-up described there may be slightly speculative, but again it is believed that the other rules not described there were identical to Brandubh.

name: Down Under: The Australian Pub Game
description:
Players add marbles two at a time into any of five chutes in a wooden tower. Once all of each players twenty marbles are distributed, blindly (the tower is a solid block of wood), the tower is slowly slid along a grooved path that distributes the marbles in the order they were placed into an even grid of depressions. Each player scores for marbles that appear in a row of four, either diagonally or orthogonally, and any line of five counts as two four-in-a-rows.

It's a quick game of memory and patterns, and it engages blocking and building strategies.

name: Kostky
description: This is a Travel Line (pocket} edition game named Kostky published by Dino Toys in the Czech Republic. It contains six plastic dice, a dice cup, a scoring pad and a booklet of Czech and Slovak rules. Apparently it is a set of rules to play a variety of dice games.

name: Volopoly
description:
For the manufacturer:

GO VOLS!
Buy, sell and trade the University of Tennessee! Neyland Stadium, Andy Holt Tower, The Hill and Smokey are available at bargain basement prices! For a mere $110 you could become the newest member of the Pride of the Southland Marching Band! If things don’t go your way – you may be sent home on Academic Probation! VOLOPOLY is designed for alumni, students and fans of UT!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Gary Lineker's Footballer of the Year
description:
A game based around Gary Lineker, a celebrated footballer from Leicester, England, and his rise through the footballing ranks to become the superstar of football that he did. (Note; he is still famous as a presenter of football on TV)
The object of the game is to play the football matches to the best of your ability and try to attain as much money and as many football awards as possible. The game starts with each player being a fourth division footballer with just £500 in savings and no status.

Game Contents:
1 Playing board
1 Footballer marker
40 playing tokens
4 match score dice (red, yellow, 2 x green)
1 skill dice (white)
1 win or lose dice (black)
5 cup dice
1 pack incident cards
1 points score pad
cheques
1 set rules

name: Matrix
description: In this solitaire cyberspace Piecepack game you move your icebreakers across the ice in search of the four Data Forts. Once located, you have to infiltrate the Forts with the corresponding color icebreaker. Just make sure you don't use all your strength before you have succeeded doing this, or you'll die from brain damage!!!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Small Commercial Real Estate Lending Game
description: The object of the game is to become the wealthiest mortgage broker through commissions earned by closing loans on the properties shown on the game board. This game was created by Interbay Funding to expand the knowledge of mortgage brokers and others who originate loans for small businesses.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Balancing Board Game
description: A simple dexterity game - the play area consists of a disc suspended from a pole. Players take turns to roll the colour dice and choose which type of weight to add to the disc. Larger weights score more points. The game continues until the disc tips over.

name: Adventurer: Card Game â Portals Expansion
description:
From the publisher's website:

"The Portals Expansion adds a ton of new features that all the fans have been asking for in regards to player interaction. With Portals players can now trade, do battle, and even hire thieves to steal from one another.

Portals also introduces Mystical Forces to the game, magical energies that can be a boon or a bane to all players.

- Trade and do battle with your opponents
- Hire thieves to pilfer treasure
- Take advantage of magical random effect cards
- Escape deadly new traps
- Acquire powerful treasures -- the Scroll of Life Stealing and the Divine Statue await!
- Portals also includes 1 new hero -- designed by a player like you!"
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval

name: Zakazana Planeta
description:
Description from box back. Translated from polish:

Players take a role of rescue team member, who have to find a spaceship wrecked group on inhospitable planet. Players in their turn build a planet from tiles and then move their pawns. Points could be gain for reach rescue pods and optimal tile placement.

name: East High Forever Game
description:
Game based on the Disney's High School Musical 3, the Senior Year.

From the box:
"Join the East High Gang as they step up to their greatest challenge - the future! Senior year is full of fun when you meet Troy in the Gym to prepare for college tryouts, or share notes for final exams with Gabriella. Will Mrs. Darbus cast you in this year's musical, or will you dance with your crush on prom night? It's your choice and your future - so give the best performance you can! Go Wildcats!"

Game includes :
-6 pawns (based on characters from the show)
-6 different colored stands for the pawns
-6 decks of character cards (30 cards each)
-1 Event Card Deck (32 cards)
-156 graduation cap tokens
-1 gameboard representing the high school
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Elixir of Life
description:
From the Publisher:

Can you be the first to move up through the levels of transformation and release the Elixir of Life?
Will you be a true alchemist on your journey or will you bluff your way through? Will you be able to stop the false alchemists?

In this game you can test not only your tactical skills but your ability to bluff and double bluff by playing your cards right

name: Kecke Schnecke
description: Goal of the game is to give snails a home. This is done by playing cards out of your hand faster than the others.

name: Filou
description: This is a memory game in which players move around a board which contains twelve face down chips (four sets of three each). Each time a meeple steps onto a square, the player shows the other side and places it onto the square he or she came from. The memory layout thus changes constantly. If a player knows the location of a complete set, he or she calls it (and gets the set if he or she is correct). New chips are placed and a new turn starts. Whoever collects 15 chips first, wins.

name: Monopoly: Rennes
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Rennes, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Tours
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Tours, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Haute-Normandie
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Haute-Normandie region, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Spel van het jaar 2002
description:
What happened in the year 2002?

Spel van het jaar 2002 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. The most important, sensational and talked about moments of the year will be questioned in 1100 questions of October 2001 till October 2002.
The first to collect five different colors (corresponding with question categories) chips wins the game.

Contents;
112 question cards
25 year chips
1 color-die

name: The Nasi Lemak Stand
description:
Its recess time at Adam High School. Apparently, some student doesn’t really like the school canteen’s food. So, instead of buying them there, they go outside of school and buy uncle Gram’s delicious nasi lemak (na-see le-mak, Malay delicacy, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nasi_lemak) which is located right outside of the school compound, and it is very popular with uncle Gram special topping (i.e the extra egg, beef and squid). This is where the game comes in. You are to play as uncle Gram and collect as many points as possible before recess time is over, remember the faster you serve your customer, the more point you get. Oh yeah it’s a solo game.

you may go here to download those component of the game -> http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/2009/06/nasi-lema...
while you're there leave a comment ya :D

you may also download the component of the game here :D
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Economic, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rush-Hour
description: Rush Hour With thanks to Stock Classic Card Games. This is a British card game of "unceasing thrills and fascination" by Universal Publications Ltd. The object is to make up sets of six cards to a value of 50. It is based on transport - planes, cars, coaches etc. The box says that it is for Children aged 5 to 50.

name: Donna Leon: GefÃ¤hrliches Spiel Expansion
description:
The first expansion for Donna Leon - Gefährliches Spiel, Released at Essen 2009.

The extension contains 22 new action cards with the logo of the Österreichisches Spiele Museum (boardgame museum). With new actions like "re-throw all dice and choose a character for your turn".

name: Waagemut
description:
The board is a see-saw with five extensions. Each of these has six holes. Players take turns to add weights to the holes without the see-saw hitting the table. The further out the weights are, the more points they count (1-6). Also, other player's pieces can be "caught" by placing another weight on top, thus doubling the score.

The game was originally published by Parker, then re-issued by Schmidt as Waage-Mut in 1982 in a smaller version.

name: The Master of the Merchant in the Sakai
description:
Trade between Japan and China developed at the beginning of the 15th Century under the rule of Yoshimitsu, the 3rd Shogun of the Muromachi Shogunate. This period of trade between the two countries was known as Nichi-Min or Kango trade. Ming China agreed to this trade on condition that Yoshimitsu brought the Japanese pirates called Wako under control. Hence, the Shogunate's trading ships all carried a Kango-fu identifying seal in order to distinguish them from the pirates.

The players are traders in Sakai, a port in Osaka Prefecture. They are trying to earn money from importing goods to Japan from China. So the Kango-fu is very important to the success of their business.

name: Ransom Trump
description:
Ransom Trump is Decktet trick-taking game.

Before start of each hand, the players try to buy the trump suit by choosing one card and putting it face down on the table. Next the cards are revealed and the suit of the highest valued card is a trump for that hand. If several cards tie, then the suit of the second highest card is chosen as a trump. If the tie cannot be broken, the hand is played without a trump suit.

The player who won the trump leads and each player plays a card, matching the suit with the card, that was led. The highest trump wins the trick and if there are no trumps, the highest card that follows the suit wins it. The winner of the trick leads the next trick.

The aim of the game is to collect as many tricks as possible. The single hand takes no more than several minutes and the length of the whole game depends on the game end condition.

The complete rules can be found here.

name: Princezny na plese
description:
Game for little girls. You place pink cardboard hearts in a circle and in the middle you place another six blue hearts to form another, closer circle.
Four princesses take turns and run around on the outer circle, turn the hearts and find things as a lost dress, and so on. They have to find four pieces of clothing before they can go to the ball and find their prince. There are many obstacles in their way (a birdie,...).
When they are dressed, they step into the inner circle and are trying to find their prince (only one of the four is the right one for each princess).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The World Of Cars: Race-O-Rama
description:
From the publisher:

Attention, attention! It is time to start the big race! All cars have taken their standing positions! Is McQueen going to win again? Join the race and see who will be the crazy speed champion this time. Ready, steady, go!

Game play:
Lay the board into the middle. Place the token next to the board. This is the "token bank".
Place the cars on the start line. Youngest player will start.

You win the game when you finish the race first. But to do that you need fuel. Token act as a fuel in this game.
You get fuel on the square with a cup on it. The max number of token collected is different with number of players.
Each token also add 1 to your dice roll. So 6 token add 6 to your dice roll.
After crossing the lightning square you will no longer get the token bonus.
And when two cars land on the same space, then the one who was there first will miss one turn.
Special squares:
Gas station - extra gas. 3 more spaces.
Wheel - snow. Subtract 2 from the next roll.
Flat tyre - miss two turns.
Gear box - stay put until roll at least 4.
Speedometer - 4 extra spaces.

The winner is the one who crosses the finis line first.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bloody Crossroads: Gettysburg Day 1
description:
Gettysburg: The Bloody Crossroads is the first title in Academy Games' "Fight for the Colours" trilogy of battles, each focusing on a separate day or area of the Battle of Gettysburg during the American Civil War.

The rules will be a cross between the Johnny Reb miniatures ruleset and the game system introduced in Conflict of Heroes by Academy Games. The brigade-level game system relies on unit counters, action cards, and a hex-based map Players can substitute miniatures for the game counters if desired.


Full map of Gettysburg

Bloody Crossroads is a detailed simulation of day one of the Battle of Gettysburg, with twenty scenarios that include fast-playing smaller engagements up to the full northern half of the battle including Culps Hill, the town of Gettysburg, Evergreen Cemetary, Seminary Ridge and more.

Follow on games in the series will include Union in the Balance and High Tide, each focusing on separate areas of the battle including the Round Tops and adjacent areas that could have been used for flanking attacks and calvary fights that might have changed the history of the battle and the war.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Pancakes
description:
(From the back of the box):

Pancakes is a simple and easy game to play. Build stacks of pancakes, add butter to increase the value of the stack, then top it off with syrup before someone else to score the stack!

The game takes minutes to learn and is simple enough to be enjoyed by the whole family!

name: Tego Card Game
description:
Tego is a fast paced bidding and strategy game where a player competes with others
in hiring 12 best characters with a limited amount of money and time they have.

The game play is approximatelt 30 mins, with 2-3 mins setup, and suitable for 2-6 players and for
ages 8 and above.

Players will become Tego, a Human Resource Manager for Pablo the billionaire. Pablo has entrusted Tego to form
a Management Team that will run his new company, Pablo Chocos. With $50,000, players' task is to headhunt and
hire 12 best characters within 10 working days (10 rounds). The player who emerges with the group of best
characters and meets most of Pablo's criteria shall be the winner.

Out of these winners, only a few will be The Ultimate Headhunter. These are those who can score the maximum
110 points. So not all winners will become The Ultimate Headhunter, only the few great ones will.

The game play involves players bidding for these characters. One character will be bid at a time. The highest bidder gets the character. Players can also negotiate and trade during the game. The challenge is how one needs to achieve the target of the game without running out of money and also not to undervalue them until you lose
the bid. Thus one needs to bid wisely, value the characters at the right place and to get them at the right
time.

The Card Game comes with a package of 200 playing cards, 2 sets of 48 characters, and a fully coloured game
manual.

Tego has also been designed for tournaments and competitions.

name: Ultimate Movie Quiz
description:
Ultimate Movie Quiz contains everything necessary to run a movie quiz game show. With 50 question cards containing 1900 questions and answers, answer sheets, and an audio CD, two or more players can test their film knowledge in 10 categories.

From the box:

Even better than a night at the Oscars, this ultimate quiz night will put any movie buff to the test!

How much do you really know about the movies? Find out with 10 categories titled: Hollywood Blockbusters, Movie History, Thriller and Horror Movies, Oscar Winners, Science Fiction Movies, Actors and Actresses, Directors, Movie Charades, Cult Movies, Movie Soundtracks and Famous Lines (on audio CD).
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Thomas & Friends: Birthday Surprise Game
description:
Join Thomas the Train in your own adventures with this Birthday Surprise Game. This colofrul game helps little engineers build memory and matching skills and no reading is required. Perfect for game night or parties with friends!

Preschoolers travel around Sodor by train trying to match party favors found along the route. Race to see who can make the most matches!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing, Trains

name: First Around The World
description:
The trivia game that sends you on a race across the continents.

The winner is the first player to visit six Destinations, one on each continent.

Discover the world in a game like never before! From London to New York, or Sydney to Paris via Cape Town. Travel the world like never before!

The perfect blend of knowledge, trivia, luck and bluffing.
First Around the World is great for enhancing your knowledge of people and places, culture and nature, politics and sport, and more!

But look out: a bad roll of the dice, or an unforeseen event can really thwart your travel plans.

And finally, your ingenuity comes into play: clever tactics can sometimes be more successful than mere knowledge.

Plan your route
Test your trivia
Try your luck!
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Reader's Digest, Readers Digest (Australia) Pty Ltd, Schmidt Spiele

name: Het Grote Ome Henk Spel
description:
Based on the Dutch CD's with stories and song by Frank v/d Plas. Ome Henk (Uncle Henk) is a asocial person who has an rather adventurous live and gets in all kinds of trouble. The most famous character from the CD's are depicted on the game board.
This game is a boardgame in which the players need to lose all their money, while the board & cards make them do all kinds of
crazy stuff.

Each player starts the game with a 1000,- Flappen.
On a player's turn they throw 2 dice, move their marker & follow the instructions on the board. The cards give players tasks which can be as simple as loosing money, to actually doing thing like imitating a rock.

First player to loose all his or her money, wins the game.

name: Party on the beach
description: Travel edition of the game Party & Co with 45 cards and 225 questions and tasks. In teams you answer questions and tasks in 5 categories: charades, drawing, trivia, lip reading and word guessing.

name: Redakai: Metacharged
description:
The MetaCharged expansion will add a whole new element to Redakai game play by making monsters more powerful and aggressive.

The new release includes 75 new monsters and attacks for the world’s only Blast 3-D TCG. The expansion adds considerably to gameplay with new "Metacharge" attacks that enables players to get the most out their monsters by making them more powerful and aggressive than ever.
Metacharged Power Packs will contain 11 cards (with one rare or super rare), while Metacharged Gold Packs include 6 cards (with one rare or super rare and one hobby-exclusive Gold Pack rare).
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: HOOLIHAN the game of Rodeo
description:
Hoolihan is a game of luck, skill and chance. It was copyrighted in 1973 by Sam Reeves.

It captures all of the realism of the RODEO circuit because you choose your own events, pay entry fees, have small setbacks and win prize money just like the cowboys on the Rodeo circuit. Events include Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Calf Roping, Steer Wrestling , Team Roping and Bull Riding.

There are 5 rodeos that you enter all across the Southwest with the object of being the largest winner of cash at the end of the rodeo season.

Scoring of events is that are timed events is dependent of the spin of a spinner. Some events are judged events and you win by picking a correct card

name: ASL Comp: Facing the Blitz
description:
From the publisher's catalogue:

VROENHOVEN, BELGIUM, 11 May 1940: By mid-afternoon of 10 May, infantry elements of the 4th Panzer Division took over the bridgehead at Vroenhoven, relieving the exhausted paratroopers. During the evening, the infantry pushed west to free the main road and north to join with the Velwezelt bridgehead. Two platoons of the 2nd Company were all that remained of the Belgian troops near the Vroenhoven Bridge. On the morning of the 11th, the Germans started to attack towards the south to completely secure the bridge area. As the lead panzer elements were crossing the bridge, three Fairey Battle aircraft of the Belgian 5Ëme Escadrille appeared over the Albert Canal and began a bombing run against the bridge. Because their initial mission was to bomb wooden footbridges, the planes were loaded with puny 50kg bombs instead of the more potent 250kg bombs normally available. Lead by Captain Glorie, the three Battles made a first bombing run though withering anti-aircraft fire. Due to either the wounding of the observer or a malfunction of the bomb release system, Battle number T-70 of Captain Glorie, followed by the T-63 of Adjudant Delvigne, turned about and made a second run. Both were shot down after hitting the bridge. Une vaine mission de sacrifice!

Welcome to FACING THE BLITZ, an updated edition of the Albert Canal map and scenarios that were included in CH 7/1. A second edition map was printed after the initial print run was sold out and is included with this version. No worries, if you already own the map, a 'no map' edition is also being made available so you can get the new counters and updated scenarios and save some cash.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Egg Race
description:
Flinke Flieger is a racing game played in rounds between two teams (or two players). Each round, two players (one from each team) race each other, trying to deliver an egg to their team's nest.

To set up the round, each player receives a seagull on a stick, which he has to hold by the stick during the race. The seagulls have a backpack, in which a flat paper egg is placed. Now, a spinner is spun, determining the special conditions for this round: it may be a straightforward race, or there may be special conditions, such as the players being required to run backwards or to spin twice before delivering the egg.

If a player drops his egg, he is out of the race for that round. If both players succesfully deliver their eggs, the fastest player's team receives an additional egg.

The game continues until fewer than three undelivered eggs remain at the beginning of a round. Now, players inspect their eggs by flipping them over to see which ones "hatch". (Those that hatch have a chick painted on the back.) The team with the most chicks wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Racing

name: Kuck Ruck Zuck!
description:
The animals at the zoo are tired of constantly having to pose for photographs again and again, so they decide to steal a camera and take pictures of themselves to make the process more fun. Can you tell who has the camera?

In Kuck Ruck Zuck! you can't see which animals holds the camera – but you do have the snapshots as evidence of where the camera was, and by looking at the pictures you can tell which animals took which shot. But can you figure out which critter took which pic before anyone else?
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction

name: GitterrÃ¤tsel! German-English Expansion Set
description:
The Gitterrätsel! German-English Expansion Set is an expansion for GitterrÃ¤tsel!.

English words and their translations in German letters are hidden forward and backward, horizontally and vertically, and diagonally in a tangle of letters. The object is to find the solution to the puzzle in the grid. This game can be used to help teach children the vocabulary of a subject area and the spelling of foreign words. 20 theme cards are included in the set.

The game play of grid puzzle is also extension of the English once the same: The whole family gathered around the board and goes on a word hunt. By rotating the game board is always a word of the topic map in an open field of the visible edge of the board. The goal is to mark the found words quickly. But beware, if an opponent crosses out a pre-selected word, then is is lost to him.

This expansion set also includes a German-English puzzle grid or a new way of playing: advanced native speakers start looking for the translation of the word shown - German to English and vice versa.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Monopoly: France
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Italy (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: Fan-made Italy map for Ticket to Ride.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Minchiate
description:
Minchiate is a card game from Italy with 97 cards, most likely invented in the 15th century in Florence, though its exact date is unknown. The earliest mention known dates from 1466. The cards were largely based on Tarot, at the time known as Tarocchi in Italy, by expanding the trump suit to 40 trumps. It was also known as Germini and Gallerini in other parts of Italy. It was played up until the 1930s.

Over time, numerous of games played with the very same deck were known as Minchiate, some including partnership and some not, and also differing in numbers of players.
Minchiate games are all trick taking games of the Tarot family, although they introduce a few features that are unique and exclusive to Minchiate. Among these are scoring points for certain combinations of cards won in tricks, named 'versicole', and a different distribution of point values for the cards.

There were also a few gambling games played with the Minchiate deck not from the tarot family of card games, among them 'Al Palio' and 'A sei tocchi'.
publishers: (Unknown), DiputaciÃ³n Foral de Ãlava -D.F.A., Il Meneghello, Lo Scarabeo

name: Futebox
description:
Simple rules, great ambiance (soccer), beautiful box: this is Futebox. It is an intuitive game where children learn the rules quickly and can create new rules and possibilities, from the original.
First, each player positions the numbered tokens (1 to 6). In your turn you roll the die; only the token with the same number can be moved. When a token pass the goal line, the player scores.

name: Ad-Man! A Game of Advertising Mascots
description:
Ad-Man! is a card game about advertising mascots. Playing the role of an advertising executive, players use original mascots to win product accounts to sell things like soda pop, baseball teams, and fabric detergent. The winner of the game has collected the most products. Different mascot types (like a dog, a cowboy, or silverware) are not restricted to selling just one thing. A snowman, for example, has been used to sell apples, dishwashing soap flakes, and the city of North Saint Paul, Minnesota.

The game consists of 60 core mascot cards, 20 expansion mascot cards, 31 product cards, 8 trump cards, rules, and 4 blank cards.

(The following is an abbreviated rules set. The full set of rules can be found on my website)
Product cards have a symbol, and only mascots with that same symbol are of use in winning the account for that product. Mascot cards have three symbols, each with a numerical value. Players take turns playing mascots with the appropriate symbol, vying to have the highest accumulated number value.

If a player has put any card into play during the round, at the conclusion they draw 1 fresh Mascot card. Players have the option to pass play at the beginning of a round, and may draw 2 Mascot cards

More information can be found at www.steverobbinsgames.com

name: Wogan's Perfect Recall: The Ultimate Memory Game
description:
FROM THE BOX:

The questions change but the answer stay the same!

Pit your memory against your friends and then the clock
as you battle to become the champion!

Round by round, answer a variety of general knowledge
questions and 'recall' the 20 answers locked in the
answer bank to win points and become the ultimate
master of memory!

This is not just a test of memory, it's a test of nerves!


Can You recall the answers?



Recall the answers...grab the points!



One by One the answers are revealed...



Go against the clock to be the master of memory!


Based on the short-lived 2008-2010 Channel 4 game show of the same name.

name: "A Matter of Honor, Sire"
description:
"A Matter of Honor, Sire" is the fourteenth game in the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS, Inc.

This battlefield was one of the missed opportunities for the Coalition. Bernadotte's subordinates challenged his honor in getting him to the battlefield, arriving late and in the wrong place.

"A Matter of Honor, Sire" is a mini-game, postcard sized. Rules at the back, map front and 17 double sided counters along the sides.
The game is a hex and counter game where troops are activated though a standard deck of cards: black activates French units, red Coalition. How many and all is determined by the specific card.

Combat is resolved by comparing combat strengths of the units and drawing cards from that same deck. Whenever a joker is drawn, the turn is over, the deck is reshuffled and a new turn begins.

The Coalition player wins if they are the last to control the Leipzeg hex, otherwise the French win.

This game is part of a series of postcard games about the battle of Leipzig, which can be played individually or combined into a single game called A Bridge Too Few (for this you will need an article published in the 2013 Against The Odds Annual):
13) Marschall VorwÃ¤rts!
14) "A Matter of Honor, Sire"
15) The Nations Assemble
16) Trapping the Ogre

name: Pioneer City
description:
In Pioneer City, players become pioneers in wild west. First you start with your little wagon and try to be the first to arrive to the best land spots, there are six different choices of those. After that you go round the board and try to grab goods, crops, fish and so on (and later sell those). Game is divided to twelve months for five years (1858-1862), so you get to move 60 times during game.

During game you draw cards which affect the prices for different goods, moves indians, starts auctions or sends you to jail.
Sometimes you get to go to the saloon, for a little gambling. Or you can go hunting or fishing, but then you have a risk to encounter indians.

Goal in the game is to collect as much money as possible, you get income from forests, fields, fish, gold etc. etc. Pioneer City is an old-fashioned game, which has clearly taken influence from Monopoly. But still there are couple of quite modern mechanics involved, little bit of choices and a little hint of theme.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hedbanz Charades
description: Guess the card on your headband by looking at your co-players acting out the activity shown on it and earn a token. The player or team that ends up with the most tokens is the winner.

name: Zing! Pow!!!!
description:
In a city overrun by ninjas, mimes, and other villains, you and your fellow heroes have a bet to see who's the best:

Capture villains and put them in your pile for points. The hero with the most points wins. Sounds simple, right? Yeah right, keep dreaming!

None of you are the most honest of heroes. Steal and discard villains from your friends' piles, or even reverse the rules, in this fast and unpredictable game that keeps everyone scrambling to stay in the lead!

name: Incredible Expeditions: Lovecraftian Mini-Expansion
description:
This set of 17 additional cards for Incredible Expeditions: Quest for Atlantis includes even more content inspired by the writings of H.P. Lovecraft. Add to the base game to bring more madness, Curses and Supernatural influence to Quest for Atlantis.

Take charge of your expedition as the academic-turned-cultist Dr. Psyrri. Enchant your Crew with the haunting violin song of the Musician. Face off against Shoggoths and Deep Ones in your quest to discover the secrets of R'lyeh.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Sovereignty of Dust
description:
"We used to have a civilization. A future. All we have now is Dust."

Sovereignty of Dust is a post apocalyptic strategy card/dice game for 2-5 players.

Featuring a sandbox day/night system and both free-for-all and team based play, players take on the role of one of five factions vying for control of the ruins of a once-great metropolis now known only as "Dust."

Capture your enemies, meet trade caravans and vicious gun runners, collect useful items and resources in the wasteland, gather intel on your opponents and undertake missions to carve your place in a crumbling world.

Players begin by selecting their faction:

"The Staten Island Resistance" - A ragtag group of soldiers fighting for what's left of humanity.
"Brothers of Dust" - Though most would view them as a fanatical cult, the Brothers of Dust see themselves as the only light left in the world.
"Long Island Greasers" - Bikers influenced by the mentality of mid-20th century anarchist punk rockers. Their only goal is to reduce the city to smoldering ash.
"Pax Americana" - The scientists and intellects who survived the fall of the civilization. They consider themselves true patriots, fighting for the American way.
"The Ward" - Beneath the ruins of Dust, an army of monstrous human experiments is growing by the day, led by a crazed asylum doctor.


Each faction has a preconstructed deck of cards, and a unique ability.
At the beginning of each turn, players will discard any cards they have in play and draw three new character cards to the field of play. One action may be taken per turn by each of these characters. Actions include:

Combat against another player's character or a city landmark.
Scouting the wastelands for supplies, or undertaking a mission on behalf of their faction.


Victory points are awarded for capturing enemy units, conquering landmarks, and completing missions in the wasteland. Once the day/night deck has been depleted - the player with the most victory points wins the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Life Manager
description:
Let the business guru in you run wild as you juggle career, relations, investments, and your private life. Life Manager gives you the opportunity to shape the game, devise a strategy, and make personal choices, while battling it out for happiness points. Have you got what it takes to manage like a pro?

The main goal in Life Manager is to have the highest number of happiness points at game's end. While playing, you first reflect on your personal priorities, then later take care of selected domains: career, relations, private life & finances.

This is a business-strategy board game designed for 2-8 players at the age of 10+.

Producer: Granna
Rules available upon the e-mail request
Full Game available in French, English, German & Polish

•••

Entdecken Sie den Business-Guru in sich, indem Sie im Kampf um Glückspunkte geschickt alles unter einen Hut bringen: Ihre Karriere, Ihre Beziehungen, Ihre Investitionen und Ihr Privatleben. Das Spiel "Life Manager" gibt Ihnen die einzigartige Möglichkeit, die Reise ihres Lebens selbst zu gestalten, ihre eigenen Strategien zu entwickeln und persönliche Entscheidungen zu treffen.
Haben Sie alle dafür notwendigen Profi-Qualitäten?

•••

Laissez le gourou du business qui est en vous agir en liberté en jonglant entre carrière, relations, investissements et vie privée. “Life Manger” vous donne l’opportunité de façonner le jeu, d’échafauder une stratégie et de faire des choix personnels tout en vous battant pour des points de bonheur.

Avez vous ce qui qu’il faut pour manager comme un pro ?

Jeu de stratégie dans le monde du business prévu pour 2 à 8 joueurs de 10 ans et plus.
mechanics: Acting, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Moral Dilemma: Option C expansion
description:
An extra deck of cards to spice up your game.
In each round you flip over the Option C card after reading A and B. Option C is random and may give it all an extra twist.

No extra rules needed.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Castles and Keeps
description:
Castles and Keeps is a 2 player head to head card laying game using a deck of only 9 cards.

On each card there are four castles which contain a different combination of player shields.

Players take turns to place a card matching the castle type and at the same time trying to cover their opponents shields with their own.

Once all cards have been placed, players with three or more castles connected by a road score one point for each.

As soon as a player gets to 30 points they are crowned the champion.

Castles and Keeps is a free print and play game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Lords of the Sands
description:
This expansion provides alternate rules for Lords of the Sand, one that players will likely find quicker and more dynamic than the original version.
It includes new God cards, and introduces stone markers.

A small rule change to Crimson Sun is also included.

name: Yes or Know
description:
The game is a quiz Show and the quizmaster is a Smartphone and all the players compete in a quizbattle.

It's a game out of the Ravenburger smartplay series.

name: Touchstone
description:
Roll the dice!
Without looking at the bag in hand, touch only 5 runes!
Take out quickly the runes!
Throw in the center of the box furnace first!
The board game Touchstone uses touch and agility!

The one who is the first to throw the rune into the hole in the middle is the winner of the round and scores.

name: æªçã«ãã³ã»ã­ã£ãã (Lupin Cat)
description: In æªçã«ãã³ã»ã­ã£ãã (Lupin Cat), players represent a dog detective team that's trying to track down everyone's favorite food, but hiding amongst them is Lupin Cat, whose only goal is to escape with their favorite food...

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â Emergency Force Field Resource
description:
The Emergency Force Field Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "Year of Hell" episode Organized Play Event.

When using the resource, each time a ship in your fleet defends, during the compare results step, you may
1) Disable 1 of that ship's active shields to cancel 1 of the attacking ship's normal hit results.

OR

2) Disable 2 of that ship's active shields to cancel 1 of the attacking ship's critical hit results.

If a ship uses either ability, place an Auxiliary Power Token beside that ship.

The cost of this resource is a number of SP equal to the total combined starting shield values of all ships in your fleet divided by 2 (rounded up).
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Marvel Avengers Assemble: Slide Strike Battle Game
description:
From Back of the Box:

"Go head-to-head in an exciting game of concealed identities and cunning strategy! Slide your team across the battlefield for a surprise attack! Reveal which bero or villan you're attacking with... then find out whl they're up against! Every character combo yields different outcome. Out-last your opponent to win!"

6 characters on each side, mirrored team builds. (12 total)
23 Grey Spacer Tiles create a field similar to Think Fun's Rush Hour puzzle game.
This is Stratego with more restrictive/defined movement, and character powers.
1x d6 (3,4,5,6,7,8 faced)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fire Ants!
description:
Game Overview: A small box, a small price ($10), and big fun! Fire Ants! is a card game where you play as an ant and fires are breaking out throughout the ant colony. As a fire ant, you must extinguish those fires by collecting resources from the card deck. The fires can only be extinguished by collecting a certain number of metal cards, a certain number of plastic cards, and a certain number of water cards. You will also find ant magic cards which can be used in place of any resource card that you need. Each fire card that you extinguish is worth a certain value. The higher the point value on the fire cards, the more resources that are needed to extinguish that fire. At the end of the game, if all fires were extinguished then whoever scored the most points from their fire cards win. However, the game can beat you when seven fire cards are played at the same time and no one can put out the fires. When this happens, your entire colony has burnt to the ground.

Box Contents: The game comes in a small box that easily holds the 90 playing cards within it.

Game Play: At the start of the game, each player is dealt three cards and a five point double sided fire card is placed in the middle of the table. This fire will not be extinguished for a few rounds with players drawing a single card. You will need a total of 11 resources (2 metal, 4 plastic, and 5 waters) to capture this card and to put out this fire. While players are drawing cards to get that five point boost to their score, other fire cards may be drawn. When this occurs they are placed down onto the table. There are two five point fire cards, two four point fire cards, three three point fire cards, four two point fire cards, and five one point fire cards. If at any point, seven fire cards are placed onto the table, one of the players must put out a single fire without drawing any additional cards. If no one can, the game is over and the colony has burnt down and everyone loses. If you are able to get through the entire deck, then you know someone will win. You will need to reshuffle the cards and then it is a race to get the remaining cards to determine the overall winner.

--Chad Osborn (thedicehaveit)
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Party Game

name: ZnajZnak: Sport
description:
In 2012 the Institute of National Remembrance published a game called “ZnajZnak”. The game is the history of Poland told with 133 symbols. Playing “ZnajZank” makes it unbelievably easy to remember the most important figures, dates, places and objects in Polish modern history.

ZnajZnak - Sport is an educational game for 2 to 8 players about sport in Poland (1918-1945). The 133 symbols placed on the game cards were carefully selected to show best sportsmen, club badges, world records and many more.

ZnajZnak - Sport includes 63 cards on each of which 12 different symbols have been placed. Every two cards have a common symbol. Your job is to find and name it as fast as you can. If you don’t recognize your symbol flip your card and read the information on the other side. Then place a new card on the back of your deck and go on with the game. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the player on the left. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

name: The King's Armory: Zoe the Ninja
description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Dracucat
description:
Dracucat is a family card game, epic and fun in which every player is an hunter. Catch all vampire cats !

During the night, vampire kittens try to bit you but during the day, you are an hunter and you could buy weapons to kill them.

During the day round, each players takes 3 cards. They could play one card or more during the turn. At the end of the turn, Player can't keep more than 5 cards in his hand.

During the night, each players takes 3 cards minus the number of vampire kitten cards in front of him. Like int the day, player can't keep more than 5 cards in his hand.

The winner is the first player how kill 3 vampires.

At the center of the table, there are the shop. This shop is composed by 10 weapons. Each weapon has a cost. Not always the same at each game.
To buy a weapon, the player must use money card from his hand. The shop is open only during the day.

To kill a vampire, the player must place a coffin in front of him. Place a vampire on the coffin and place weapons necessary during the night.

Only one time during the game, a player could choose a role. This hunter has a power and the player could use this power all the time.

name: Bugs 'n' Slugs
description:
Race to the finish by correctly answering questions about all those creepy crawly little critters! How long can a cockroach live with its head cut off? How many mosquitoes can a dragonfly eat in one day? The questions are multiple choice or true/false, so even if you don't know the answer, you have a chance of getting it right and learn something along the way! Most of the spaces are question spaces, but some spaces challenge players to complete an activity. For instance, without using your hands or feet, wriggle across the floor like a worm, then ask other players to guess what you are" (which may be awkward if adults are playing the game, but kids would probably find it enjoyable!). Fun and educational, you'll gather a wealth of knowledge about bugs and slugs by the time you reach the end!

The objective of the game is to be the first to cross the finish line.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Racing, Trivia

name: quizzone
description:
quizzone is a trivia game containing 3.000 questions in 10 categories (Music, Movies & TV, Language & literature, History and religion, Sport and leisure, Art and culture, The world, Society and business, Out and about, Nature and science.

The board is two sided. On one side all 10 categories are in play and have a predefined color. On the other side you choose 6 categories to play with and define their color by placing a token on colored circles.

It is possible to play as individuals or teams - up to 8 in total.

Each player places their token on one of the squares at the rim of the circular board. There must be at least one free space between players.

When the game starts you get a question in the color that you are standing on - if you answer the question correctly you move one space closer to the centre. If you answer incorrectly nothing happens. The winner is the one that reaches the centre first and answers a question of a self chosen category correctly.
