Each player receives 4 tactics cards at the start of the game and 2 extra every time you land on a shaded square (though only once in a ring of the board). Normally you can only move directly forward towards the centre but the tcatics cards change this. Some cards let you move a player token of your own chosing back or forward or sideways or even diagonally. Other cards let you answer other players cards, force other players to answer yours or let you choose the category of a question disregarding which color you are currently on. Finally there are cards that override other cards.

If you land on a square where another player already is standing he is sent 2 squares further away from the centre.

name: Cheese Dip: The Cheesy, Sneaky Spelling Game
description:
From the publisher's website:

Now children can practice spelling in a fun way with Cheese Dip. Roll the die to see who gets to use their mouse tail to hook the cheesy letters, but be careful not to drop them! It’s a sneaky race to see who will spell their word first! Includes multiple word level difficulties to grow with children!

name: Tous au poulailler
description:
In Tous au Poulailler, players flip face-down tiles to try and gather as many eggs as possible.

On their turn, each player flips one tile. If it shows an egg, the tile remains face-up on the table. If it shows a basket, the player takes all face-up eggs on the table. If it shows a hen, all eggs are discarded. If it shows a broken egg, the player discards one of their eggs.

The game ends when all tiles were flipped. The player with the most eggs wins the game.

Variants (memory and push your luck) allow the game to evolve as the child grows.

name: Fin Finaud voyage
description: A trivia game for the globetrotters ! Like the other games in the Fin Finaud family, you don't have to know the answer but rather guess who's going to be right or wrong. The game consists of 400 question cards related to geography, nearly the half on the countries, their capitals, flags, continent, and the other half on the world in general.

name: Blankr: An Awkwardly Hilarious Card Game For âââââ
description:
From the publisher:

Are you sad? Do you have no friends? Perhaps your partner left you because you have no sense of humour. Maybe no one comes to your parties because, quite frankly, they are incredibly boring. Are you a loner? Are you finding it difficult to impress someone with your pathetic attempt at trying to be funny? Are you relying on the old "knock Knock" jokes. Lord have mercy! Well don't worry boring person... Help is here! BLANKR is an awkwardly hilarious card game that will get the whole party roaring with laughter. When you see people trying to escape through windows to flee boredom, just pull out BLANKR and see those lips smile again. Bringing a new twist to the 'complete the sentence' game, Blankr encourages players to think and write down the most awkward and ridiculously funny sentences. The rules are simple, one player reads out a Blankr sentence containing a blank and the others think of a word or phrase to fill in the blank. At the end of each round all the answers are read out aloud and the funniest answer wins a point (actually lets make that 3,873,093 points). Don't worry if you're low on wit and/or lack a sense of humour as the references cards contain over 330+ weird and wonderful ideas to get your brain juices flowing. See your friends and family curl their toes and chuckle as they read out the answers. Perfect-size travel box to put into your bag or back-pocket. Perfect for girls night, boys night, girls and boys night, university game, ice breakers, drinking game etc.. Get yours now! Get some friends! Everyone is enjoying it, about time you did too. BLANKR: An Awkwardly Hilarious Card Game for âââââ ****************************** A great and hilarious game!!!!! **********************************

name: Room on the Broom: Dragon Chase
description: Room on the Broom: Dragon Chase is a children's game. The players spinn a spinner, and walks around the board in search of the hidden items, and they need to find 4 different spell ingredients. Then a player has find the items they need, they have to go to the centre of the board and shout out the magic spell "Iggety, ziggety, zaggety, zoom!", but they need to watch out for the dragon. The first player to the center, with four items, is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tripol
description:
Description from the publisher:

Tripol is a logic game that combines simple rules, original graphic design, and interesting tactics. Your goal is to score as many points as possible by matching appropriate triangle sides, and the rules include multiple ways to play:

1. Colorful polygon
2. One color only
3. My color
4. Three for a start
5. Experiment (combination of the triangles)
6. Blockade
7. Barricade

name: Galaktisch Taktisch Gut
description:
Aliens are planning to secretly take control of the earth. Humans who get to know about this can try to stop them. The players bet which side is stronger in the end to score points.

In Galaktisch Taktisch Gut, each player holds two cards. One player draws two cards and passes two cards to any other player, who then discards one of these, revealing it only to the player who gave it to them. In addition, the active player can play an action card and execute its special effect.

When the draw pile is used up, each player makes a bet on whether the players hold more alien or more human cards in their hands. All players who guessed correctly, win — unless everyone bets on the aliens, then the player who holds the alien leader wins.

name: Animal Auction
description:
Animal Auction includes 32 cards that show eight different animals, with four cards each.

Initially, the players each receive 10 tokens, with which they can bid for animal cards. The players bid for three cards at a time. If you win an auction, you can distribute the three cards among all players, including yourself, as you see fit.

After the cards have been assigned to the players, all players except the winner share equally the tokens spent for the auction, leaving any remainder to be added to the jackpot of the next auction.

The game ends when there are no more cards in the deck, at which point the winner is determined on the basis of the sets of cards in their possession: a set of four cards with the same animal scores 10 points, a three-card set scores 5 points, a two-card set scores 1 point, and single cards score -3 each.

There are also four special cards: three jokers that can replace any animal, and a minus-joker that subtracts 5 points from the total.

Tokens count 1 point each.
